Review: the last of vampirefilms offers plenty of blood and gore but beyond that nothing jack crow james woods is professional vampire slayer that is secretly working for the vatican his and his mens mission is clean the earth from vampires they have lost count of how many vampires they have slaughtered but one has always escaped them valek thomas ian griffith the dark messias and ruler of the undead that is older than time itself for all eternity the vampires have searched for their salvation the black cross the cross in their possesion the vampires will be able walk in the sunlight after that it is either the humans or the vampires who will dominate the earth have never liked john carpenter and his style after seeing this my opinions have not changed john carpenter remains john carpenter however because of the films selfirony black humour and fascinating cinematography would say that it is his greatest achievement in long long time neither the synopses or carpenters direction are original but there are some things that are interesting the directors negative view on the catholic church for instance at the end of the it becomes clear that cardinal alba maximilian schell has simply used crow and his team find valek so that he would gain eternal life otherwise the catholic priests are shown cool drinking smoking and breaking the rool of celibacy carpenter has created an interesting atmosphere set in new mexican dessert he switches between bright golden sunrises and bloody sundowns symbolically illustrating the good and the evil through light and darkness more than anything in this this simple illustration shows the battle between good and evil the cinematography gary kibbe is probably the films greatest achievement music composed john carpenter himself is at times effective the special effects and makeup are likewise worth notice when it comes the cast in an intellectual like this casting is the last problem everyone can scream and swing the axe but here james woods is suprisingly convincing he is macho and cool as the dedicated hunter who lost his family the breed of evil woods is constantly overacting really saves the from falling into the trap of serious self importance daniel baldwin is also entertaining as crows loyal partner the other cast members are struggling because the does not take itself too seriously it stays afloat still it is like most vampirefilms mediocre experience

i am not sure who the genius is who came up the idea of comparing disturbing behavior scream maybe it is because they are both horror films kinda both have hot young stars both have an annoying alternative soundtrack and both are aimed at the teenage crowd guess includes me but this is not the next in line the scream flicks as well as the know what you did last summer soon be flicks it owes less halloween and more kafka and orwell in my book makes for more interesting feature and it should have been this is basically rehash of the stepford wives the great never saw starring katherine ross and dealing as have been told bunch of women who are programmed be perfect housewives or something like that behavior starring katie holmes of dawsons creek deals bunch of teenagers deep in angst who are being programmed be perfect teenagers suckups preppies it actually at least me sounds like it would work and scott rosenberg that witty penmen who has written stuff like beautiful girls and things do in denver when you are dead as well as con air it actually sounds like it may be pulled off the right amount of frights and satiric wit alas it is not and it plumets into that little group of movies known as the movies potential that blow it remember called white mans burden dealt reversal of blacks and whites in society that did nothing it is potentially brilliant premise heres another one it could be brilliant satire on how teenagers need go through teen angst in order find themselves it is stage and this does in fact realize that it gets its message across and it does it effortlessly now it just needs work as it does not it is too sloppy and too contrived it paints bleak portrait of high school life then lets it lie it brings us bunch of scary monsters who are all bunch of disgustingly icky kissups who do food drives and hang out at s diner drinking milk shakes then gives it cheap twist when they get horny they become homicidal is not it scary enough that they are like this and cannot the real terror in the town be that you could be next be just like them not that you could be next die the introduces us two three different characters who in the beginning are considered outsiders because they are not yet part of this clique the new kid steve james marsden dull dull dull dull who is having trouble at home because he has not gotten over his brothers ethan embry in quick flashes so you do not recognize him did suicide the renegade girl rachel katie holmes from dawsons creek who is chief personality trait is her prominent nose ring and far the most interesting kid gavin nick stahl the kid from the man without face who is the most interesting because he is the only character who is given some dimension in the films best scene he introduces steve every single clique nailing each ones fetishes and hangups and it is the best scene in the movie because it is witty satirical and interesting something the rest of this is not gavin suspects there is something awry the preppie kids known as the blue ribbons and in the tradition of all conspirators and even when he actually shows hard pure evidence steve he is only treated as typical raving conspiracy buff here we have another case of the idiot plot where not only could steve had done something about gavin and what happens him but he may have saved this from being the dreary dull that it is without gavin who gives it life and humor the only other halfinteresting character is the school janitor played william sadler as retarded scary guy who may not be what he seems be but really we do not care anyway probably should not mention that this was directed david nutter who is works for the xfiles because that would probably tarnish his reputation like the show he is good at setting up weird conspiracies and creating general creepy feel most of this is shot at night and dark eerie shadows for the maximum creepy effect and some of it works but what this is not so good at is coming out good payoff he keeps too much inside so much that when the characters journey mental institution in the third act you wonder why they just do not get the hell out of there think what happens gavin is proof enough that there is something rotten in the state of teen angstdom what this needs be is lot longer lot more colorful and lot creepier if the best villain they can come up is guidance counselor played bruce greenwood an atom egoyan regular obviously just trying pay the rent who still thinks he can get away it even when most is revealed then they need come up tougher smarter villain if he is so villainous then why could two dense teenagers who could not figure out there was something going on until it was way too late find information on him in couple minutes the runs about or so minutes just needs work on these things and become lot less sloppy at such short running time and such lame boring characters as these it is pretty much obvious that leaving this leaves horribly unsatisfied taste in ones mouth especially mine

in the interest of being generous want start this review the scene that liked in meet joe black sir anthony hopkins playing superrich media mogul has gathered his family around him for dinner his oldest daughter played marcia gay harden from millers crossing who has been obsessively planning his sinfully extravagant birthday party presents him three superbly decorated little cakes are supposed be scale models for his big birthday cake the daughter asks hopkins pick the one he likes hopkins frustrated the weight of planning for the whole elaborate affair does what any man in his position would do he punts whichever one you like dear he says and the daughter does exactly what any woman in her position would do she cries liked that scene for two reasons first the cakes looked really cool second it was perhaps the only scene in the movie where people acted as you would expect people act meet joe black is chockfull of odd performances people doing things for no discernible reason at all and doing them in slow motion over the course of three hours boot it is easy watch meet joe black for the abundant eye candy of the palatial homes and the beauteous claire forlani but it is even easier sleep right through it two people on my row managed it quite nicely the difficult part of the movie is understanding the characters and their motivations and why someone thought three hours was an appropriate length for this overwrought mess know my audience had problems the movie because they thought it was comedy case in point everyone should know now that brad pitt plays the angel of death in this movie however the first we see of him is as young lawyer in coffee shop hitting on the glamorous claire forlani it is not clear from the movie whether you need law degree become the angel of death but it makes certain kind of sense it should not take long for the observant moviegoer realize that bad things are about happen mr pitt and indeed they do after hideously prolonged sequence where pitt looks over his shoulder at the retreating forlani and forlani looks over her shoulder at the retreating pitt because pitt walks into the road without looking and suddenly gets squished well when that happened the audience howled laughter and continued laugh at every comment that was remotely humorous so if you think that sudden violent death and sarcastic drawingroom humor are funny encourage you go see meet joe black immediately anyway the deceased lawyers body no worse the wear from its massive injuries is possessed the angel of death and brad pitt takes over that role the idea is that death given the pen name of joe black so as not disturb others wants take holiday and experience the world if this were not we might get an interesting metaphysical discussion of life and death but since it is we get scene after scene of fishoutofwater humor just as if death is george of the jungle or crocodile dundee or some other poor schmuck who is wandered in from the jungle or the outback or whatever and does not know how act in our society it also does not help that the character of death is written so inconsistently he claims be on vacation but he never does anything except hang around the seriously attractive claire forlani just try get your travel agent book that one he speaks very slow and halting english but perfectly fluent jamaican patois he knows everything about some characters nothing about others and as played brad pitt he is not especially menacing or charming or glamorous or intriguing he is just there it is as if someone told pitt never mind about acting in this picture son just stand there and look pretty it is as if pitt is doing his keanu reeves impression throughout the movie have used the phrase angel of death in this review very deliberately contrast pitts performance this years best angel performance nicolas cages in city of angels where pitt is cold and unfeeling cage is as warm and empathetic as the situation allows where cage is genuinely curious about the nature of man pitt is aloof and arrogant cage struck instant chemical sparks costar meg ryan where the chemistry between pitt and forlani is only understandable if you accept the notion that forlanis character is so shallow that she cannot see beyond pitts good looks the movies other top name is much better actor but that does not save meet joe black sir anthony hopkins is not given much better material work unfortunately he plays one of these goodhearted multimillionaire media moguls that only exist in one wonders what might have happened if they had made hopkinss character more realistically evil hopkins is marked for death due bad ticker but death steps in and grants him some extra time in exchange for being his guide in the world of course no one can be sure of how they will act when death taps on their shoulder but have wonder and in this movie you have very long time wonder how you or would act in similar situation especially if you or were multimillionaire hopkins pretty much goes the office and the major subplot revolves around who will control the corporation fans of corporate intrigue will be fascinated am sure stayed awake all the way through meet joe black and am asking myself why movies about death should encourage you live life the fullest is what am going do now go spend time your family go volunteer for local charity heck go take nap do not go see meet joe black because all it will do is move you three long hours closer death curtis edmonds no children have ever meddled the republican party and lived tell about it sideshow bob

a cop troubled personal life ruthless villain friend of the cop _dead_ friend of the cop quest for vengeance new partner romantic interest chase scene chase scene _in san francisco_ woman in peril confrontation an explosion the end yawn yawn yawn the preceding has been the plot of approximately twelve thousand and six action films this one just happens be called metro have learned expect little from films like metro and consequently am bored them more often than am genuinely disappointed eddie murphy on board however you hope for something extra some kind of spark when makes watching eddie murphy tedious experience you know it is doing something terribly wrong murphy stars as scott roper hostage negotiator for the san francisco police department who is exceedingly good at his job his personal life he is considerably less successful facing an unhappy exgirlfriend named veronica carmen ejogo gambling problem and mountain of debt then his professional life gets jolt as well when friend and colleague art evans is murdered while investigating suspected jewel thief michael korda michael wincott finding korda becomes very personal scott and he joins new partner kevin mccall michael rappaport foil korda during an attempted heist but all is not well even korda in jail as scott veronica and kevin all continue face lifethreatening danger metro the title in case you are wondering means absolutely nothing is so badly put together that even the most casual viewer may notice the miserable pacing and stray plot threads in the first place kordas rage over being discovered before he can make his big score is rendered completely pointless when he proceeds hit the target anyway and incidentally screw it up reference payoffs in the police department followed conspicuous decision keep scott off the korda case and couple of pointed glances is dropped abruptly no resolution after about fortyfive minutes even the relationship between scott and new partner kevin is so perfunctory kevin disappearing entirely after taking bullet for scott that you may yearn for bickering buddies worst of all is plot structure places the main villain the always menacing michael wincott behind bars for far too long leaving lot of time kill the tedious reconciliation of scott and veronica you cannot blame murphy for being unable muster any enthusiasm for the scenes his bland leading lady but he should have known better than take this role at all scott roper exists in an uncomfortable middle ground between the kind of streetwise fasttalker murphy has built career on and an actual threedimensional character and murphy is never able reconcile the two the script seems have been doctored for him gambling problem turned into bit of character color and his supposed inability form relationships turned into cause for gags rather than actual conflict yet there is still too little comedy for murphy work for much of the he walks around an intense frown and it is over minutes into metro before you hear that trademark laugh for the first time murphy is stranded too few solid punch lines and nearly all of the ones he does have bounce of ejogo and fall the ground limply suppose should give director thomas carter credit for taking the obligatory san francisco car chase how much do you want bet on the likelihood of seeing car soar over hill and doing few interesting things it as vehicles are sent flying and passengers sent sprawling runaway cable car it is possible at least for moment take some pleasure in goofy spin on familiar situation carter does an even better job taking that old suspense standby the medicine cabinet mirror will close reveal killer standing behind someone and using it defuse tension not once but _twice_ the fact that carter was able demonstrate even that much recognition of cliches and willingness subvert them makes his involvement in the rest of the disaster that is metro all the more puzzling an action like this plods so relentlessly and obviously from point point point that you might find yourself shouting out point while they are still getting point or getting up the rest of the audience after the big explosion signals that nothing else of any consequence is going happen

can horror movie truly be called horror movie if it has no scares suspense or even eerie elements think not but that is what children of the corn issacs return wants us believe the sixth installment in the horrible worn out series is far the worst date unlike the other five chapters children of the corn is confusing brainless thriller that takes the psychological horror route rather than slasher horror but either way none of these movies are the least bit scary the follows hannah natalie ramsey teen looking for her mother in gatlin nebraska on the eve of her st birthday what starts out as daughter in desperate search of her long lost mother turns into the story of hannah being the first daughter of the children of the corn who roam the cornfields looking for adults murder that is about all that is understandable in the as after we learn this much issac john franklin who led the children of the corn in previous chapter now an older strange man is looking for hannah fulfill his prophecy and this is supposed make sense really from the start the is unclear of where its going not developing any characters or throwing any concrete plot details across the table constantly introducing new characters without personalities or the slightest hint of an individuality and sub plots that have nothing do what seems the main focus of the the runs at short minutes but it seems be more in the vicinity of two hours as the bleak slow pacing makes children of the corn issacs return excruciatingly boring plot holes are everywhere in tim sulka and john franklins unbelievably horrible script as nothing is accomplished or clear when the reaches its conclusion everyone and everything involved children of the corn issacs return namely writers john franklin and tim sulka along director kari skogland should crawl under rock and hope no one sees their horrible work of trash the bottom line horrible horrible horrible another attempt revive this worn out genre falls flat and what is that title the devil has nothing do whatsoever this let us pray that this is the finale in one of the worst current series one of the worst horror films in years

arnold schwarzenegger has been an icon for action enthusiasts since the late but lately his films have been very sloppy and the oneliners are getting worse it is hard seeing arnold as mr freeze in batman and robin especially when he says tons of ice jokes but hey he got million what is it matter him once again arnold has signed do another expensive blockbuster that cannot compare the likes of the terminator series true lies and even eraser in this so called dark thriller the devil gabriel byrne has come upon earth impregnate woman robin tunney happens every years and basically destroy the world but apparently god has chosen one man and that one man is jericho cane arnold himself the help of trusty sidekick kevin pollack they will stop at nothing let the devil take over the world parts of this are actually so absurd that they would fit right in dogma yes the is that weak but it is better than the other blockbuster right now sleepy hollow but it makes the world is not enough look like star anyway this definitely does not seem like an arnold movie it just was not the type of you can see him doing sure he gave us few chuckles his well known oneliners but he seemed confused as where his character and the was going it is understandable especially when the ending had be changed according some sources aside form that he still walked through it much like he has in the past few films am sorry say this arnold but maybe these are the end of your action days speaking of action where was it in this there was hardly any explosions or fights the devil made few places explode but arnold was not kicking some devil butt the ending was changed make it more spiritual undoubtedly ruined the was at least hoping for cool ending if nothing else occurred but once again was let down also do not know why the took so long and cost so much there was really no super affects at all unless you consider an invisible devil who was in it for minutes tops worth the overpriced budget the budget should have gone into better script where at least audiences could be somewhat entertained instead of facing boredom it is pitiful see how scripts like these get bought and made into movie do they even read these things anymore it sure does not seem like it thankfully gabriels performance gave some light this poor when he walks down the street searching for robin tunney you cannot help but feel that he looked like devil the guy is creepy looking anyway when it is all over you are just glad it is the end of the movie do not bother see this if you are expecting solid action flick because it is neither solid nor does it have action it is just another movie that we are suckered in seeing due strategic marketing campaign save your money and see the world is not enough for an entertaining experience

i still cannot figure out why people went in droves see this movie now before you go assuming am some sort of high brow snob who cannot appreciate little dumb humor let me say that love cheap humor thought there is something about mary was one of the funniest films that have ever seen and it was certainly one of the best films of low brow adolescent humor can be lot of fun the problem the waterboy is that it is just low brow and adolescent there is no humor component wanted like the waterboy really did think only laughed maybe or times throughout the entire movie actually smiled couple of more times on top of that not great record for minute the problem the waterboy is the same as most other adam sandler movies those responsible for this mess seem think that the sheer fact that sandler walks around using goofy voice and playing dumb the entire movie is substitute for actual funny material nothing could be further from the truth as matter of fact sandlers idiot voice started get on my nerves at points in this it is really shame too because this had the potential be very funny personally believe that sandler is probably very talented comedian it is just that so far he has not been able find the right showcase his talents if his only talent is making goofy voices and playing morons my guess is that his career in the movies will go down the same road as the vast majority of the former stars of saturday night live most of whom are now happily no longer in the entertainment industry sandler plays yearold somewhat mentally challenged waterboy for college football team the teams somewhat mentally disturbed coach henry winkler realizes that his waterboy has great deal of pentup rage if harnessed properly would make him force be reckoned on the football field you can figure out the rest from here sandler joins the team and this once lowly waterboy becomes football star as said the had great deal of potential the idea was decent one but the main potential of this movie is result of the cast all of whom are very good just hamstrung really really lousy material even sandler annoying goofy voice and all has enough charisma and natural comedic ability overcome some of his bad material even as unfunny as his character is still found myself rooting for him throughout the but it is the supporting cast that feel most badly about if their material had been just bit better this could have been such funny movie fairuza balk plays sandlers leatherwearing bikerchick love interest and does great job playing sleazy and sexy at the same time winkler is great as the coach who uses coaching for dummies style book help him get through games the real standout though is kathy bates even some of the worst material of her career deal she is still treat watch in her role as sandlers overprotective and overbearing mama even the performances of bates and winkler there is absolutely no way would recommend this movie although get the distinct impression that without them this would have ranked in negative numbers for me is sad because cannot really put my finger on particular element of the movie and single it out as the cause of the disaster that it became it is obvious that those involved specifically the actors tried very hard make what they thought was going be funny movie it is just too bad that percent of all of the jokes fell flat

gordie boggs arquette aptly cast as moron as he is one and his best friend sean dawkins scott caan the son of james caan should not be reduced garbage like this are two losers from wyoming no jobs and no girlfriends who look up world championship wrestling champion jimmy king terribly casted oliver platt as he is everything they are not they finally get see him live and he is screwed out of his title the evil ruthless promoter titus sinclair wasted palitaliano in role originally meant for reallife wcw president eric bischoff whose name was written all over the role gordie and sean track down king in atlanta and discover that he is not really the english king the wcw writers created for him but drunken ignorant southerner who is as irritated these two lunkheads as bob newhart was larry darryl and darryl they sneak him back onto wcw tv after sinclair agrees book him in steel cage match in las vegas at wcws next payperview against his rival diamond dallas page if he wins king gets his title and his career back plus one million dollars wcw president eric bischoff knowing his promotion was desperate bad writing and ratings skyrocketing down thanks the far superior world wrestling federation came up the idea for this movie hoping it would save wcw he was then fired and rehired two months ago but the time he would left they had already been contracted do the and bischoff could not play sinclair in itself is for the best as anybody who has seen him on wcw programming knows that bischoff is no actor the characters of gordie and sean show you exactly what eric bischoff thinks of his fans he thinks of them as young dumb pathetic idiots who will believe anything that will be put out in front of them is real that is why he does not take the fans into consideration when he books nitro or payperview have news for you eric no wrestling fan in this day and age is dumb enough believe that professional wrestling is not for show unless they are four years old this is you know not bischoff will try cover up criticism like that saying it is comedy but have no doubt in my mind that if this had been dramatic rockystyle it probably should have been professional wrestling is ridiculed enough as it is why should the first wrestling movie in ten years be comedy gordie and sean would have been portrayed in the same light anybody who has seen the documentary wrestling shadows documenting wwf owner vince mcmahons doublecrossing of bret hart will probably realize via the reviews and previews of ready rumble that it is basically ripoff of that films storyline the poor mans wayne and garth thrown in for comedic affect you can tell titus sinclair is supposed poke fun at vince but any selfrespecting wrestling fan knows that sinclair is more inspired bischoff than vince and that vince did what he had do bret hart all of these aspects of the needless say seriously offended me as wrestling fan another thing found disturbing about the was the romance between gordie and nitro girl sasha the lovely rose mcgowan would not it have been easier bring something new into the relationship rather than revealing she was only working on gordie at sinclairs insistance hate that cliche the world wrestling federation would have made better they are the promotion everyone cares about they are winning the ratings they have better wrestlers and they take their fans into consideration and do not treat fans like morons so vince how about movie

when arrived in paris in june was surprised find france plastered posters twin peaks fire walk me since the movie was not scheduled open in the s until late august happily the filmthe prequel david lynchs cult television serieswas playing in fancy thx theater unfortunately the theater was far more impressive than the movie absolutely stinks much like french lavatory worse actually fire walk me directed lynch will be completely incomprehensible anyone who has not seen the tv series or read laura palmers secret diary for twin peaks junkies like me the movie is only marginally improved the plot is jumbled and illogical not mention excruciatingly sluggish the first minutes have almost nothing do the main story line feature chris isaak and kiefer sutherland as fbi agents investigating murder in portland oregon the movie then stops in philadelphia for nonsensical cameo david bowie and brief appearance kyle maclachlan as dale cooper lynch then drops this plot strand altogether and abruptly shifts the setting twin peaks washingtonone year later ah twin peaks familiar territory you think yourself as angelo badalamentis distinctive musical score chimes in wrong the movie proves that you really cannot go home again or at least lynch cannot only about quarter of the characters from the tv series appear in the movie leland palmer bobby briggs james shelly leo the log lady and few othersmostly in meaningless cameos the rest of the twin peaks cast is nowhere be seen and consequently lynch fails recreate the spirit and flavor of tvs most enigmatic town cast members michael ontkean sherilyn fenn piper laurie and richard beymer are sorely missed not mention lara flynn boyle who has been replaced lackluster moira kelly in the crucial role of donna the movie concentrates solely on laura palmer sheryl lee as she suffers through drug abuse prostitution and incest during her miserable last seven days on earth the night of lauras death is truly terrifying is the films only remotely effective sequence we finally get see exactly what happened laura after she jumped off james motorcycle and ran into the woods at that lonely traffic light in the middle of nowhere her murder unfolds just as agent cooper reconstructed it in the tv series is gratifying for faithful twin peaks viewers but it is an awfully small reward for sitting through painfully awful movie

capsule this superlight situation comedy from sweden tells the story of two close friends romantic problems the script involves formerly taboo subjects like erotic toys and sexual enhancers but otherwise the writing is not lot different from what is shown free on television the characters are paperthin and the interesting ideas purely nonexistent this is decrementlifebyminutes card jalla jalla is basically an exuberant tv situation comedy written instead for the wide screen it tells the story of two park custodians and the problems they are finding on the path true love the is set in sweden where roro and mans fares fares and torkel petersson are custodians at public park roro is from tightly knit lebanese family who control him very closely mans is swede from much more liberal background they spend most of the day in the bushes at their park cleaning up after dogs roro and mans each have girlfriends but each has problem roro nicknamed jalla is having family problems it seems that his family wants arrange marriage between him and nice lebanese woman yasmin laleh pourkarim but he is already in love lisa tuva novotny yasmin likes roro but does not want get married either mans on the other hand has been having problem of sexual impotence the two friends worry about their problems and discuss the problems each other mans thinks the answer his problem is purchase sexual enhancers the one catch is that he is too shy go in and buy them roro and yasmin decide give themselves some time telling the families that they want marry each other but then plan break up before the wedding not too surprisingly neither finds that his idea works out the way he quite expected the plot turns in several places are contrived one knows fairly quickly that if things are going work our happily for everybody certain plot contrivances have happen lebaneseborn josef fares who wrote and directed is perhaps better director than he is writer when things start get slow he just adds throws in another story for example halfway into the mans innocently antagonizes some local toughs and long chase is added the characterization is little better roro than it is mans who does not seem have whole lot more personality beyond fear for losing biological function we do see some of roros family life and his concerns that may be because roros background is lot like that of the director while the story was entertaining did not feel that got anything worthwhile from the it was just way pass about an hour and half in my life one does not have go the movies see entertainment like this rate it on the scale and on the scale

remember tom cruise and brian brown as rival bartenders juggling bottles of booze in cocktail remember how stupid that looked and remember the scantilyclad dancers of flashdance getting doused buckets of water well coyote ugly does those films five better or six better if you count john goodman since here we have piper perado maria bello tyra banks melanie lynskey and izabella miko doing the absolut spinning and jiggling thing while pouring pitchers of perrier all over their seminaked torsos no goodman does not flip jim beams or wear anything particularly risqu in the but he does get up on the bar and start gyrating the rest of them and the central characters love interest played an australian actor named adam garcia proves he can get up on that bar and start shimmying along the rest of them too what seems have started life as victorias secret photo shoot quickly deteriorates into one heck of an embarrassing movie violet perado is south amboy hopeful who tries make it big as songwriter not welder in new jack city as na ve as they come she is fobbed off music producers receptionists the scornful and has her apartment robbed hours after touching down in chinatown and like her mother before her she gets stage fright whenever she tries do the open mike night thing when she sees trio of babealicious barkeeps thumbing through stack of in an allnight diner violet simply has check out this bar they call coyote ugly lil bello the nononsense owner agrees give violet an audition but violet blows it still lil gives violet another chance riot breaks out riots are the order of the day at uglys since the staff are relentless in flaunting their sexual wares flambeeing the bar and soaking the patrons diet spritethis is certifiable behavior in case did not mention it but violet successfully subdues the crowd singing along blondies one way or another on the jukebox she is hired and cured since this little episode gives her the confidence sing in an amateur talent contest where her dad goodman the junk foodeating laundryimpaired toll collector comes see her and is as proud as punch the end

confucius once said governing nation is like cooking small fish do not overdo it his maxim might be easily applied writing comedy script for quantity over quality is one of the worst mistakes an amateur scribe can make granted mike judge writerdirector of the workplace satire office space is not exactly an amateur his most infamous work the mtv series beavis and butthead was pure gold for its network but unfailingly judge manages make some rather inexcusable mistakes in office space spreading an iffy plot over too much ground the iffiness in judges plot group of coworkers plan the downfall of their despicable boss is not in its appeal in fact based on the popularity of scott adams cartoon dilbert will soon have its own television series satirical view of the american workplace is hot item in unfortunately the concept lends itself skitlength sequences would be more at home on the set of saturday night live rather than fulllength feature the most convincing evidence of this are the trailers for office space feature almost all of the movies top content this leaves the actual picture appearing very deflated other evidence of office spaces failure work are its lack of good jokes the comedy is marginally funny at best but not enough get packed house of theatergoers laugh out loud the material in the movie is onkey for an older demographic than judge is used targeting and this could partially explain his work here however the movie is loaded too many misfires including the token plot allow for any excuse the plot centers around three or four cubicled engineers headed up peter gibbons ron livingston at company named initech after the movie elaborately establishes the miserable working conditions at initech the movie introduces us two consultants john mcginley and paul willson are in charge of downsizing the companys payroll when peter and his gang learns of this as well as the reason behind it so their smooth talking boss bill lumbergh gary cole stock will go up they set about creating plan see his downfall the circumstances that follow were obviously intended be hilarious but they come out as anything but sympathetic cast and muddled jennifer anistonasloveinterest subplot are all that keep this one together but it is definitely missable in lieu of something more intelligent

it seemed like the perfect concept what better for the farrelly brothers famous for writing and directing comedies offensive subject matter than make movie about guy split personality it is exactly the sort of thing the brothers relish poking fun at something serious in this case mental illness throwing all care the wind get laugh jim carreys signed on too even better the national alliance for the mentally ill even helped out levying complaints against the brothers new before its opening claiming it was misrepresenting the condition of split personality labeling it incorrectly as schizophrenia and so forth such protest seemed like just the sort of thing that would of course only add more fuel the farrelly brothers fire proving that some people just could not take joke and that the farrellys would be helping the more enlightened viewers yet another dose of their brilliantly subversive comedy yes it all seemed perfect but one thing went wrong their movie is not funny it is not for lack of trying the farrellys utilize in me myself irene their most highconcept premise ever carrey plays charlie baileygaites man who after being dumped his wife for midget limo driver decides bury all his aggressive feelings deep down inside and never release them this of course means all his neighbors exploit his entirely tooforgiving nature making his job as rhode island state trooper increasingly difficult soon enough charlies repressed aggression manifests itself into second independent personality named hank deepvoiced boorish ogre unafraid of taking the assertive actions his predecessor had been unable muster this guy is not above crashing car through the wall of the barber shop in he is been insulted or holding little girls head underwater because she refused stop jumproping in the street then things start getting lost in the most complicated plot the farrellys have ever attempted and the runs off its tracks some have suggested that this is not problem because the farrelly brothers brand of humor does not require plot work they are wrong of course plot was greatly instrumental in building up the kind of rollicking comic energy that infused the farrellys last effort there is something about mary outside providence was technically an earlier project the brothers earlier was not funny merely because it contained outrageous gags despite what some newsmagazine articles would have you believe but rather because its most outrageous gags were entirely unexpected in mary the farrellys managed several times pull off neat sleightofhand trick they would have you thinking the story was going one way then reveal its real direction in delightfully surprising fashion me myself irene contrast seems have been made folks who looked at mary and saw only the surface grossness missing all of the subtle machinations that really made it work having been produced the same guys who made mary irene seems like an even bigger disappointment the brothers pile on the offensive humor taking shots at race midgets albinos mental illness and all manner of bathroom jokes but they have not come up way make any of it fresh most of me myself irene comes off as rote bythenumbers adolescent comedy the plot carrey forced drive alleged fugitive irene waters renee zellweger who is in more trouble than anyone knows back new york has an ending that is entirely predictable from the getgo think charlie and irene will fall in love yeah me too the farrellys then introduce scores of different characters and none of them ever manage do anything you have not already expected them do no matter how outrageous their actions might be compared the curveballs the farrellys are used throwing this stuff is almost entirely softtossed presenting an obvious problem when grossout humor loses its shock value it is no longer funny merely gross the jokes that do work are milked over and over until their effectiveness runs dry take for example the subplot involving charlies three black sons anthony anderson mongo brownlee jerod mixon the incongruity of it all is funny for while three burly black men discussing higher math in ghetto language and whitebread carrey mouthing said language an entirely toopleasant smile on his face but the end of the they are still doing the same schitck it has not been elevated another funnier level and it has not been dropped either that is too bad because it ceases be amusing about halfway through me myself irene reeks of wasted opportunities there ought be more focus on how other people react charlies new personality and on how charlie deals the consequences of hanks actions this does not really happen nearly every supporting character learns about charlies condition early on so they do not have any opportunity be surprised it the throws what looks like patented farrelly curve in scene towards the midway point involving an albino companion charlie and irene pick up called appropriately whitey but the script does not go anywhere it instead leaving the thread twisting in the wind before awkwardly tying it up during the climax jim carrey is gifted comedian both physically and vocally but he is left nothing much do here except contort himself in manner similar steve martin in all of me it is great showcase of flexibility and splitsecond roleshifting but none of it is terribly funny carrey does not pull any stunts we do not expect him pull and the farrellys script does not give him anything else pull the situations in he must perform the roleshifting are not set up in any meaningful way perhaps carrey can take solace in the fact that his supporting actors fare no better zellwegers irene is not strong female lead mary in mary may have been part adolescent fantasy but she was also intelligent and strongwilled irene is nothing in particular as the never makes clear whether she is ditzy clever or neither as such she gives us nothing latch onto as the only sane person in the chris cooper is stuck playing exactly one note as corrupt fbi agent and his character is entirely too straightlaced for movie like this he like the others does absolutely nothing unexpected after viewing the shapeless mess that me myself irene eventually dissolved into was stuck wondering whether or not the farrellys had outsmarted themselves maybe their kind of comedy can only work for so long until audiences get wise it and stop being shocked but do not believe it good filmmakers find ways of surprising their audiences even after people have grown attuned their style if the farrellys are indeed good smart filmmakers and still think they are they will rebound just fine even after that happens though will still consider me myself irene be highcaliber misfire

the yettobereleased krippendorfs tribe is being marketed as family comedy but buyer beware this movie cannot make up its mind is it family comedy vulgar references both the male and female bodies menstruation circumcision and sex that would make any parents squirm at the thought of having their child next them or is it an adult comedy approached such immaturity that only adolescents will appreciate the effort either way unbalanced is the word stamp on this hit and miss and miss and miss effort the premise is catchy widowed anthropology professor james krippendorf richard dreyfuss has spent the past two years getting over the death of his wife neglecting key research and squandering grant money on personal living expenses now it is time show what he is achieved in those two years and he has absolutely nothing show for it fabricated tale of studying previously undiscovered tribe in new guinea krippendorf petitions for new funds while hiding the fact that the previous grant was spent on trips mcdonalds but when his discovery becomes the latest craze among colleagues the professor finds he must do more than talk about the tribe he must create it the aid of his three children the headstrong teen shelly natasha lyonne of everyone says love you the slightly younger mickey gregory smith and the nineyearold edmund carl michael lindner the shelmikedmu tribe named from the first half of each childs name is born and videos quickly produced in krippendorfs backyard are passed off as stunning documentary footage of the newly found new guinea tribe despite the professors wishes the buzz surrounding his discovery only grows due in greatest part veronica micelli jenna elfman an overly vivacious and voluptuous anthropologist who barges her way into the discovery and basically deems herself krippendorfs main assistant hungry for recognition micelli sets up interviews lectures etc in an effort make this the biggest sociological event in history sure fire way go down in the history books krippendorf on the other hand is seeing himself go down jail cell corridor not in history books and each new lecture he must come up something impressive unleash about the tribe mating habits domestic structure etc thru fumbling improvisation and often some quick thinking from his oldest son krippendorf makes it thru each new lecture but only creates more and more interest in the highly unique tribe on the opposing end is krippendorfs arch rival ruth allen lily tomlin an arrogant professor whose jealousy drives her on mission disprove the existance of the nonexistent tribe it is cute idea and approached more subtle and mature style krippendorfs tribe could have been real winner sadly the mostlymisfired toilet humor overly comical musical score bruce broughton and sugar coated sentiments all the key ingredients of family comedy just are not the right tone for this cut that crap out add some razor sharp dialogue and witty sociological perceptions and you have got good start at the state it is in now you have got something along the lines of medicine man meets mrs doubtfire meets dumb dumber and that is not concoction anyone should be overly anxious try the overall product here is highly forgettable cup of average few laughoutloud moments and great big gap in between them most of the characters are surprisingly twodimensional and the only one who seems exhibit any real acting effort lyonne seems go greatly unappreciated director todd holland has gone about making this in all the wrong ways it is stuck in limbo between disney family fare jungle jungle and potentially hilarious adult comedy fish called wanda it is this unbalanced structure that really knocks it down grade and it is brutal drop strong warning parents forget the impression given advertisements do you want take your kids that has woman asking man if he finds her attractive merely because she is holding his penis yes it is put that bluntly just be warned this is merely one example of the many shocking subjects be brought up in the and others might not be as tame

it is been hours since returned from the much anticipated scifi opus mission mars and can still detect the reek of moldy cheddar why the movie is shoddy cheesefest full of digital eye candy stapled carelessly onto flimsy screenplay somehow manages leapfrog the great promise of space opera instead shooting for the angle of feelgood science fiction drama more akin space odyssey got the feeling that most of my fellow moviegoing patrons were expecting another armageddon but no mission mars certainly is not one large action sequence about colossal disaster this is supposedly thoughtful familyfriendly space flick in the apocalyptic excitement takes back seat visual elegance and uplifting drivel you have been warned of course crafting tightly claustrophobic space drama is not impossible see apollo for an excellent example but few directors possess the skill and craftsmanship pull it off without seriously scarring their reputation brian de palma has enough directorial expertise and visual wizardry up his sleeve pull it off when he gets his hands on an intelligent systematically practical script like the untouchables or mission impossible the director has the ability create sound technical achievement although his overly indulgent style becomes bothersome more than occasionally of course there is also the inexcusable string of crap that has carried his name including snake eyes and the notorious bomb the bonfire of the vanities all of makes me want call de palma the most talented hack in that term may be too harsh but if were judging him solely on the perpetual waste of talent that is mission mars my choice of words would have been slightly less lenient if were gary sinise would not touch de palma foot pole sinise is wonderful wonderful actor but after appearing in snake eyes and this vomitinducing sham am sure he would not want risk the embarrassment of third collaboration the academy awardwinner plays nasa astronaut jim mcconnell man who recently lost his wife kim delaney and is apparently psychologically unfit for an upcoming space shuttle mission mars oops forgot mention the year after barbecue gettogether for the astronauts we cut luc goddard don cheadle and his team who are already taking measurements and calculations on the red planet suddenly towering formation of rocks and soil probably best dubbed sand tornado appears and creates whirlwind of suction for some reason the astronauts just stand there calmly admire this as if it were lovely piece of art the team is killed within seconds expect for luc who was able send one final transmission and may still be alive immediately second mission consisting of astronauts mcconnell husband and wife woody and terri blake tim robbins and connie nielsen and phil ohlmyer jerry oconnell are dispatched rescue luc and discover the mysterious secret of planet mars let us put the secret on hold for now and discuss the trip there it is explained whether scientifically accurate or not probably not that trip mars takes roughly six months am not sure why the quartet of screenwriters behind mm did not capitalize on this juicy opportunity of creating tension and claustrophobia instead we join the team during their final days aboard the ship what happened during the five months prior this did they just play cards and tell dirty jokes still there are few nicely tense moments maybe the only in the movie during the timeframe involving fuel leak depalmas direction is quite good in these scenes although the score ennio morricone is largely inconsistent organ music in space cmon there is few good imaginative ideas in the landslide of cheese sad realization that causes me sigh out loud it is colossal bummer that mission mars is poorly assembled and laughably written dubious and supremely silly finale that will only satisfy dedicated optimists as mentioned before anyone looking for some disastermovie carnage is going feel savagely disappointed maybe even cheated after the unbelievably hokey final shot the words the end somehow adding insult injury few audience members made the effort boo and hiss at the screen others muttered obscenities shaking their heads in disbelief while mumbling jeez that sucked okay it did suck but you have show the actors some sympathetic mercy after all they do pretty well sinise is sincere and effective in many of his scenes robbins and nielsen wholeheartedly convince as loving nasa couple and funnyman oconnell well he has couple lines are actually amusing and intentionally so the digital effects accompanying the sand tornado sequence are quite impressive so golly where did this mission go wrong looking back on the appalling experience would say in practically every conduit and crevasse it could have while watching mission mars my suggestion would be immediately abort or better yet do not even strap yourself in for liftoff

despite its exceedingly welldone visual effects original species was one big hunk of scifi cheese from the writing the feeble performances so coming from such bgrade roots its sequels stunning ineptitude is not terribly surprising yet at the same time it is it would not have been difficult at all for the people behind species ii top the hokey original yet they have somehow managed fabricate something just as bad if not even worse something is clearly amiss when the back door left open for sequel in speciesa sewer rat becomes not quite of this earth after eating body part from the exploded alienhuman hybrid silis never entered into perhaps that was left for species iiithough am not giving away anything when say that this installment has an open back door of its own the alien fun and games begin this time when threeperson astronaut crew returning from mars inadvertently carries within their soil samples deadly alien dna that eventually infects the mission captain patrick ross justin lazard late of cbss shortlived soap of few years back central park westcpw this alien dna is not identical that created the original films sil but it is close enough and upon arrival on earth patrick is mating like crazy engaging in bloody sex just about every woman he can find meanwhile scientist dr laura baker the returning marg helgenberger has created clone of sil named eve natasha henstridge again for research purposes it does not take long for eve sense another alien presence send her libido into hyperdrive it is up laura and her former partner bounty hunter press lennox michael madsen another returnee and patricks uninfected shipmate dennis gamble mykelti williamson find patrick before the inheat eve does this is not the xfiles goddammit exclaims one character in the early going in terms of quality he is absolutely right but he is also wrong the new alien first appears as an otherworldly oozing sludge that causes patricks pupils dilate once he is infected looks and sounds an awful lot like the xfiless black cancer me but that is not the only source director peter medak and writer chris brancato steal from species was already ripoff of alien but medak makes the cribbing much more blatant than the originals director roger donaldson did human patrick is given tongue that also has tongue within itself and his alien form more closely resembles the alien than eves alien body ironically was designed alien designer r giger large alien hive that our heros douse substance fired from large guns aliens sans flamethrowers the visual effects were far the best thing about species and the sequels effects crew at steve johnsons xfx inc keeps that highquality tradition alive no cheaplooking lost in space cgi here after the effects the originals best asset was the fresh presence of henstridge however medak and brancato have no idea what exactly do her for this installment at one point she is called on play alien empath la forest whitaker in the original but for most of the duration she is holed up in glass cell the time the big breakout so prominently featured in the trailer actually takes place the is well into its home stretch so the rest of the time we are treated patrick played little zest lazard one problem the first was that the deadly horny but innocentatheart sil was too sympathetic no such problem patrick who comes off as cocky pretty boy before the alien takes control the rest of the cast also fails add much but the writing can be faulted for that helgenberger and madsen go through the motions but they are already hampered the clich development that somewhere between the two films the oncelinked laura and press stopped getting along williamson suffers the worst indignity he tries his best enliven the token africanamerican role but how can anyone recite insulting derivative lines such as am gonna get african on someones ass and not appear ridiculous but species iis worst crime is being thoroughly uninteresting piece of work at least the original featured plenty laugh atunaccountably awful performances the otherwise fine actors ben kingsley and whitaker and the sight of helgenbergers character performing fellatio on madsens for start but the filmmakers do not display any discernable effort at all let alone the misguided effort that is required for something reach the camp level for all the blood and gore nudity and sex thrown in species ii is quite simply vapid bore

the marvelous british actor derek jacobi stars in writer and director john mayburys love is the devil about the popular modern artist francis bacon as always jacobis acting is impeccable but the movie tries hard and succeeds at being unentertaining and opaque the movie convincingly argues that francis played jacobi was completely despicable and vain individual but it never provides any insight into his work or any motivation for his attitude when interviewed fawning talk show host francis calls his style chance brushstrokes starting burglary of franciss flat the uses loud sound effects that sound like they were lifted from cheap horror movie the camera shots are heavy on the avantgarde angles lots of wideangle closeups and distorted shots filmed through coloredglass reflections the director is much more interested in filmmaking style than in the substance of the story the result being sterile examination of lonely and vain man daniel craig in lifeless performance plays the burglar and boxer george dyer when francis lays eyes on him after the breakin francis promises not call the police if he will stay for sex he stays for the entire movie but never respects the man whom he shares bed he thinks that franciss paintings have no bloody use and the movie presents no counterargument writer maybury barely outlines franciss character and george and the rest of the supporting cast remain complete enigma we learn little of george other than franciss reason for liking him georges amorality and innocence franciss love of sadomasochism is shown early and often boxing is such marvelous aperitif for sex he reflects george on the way watch boxing match as the fighters head is sliced open heavy blow the camera cuts gleeful francis whose own head is soaked the flying blood francis appears be in complete ecstasy another of franciss favorite activities is viewing old movies of atrocities as the carnage mounts we witness an orgasmically happy francis in the audience in that tries obsessively shock one dream sequence portrays family in car accident franciss mind slowly examines every bloody limb of the mother the father and the boy sometimes the script throws us tidbits of franciss wisdom illuminate little while merely sounding insightful am optimistic nature am optimistic about nothing loneliness is my only true companion we learn more details about franciss makeup techniques than about the man himself he prefers shoe polish for his hair and sink cleaning powder for his teeth full of metaphorical interpretations the films best scene occurs late one night when george has get up go the bathroom mistaking franciss picture of toilet for the genuine article he urinates on it and then crawls back into bed contentedly like parody of bad art house movie love is the devil has horrid characters filmed bizarrely and confusingly director who is much more interested in technique than storytelling the end the audience has not learned any more than it could have in threeminute sketch love is the devil runs the is not rated but should be considered nc for violence profanity graphic sex nudity and sadomasochism and is unacceptable for most teenagers

payback brian helgelands inauspicious directing debut coincidentally he previously penned the awardwinning screenplay for l confidential is wildly uneven and thoroughly unpleasant revenge thriller that takes one ideaa movie nonstop violence death and villainsand runs it or should say barely manages crawl away it mel gibson in yet another disappointing picture conspiracy theory and lethal weapon anyone stars as the reprehensible villainhero porter man who becomes determined get his share of he stole in robbery back when his partnerincrime gregg henry and drugaddicted wife deborah kara unger doublecross him shoot him and leave him for dead porter is not dead howevernot long shotas he quickly rehabilitates and along his loyal prositute girlfriend rosie maria bello sets out make everyone involved in the scam pay the tagline for payback is get ready root for the bad guy and sure enough this is true as pretty much every significant character who appears is crooked in some way would not have problem this offbeat detail if the painfully thin story had been of any interest but it was not and therefore found myself having an especially laborious time investing myself into wide array of character that have absolutely no redeeming qualities whatsoever no attempt is made flesh the roles into threedimensional characters and there are no vacant signs that anyone has any sort of humanity in them just because the protagonist bad guy is played mel gibson does not mean will root for him and did not quite the contrary every person in the movie deserved die gory death although some of them did anyway just spice up the dull proceedings since none of the respectable actors in payback actually have human beings play only one performance managed stand out lucy alexis liu of v ally mcbeal who plays spicy sm dominatrix brightens up every scene she is in and has definite flair for comedy something would have liked have seen more of since most of the humor fell resounding splat meanwhile gibson who is perfectly fine here sleepwalks through role that is not the least bit challenging unger who made an impression in the game is surprisingly wasted and it is difficult see why she took such part since she disappears ten minutes in and only has two purproses get high on heroin and because she plays key part in an early flashback finally kris kristofferson appears in throwaway role during the climax and this unnecessary plot development sticks out like sore thumb tellingly he did not appear in the original cut of the but was cast when extensive reshoots took place months later like most action movies the star often takes licking but keeps on ticking in the course of the minute running time of payback porter is shot three times in the back hit van beaten up and has his feet smashed sledgehammer and guess what not only does he survive the whole ordeal but he is happygolucky in the penultimate sequence and can still walk even though he looks like he had recently substituted for punching bag payback is not in any way an entertaining even though am sure the makers hoped it would be all the graphic carnage that goes on but take away that violence and what you are basically left is blank screen perhaps director helgeland would have been smart consider this so he could have at least added few worthwhile elements like fresh storyline and characters whom you could even remotely stand be around for few hours

did do something bad must have because sitting through this movie was sheer punishment heres the plot ricky jeff goldblum is producer of the goodbuy network one of those hour home shopping channels the new boss robert loggia plans can rickys behind if he does not turn the previous months flat sales numbers around and add his problems ricky also has work kate kelly preston the ivy league wunderkind whom the boss has brought him kate and ricky do not get along and do not have any great ideas until they meet eddie murphy spiritualist who sees something positive in everything his soothing voice and simple logic makes people feel good and it is this quality that will make the new gbn television star and the key the networks success the first problem is flaw in the plot sure makes people feel good sure we are told that most people feel guilty after buying an impulse item no matter how wealthy they might be and will even believe that talks talk that allows people feel good about what they have bought but hey that is after they have bought it why do sales skyrocket the first time is on camera far from trying sell the product instead blathers on about how you do not even need the thing someone please tell me how this is supposed move merchandise in the first place you might say that people feel good about what they have bought so they come back and more but due the simple fact that the first round of sales in inexplicable am not convinced this is what the filmmakers had in mind the whole movie is therefore seriously undermined because the key point in the plot is never credible another problem is in the humor you know if you see that eddie murphy is in movie think it is not unreasonable for you expect that the is comedy whoa partner are you in for surprise holy man is not funny murphy the one asset you would think this movie has remember how they brought him in at the last minute save best defense then again maybe you do not is seriously reigned in the script gives him almost nothing work and it seems as though director stephen herek kept him toned down so that the other actors in the would not be left as window dressing there is only one moment in the where murphy is allowed let loose and it lasts for three shouted words seem totally out of place as result pathetic in all there are about three jokes that work in the entire picture and they are not even that great as side note there are some cameo appearances such as dan marino pitching contraption allows you cook off of your car engine and james brown introducing medicalert device that shouts help me just like the hardest working man in show business at the push of button but these never cause your personal laughometer rise above the level of mild bemusement well you ask surely there must be some convincing performances make up for the lack of humor think again buckwheat jeff goldblum disappoints kelly preston is flat but not like that robert loggia in the kind of role for he has been virtually typecast cannot do anything it the script is part of the problem but these actors do not even look like they believe in the move they are making they look lot like they are bored just like the audience so what do you have when the humor is absent from your comedy and the acting is like the siberian steppes that drags more than dropped anchor but wait as if these problems do not make the slow enough the screenplays pacing makes the movie even slower it takes the entire first half hour establish the movies premise then more time as the wades through tortuous and seemingly mandatory romance between ricky and kate and subplot involving conniving pr man eric mccormack who wants discredit and take over rickys job as producer when the pr guys plan is foiled the is climaxes we are treated that little epilogue and then we can all go home right wrong the movie goes on for another half hour continental drift is the indy compared the pace of holy man the only thing holy about holy man will surely be the number of people exclaiming holy that movie was awful this one is for the truly pious

plot something about bunch of kids going into haunted house and playing out parodies of other horror and nonhorror movies oh yeah there is also something about ghost possessing the mansion and shit but trust me you will not care much about the plot in this critique parody movies either work or they do not and this one just does not work the laughs are not as pronounced this time around the extended skit on saturday night live there are couple of funny oneliners but mostly just rehashed onejoke scenes lot of dead silence and lame gags add that the very unoriginal title and movie poster
