the cartoon is way better that is the bottom line on disneys incredibly hyped live action version of its animated feature the alliance between disney and slapstick king john hughes has produced frenetic home alone puppies and not much else when production of this remake was announced the big question seemed be why the original cartoon still works so what is the point the answer it appears is give disney an excuse for yet another massive merchandising campaign the story for those of you who missed childhood is simple two dalmatians pongo and perdy fall in love at first sight they drag their human pets together and in short time both couples marry the heavenly matchups turn chaotic when pongo and perdys newborn pups are stolen their dognapping engineered the evil cruella devil who wants them for their pelts everyone in the animal kingdom then joins in frantic effort save the puppies in the original movie the animated pooches had broad range of facial expressions and distinct personalities we also could hear them talk quickly established crucial element the charm of the the dogs view of humans as their pets in the new version the dogs are mute and expressionless hughes attempts give them character repeated shots of the dalmatians draping their heads over each other and licking their faces and necks while he drew the desired aww they are so cute reaction from the audience it was quickly followed several people whispering wonder what kind of food they smeared on the dogs heads get them licking like that the canines lack of personality would be easier take if the human beings had little joely richardson and jeff daniels are stunningly bland in their lead roles in previous films daniels successfully played off his white bread persona in something wild he revealed the rebellious thrillseeker beneath his neutral demeanor in terms of endearment his hapless appearance masked cold manipulative womanizer here he and richardson are so consistently bland that it is wonder their images even stick the glenn close however has no problems establishing distinct personality as the villainous icon cruella devil she tears up the screen in deliciously overthetop performance close matches the intensity of the animated cruella becoming cartoon herself twotone fright wig red gloves long nails attached the fingertips garish animal skin outfits and stiletto heels close bursts through her scenes like force of nature she is clearly having ball playing this monstrous icon and her wicked glee is infectious when she spits out lines like you have won the battle but am about win the wardrobe the comes briefly life dalmatians is crammed john hughes typical heavyhanded approach comedy after an ingenuous opening showing pongos morning routine as he gets daniels prepared for the day the quickly tumbles into lame slapstick as the pooch drags daniels on careening trek through city park little slapstick goes long way but hughes just keeps laying it on the second half of the where local animals team up rescue nondescript dalmatian puppies from devil and her henchmen is tedious home alone clone the bad guys enduring variety of sadistic assaults worthy of an itchy scratchy cartoon including thug getting his testicles fried on an electric fence dalmatians has cute puppies and hoot of performance from glenn close but not enough warrant enduring third rate slapstick bland characters and unconvincing animatronic raccoons highfiving one another rent the cartoon

spawn may be somewhat of an older in fact it will probably be on video before anyone who has not seen it will finally get see it that is if they see it but managed catch it before it made it is way out of theaters and into the world of rentals and god forbid video cassette purchasing it was not the worst of year any means it is not even on the top of the worst films of the year but it did manage top the bottom five of the bottom ten in simpler terms means it comes in at number on my worst of list the only reason it does not come in lower is thanks the special effects might actually have been some of the best of the year performances however were either wooden or for the most part unforgivingly campy in fact this shows no signs of attempting avoid campiness even the editing seemed boast campy quality do not know how explain that one it was not exactly choppy but something about it seemed well annoyingly unprofessional john leguizamo almost makes it as clown but not quite he is the only character who provides the audience any laughs that can honestly be called intentional but the main problem found spawn as most films that wind up on my worst of lists is that it was just plain boring would not even say there was climax the sure it had the big battle scene at the end but the only excitement felt was that the movie might be nearing conclusion never too soon the movie did conclude in very simple disappointing way even though it is one of the shorter movies have seen this year it is one that would definitely not want subject myself sitting thru again like said the special effects are the only reason that this should have any sense of pride no matter how small was impressed the opening sequence so long as did not allow the melodramatic voiceover and lobotomizing editing get me and batman has nothing on the spectacular visuals spawns outfit created but even the effects got tiresome during the final scenes looked quite bit like modern video game who knows if spawn the video game was not part of the plan from the beginning keeping in mind that the was based on comic book makes it somewhat more approachable and in very small amount makes up for the cheeziness of it all but none of this movies saving graces can it make it something would recommend seeing no matter what the price of admission this movie is definitely not for young children should not really be problem seeing as how only teenagers if anyone would likely find it appealing if you really want catch movie there are many better ones out there no matter what your tastes might be trust me spawn has very little offer even the most avid moviegoers

from major league baseball radio broadcast featuring playby play man harry canary and color man whitey hashbrown special guest commentator james berardinelli hc as we go the top of the th we are joined in the booth critic james berardinelli who is here fresh from seeing the new baseball movie major league back the minors the third in the popular saga taking lighter look at the majors nice see you jim as big baseball fan and movie reviewer can you give us the scoop on the new flick jb my opinion the producers should have stopped while they were ahead and that was nine years ago one entry was definitely enough and am surprised there was third after the anemic showing and low quality of major league this latest installment has all the earmarks of something that should have been released directtovideo it is worse than mediocre madefortv feature should also mention that this movie likely will not play all that well in cleveland now that the real indians are perennial contenders they have been replaced the minnesota twins as the cinematic sadsacks actually most of the action involves the twins aaa minor league club the buzz rather than the actual major league franchise hc sorry interrupt jim but we still have do playbyplay for the game on the field leading off this inning is john warren he steps into the batters box and takes kents pitch low for ball one wh so the storys strictly minor league right what is it about jb scott bakula the guy from quantum leap plays career minor league pitcher gus cantrell when twins owner roger dorn once again portrayed corbin bernsen needs new manager for his aaa team he offers the job gus who is now faced two daunting tasks turn the team around and groom hot prospect downtown anderson played walt goggins for promotion the show the help of former major leaguers pedro cerrano dennis haysbert rube baker eric bruskotter and isuro tanaka takaaki ishibashi gus gets the buzz on the right track in fact he is so successful that he earns the enmity of the jealous manager of the bigleague club leonard huff played overthetop relish ted mcginley soon dorn has arranged an exhibition game that pits gus overachieving group against huffs overpaid lastplace bunch wh can we guess who wins jb the results have all the suspense of watching the videotape of game when you have already seen the box score on top of that none of the mockups are presented much flair they are not just boring they are lackluster but the major league movies have never been about drama or tension they have been about using baseball situations generate laughs hc warren fouls off fastball and wh are there lots of yuks in this one jb not one from start finish enjoyed the first major league because it was reasonably fresh and funny okay lot of the jokes were sophomoric but they made me laugh the two sequels have not just been stale but their humor quotient has been abysmally low even bob ueckers oncesharp oneliners have turned lame and they are the closest the comes being even vaguely amusing hc heres the pitch looooooong drive fair or foul foul ball the count goes and wh does the at least get the baseball details correct jb yes there are not any glaring errors like there were in one of the bestever baseball movies the natural but would gladly trade technically accurate for one good story believable characters or even little genuine humor heck the naked gun is better baseball comedy than major league back the minors wh it is nice see old friends one more time is not it like cerrano tanaka and dorn jb depends on whether you really care that anyone is back there are not any real characters here just an assortment of cliched oddballs yeah the voodoo hitter the catcher who cannot throw back the pitcher the japanese player and the conceited playerturnedowner have all returned but who really cares they have no depth notable absences include tom berengers veteran and charlie sheens wild thing we do not really miss them though hc breaking ball low and outside and wh so you are saying that we should give this one miss jb that is right use baseball terminology it is threepitch strikeout if you are looking for good movie that involves baseball try popping the natural field of dreams bull durham or even the first major league into the vcr actually this is an oddlytimed release since baseball fans are likely be spending more time in parks than in theaters even the minor league seasons are already underway do not bother major league back the minors it is wretched time waster wh thanks for the advice jb you are welcome hc and heres the pitch fouled back right into this booth hey jim heads up oops somebody better get him some ice for that he may be good at deflecting bad baseball movies but he needs learn not duck into foul balls odd how warren seemed aim that ball right at him almost as if he has grudge settle anyway back the action on the field

it is time take cover after hiatus of about fifteen years the disaster movie has come back renewed zest in early there were no less than three movies about volcanoes alone one on television and two in the theaters dantes peak and volcano in heavy competition for the moviegoing dollar of the two had heard that dantes peak was the better so decided check it out when it was released on video the begins slow motion scene of people in third world country trying evacuate their little town the town is being covered in ash and sulfuric water from what we presume is volcanic eruption flaming rocks of various sizes also fall from the sky crushing homes and people we see people panicking people crying and even horses rearing it is disaster of biblical proportions signified us one person dragging cross down road symbolism does not get much more blatant than that we learn that harry dalton pierce brosnan volcanologist the s geological survey was there his wife when the eruption occurred harry survived but his wife did not few years later harry is sent investigate some unusual seismic activity detected near the small town of dantes peak washington we are told has been voted second most desirable place live under the readers of money magazine there harry meets rachel wando single mother of two who serves as mayor of dantes peak and proprietor of small coffee shop although the mayor does not seem be alarmed the presence of man sent determine if the mountain next their town is going blow up few members of the city council are they are afraid that harrys presence is going scare off an investor who has pledged put millions of dollars into developing dantes peak they would rather have any news of possible stirrings within the neighboring dormant volcano swept under the rug however when an amorous young couple takes skinnydip in the local hot springs they turn up cooked lava bubbles up from small fissure underneath thus begins chain of events leading up the inevitable eruption this contains number of cliches the amorous couple is one as soon as they doff their clothes you know they are going die the town busybody and the abrasive motherinlaw make appearances as does the deathdefying dog countless familiar scenarios only serve make this very predictable watching the movie was able not only anticipate each of the major plot elements but some of the dialogue as well unfortunate since much of the dialog is terrible for example harrys boss paul charles hallahan and team from the s geological survey join harry assess the situation paul basically tells the townsfolk that harrys eruption predictions are not cause for alarm this causes harry leave in fit of rage only turn up the next day ready for work when paul asks harry why he stayed he says grim determination cause this towns in trouble and am the best man you have got even better is when harry is trying explain the need jolt the residents into leaving he likens the situation how frog will jump out if dropped into pot of boiling water if the frog is in cold water is gradually heated up however the frog will not move and will allow itself be cooked is that your recipe for frog soup asks one of the team members it is my recipe for disaster responds harry dantes peak has singular talent for pointing out the obvious our heroes are in boat in the middle of lake harry realizes the volcanic activity has turned acid mayor wando demonstrates her brilliant powers of deduction proclaiming in very grave tone acid eats metal thanks for the tip when we first see the s geological survey building there is caption labeling it as such this would not have been so bad if it were not for the fact that the caption is right above sign on the building reads in large letters s geological survey suppose the caption is for people who cannot read signs although harry and mayor wando become an item the end of the the viewer has no idea why there is severe lack of chemistry between the two characters and the relationship seems rushed because of this when they get close kissing was asking myself why do they want kiss were they even attracted each other if were the mayor would sure think twice about kissing guy who does not even crack smile through the whole movie trying pull off the roughyetdebonair act who does he think he is james bond the eruption of the volcano feels similarly rushed there are several warning signs prior the eruption itself but they are so lackluster and without suspense that we do not feel as if they are leading up anything for example one of the survey team members makes his way down into the crater of the volcano in order retrieve remote controlled robot tremor occurs does he plunge headlong his death is he engulfed in lava shoots up from below no couple of rocks fall on him and break his leg the sole purpose of this scene seemed be set up the subsequent chopper rescue scene suppose was intended be dramatic as well it was not one plot thread left noticeably hanging was the investment in the town of dantes peak in disaster movie there is usually one guy who is greedy enough cover up the possibility of eruptionfireearthquakeexplosiontsunamitornadometeorite and usually gets killed the disaster it is okay of course because we all think he got what he deserved if you are going be unoriginal you might as well go all the way in dantes peak the city councilmembers are concerned but they do not really try hard enough maybe the mayors abrasive motherinlaw should have been the one for no apparent reason she snaps at harry for even positing that the volcano could erupt perhaps her ancestors invested in some pompeii real estate there are couple of good things about this movie the first is the scenery there are panoramic shots of forests lakes and mountains that are absolutely beautiful the second is the special effects they are the closest have ever seen real pyroclastic eruption but when elements do not speak are going be the best parts of your movie you would probably better rewrite the script

capsule hamhanded and overunderwritten morality play masquerading as entertainment so muddled it does not even know what it is really advocating if anything time kill has been hailed as the best of the grisham adaptations and it is easy see why it presents strong almost rancorously so story it is full of good actors samuel jackson matthew mcconaughey sandra bullock kevin spacey charles dutton and it is ostensibly about some important social issue that we are all tangling it is not however good movie and all of the reasons have listed above have something do why right from the beginning the movie is deadset on stacking its deck as thoroughly and unrepentantly as possible pair of redneck whites boozed and drugged out of their minds kidnap young black girl abuse and rape her horribly and leave her for dead after their arrest their father jackson takes an assault rifle and guns them down on the way trial mcconaughey is then drafted in as his lawyer and the rest is somehow strangely predictable courtoom movie dramatics the acting is not quite what it should be given the cast we have sandra bullock who is good actress but not serious one looks clueless spaceys accent switches itself on and off at random and he is given totally thankless role play as well role without an iota of depth and mcconaugheys role is stamped from the cardboard back of cereal box the most memorable role is donald sutherlands and his is bit part always consider it an index of movies desperation when it is able present shocking and outlandish events and somehow not have them generate an ounce of impact there is one scene riot outside the courtroom that should have created incredible tension but winds up playing out like textbook exercise on how not deploy scene like this because the movie does not know what it is really about it cannot generate any genuine tension and so it has artifically inject tension through clumsy plotting one of the ways it does this is throwing in whole subplot about bunch of vicious kkk crossburners is tidied up so neatly that it borders on the nihilistic was reminded of the despicable betrayed tried tart up fundamentally empty story injecting vile graphic acts of racism as little more than an attentiongetter the movie immolates an enormous amount of its potential making few critical mistakes first of all the jackson character is not hard judge there is no tension in his dilemma he is selfadmittedly guilty and should be sent jail no matter how moral his crusade the old saw about how no court in the land would convict him if he was white is supposed be the underlying theme of the movie but it is never developed into an organic component of the story it just sort of floats around on top while the movie grinds away furiously its plot mechanics another mistake is in motivational logic not having the two white thugs arraigned first or maybe tried and then dismissed from lack of evidence say we have that much less empathy for jacksons character am probably supposed think that just because he had his daughter raped we are automatically supposed feel empathy for him but that is precisely the kind of facile thinking that makes real justice impossible see the virgin spring for more on that note is jacksons character then simply insane that prospect is not given terribly serious treatment either one of the most aggravating things about coutroom movies is how little they seem know about how the law works or how lawyers get their information mcconaugheys character makes an important slipup late in the movie when one of his witnesses turns out have been convicted of capital offense how did the prosecution get this information how come he did not get it the whole way these questions get handled are symptomatic of the movies way of dealing complex legal and moral questions in cheap screenwriterly slambang fashion this is the biggest problem the movie is not about jacksons character or his dilemma or this case or any of its frequently interesting despite the porcine writing and direction characters it is not ultimately about anything at all except its stupid geareddown plot inches onwards in one unremarkable scene after another towards totally contrived ending at two and half hours the movie is overlong and drastically overwritten there is endless stuff about things ultimately add up nothing and no writing about the material that should really matter it is all handwaving the closing argument are also sneaky and underhanded and underscored my suspicion that the movie is manipulative and unfair it is not easy make movie about something the other day saw kurosawas phenomenal rashomon movie that is really about the way people deal truth and reality or do not time kill is as empty and ponderous movie as have seen in long time

deep rising gives you that sinking feeling both literally and figuratively not only does the movie take place on cruise ship slowly being immersed into the middle of the ocean squidlike menace but the unfolding story is artificial silly and almost completely derivative of countless other and for the most part better films while dumb monster movies can at least be decent guilty pleasures take for example the schlocky mountain highs of last springs anaconda deep rising has no tongue put in its cheek folks we are only month into the new year and already heres candidate for one of its stinkiest releases most of the action takes place on the argonautica luxury liner in the middle of its maiden voyage uhoh if these people had seen titanic then maybe they would have known stay home when it is attacked giant tentacled sea creature the only survivors are slinky jewel thief trilian famke janssen argonautica owner canton anthony heald and few other crew members mercenary team lead resourceful captain john finnegan treat williams board the argonautica looking for assistance after their own boat breaks down nearby but what their search of the ship uncovers is something bloodsoaked hungry and not very helpful the main problem deep rising is its overt familiarity the movie makes absolutely no attempt differentiate itself from most scifihorror films in recent memory the concept is leviathan meets titanic dash of speed thrown in for good or is that bad measure this monster is equal parts leagues under the sea and the relic knows how open doors like the raptors from jurassic park and even gets expel halfdigested victim neat effect admittedly la the giant snake in anaconda some of the attack sequences are straight out of jaws and alien scene where the remaining survivors have travel under water escape death is right out of alien resurrection there is even jet ski chase like hard rain and the list goes on watching deep rising cast battle the beast is murky chore in itself because none of them have welldeveloped characters nor do they seem project even the slightest sense of fear when facing their enemy williams is affable enough but his finnegan just is not believable an interesting supporting cast is thoroughly wasted pretty famke janssen best known as goldeneye killer thighs is trapped in forced romantic interest williams while kevin oconnor as finnegans mechanic provides comic relief screechy manic shtick that gets old fast djimon honsou who received raves for his performance as noble slave in decembers amistad pops up in brief part he needs stay away from the water the movies final shot is groaner as is the thhour regurgitation of subplot involving an onship saboteur as if cast deserving of their snack foodfate is not bad enough when you taunt the monster you are really asking for it deep rising is slow stupid slog through story without single bright spot and since we all know that the higher the casualty rate is the closer we are the end of the movie rooting for this overgrown squid swallow the whole ship is not out of the question

mandingo has traditionally been seen as one of two things either muchneeded revisionist look at slavery in the south or in the words of critic leonard maltin trashy potboiler that appeals only the sm crowd actually think mandingo is strange combination of the two although it fails on both fronts it is too trashy be good drama but too dramatic be good trash the story takes place on dilapidated louisiana plantation run crotchety old warren maxwell james mason and his son hammond perry king one day in new orleans hammond comes across slave trader selling mandingo named mede heavyweight boxer ken norton although the movie never explains it mandingo is simply the name for africans who come from the region of the upper niger river valley according the movie mandingos were the rolls royce of african slaves hammond pays top price for mede and has fight off others in order get him hammond then spends his time training mede be fighter in money brawls other slaves meanwhile hammond has married his cousin blanche susan george because she wants escape her family and he is under pressure from his father produce grandchild hammond however is happier spending nights his bed wench the derogatory name given female slaves used their masters for easy sex it is quickly apparent that hammond despite his overt racism is more in love his bed wench sensitive slave girl named ellen brenda sykes than he is blanche hammond considers blanche tainted goods because he finds out on their wedding night that another man had pleasured her before he did of course it is fine that he is slept numerous slave girls but the fact that his wife white lady had been another man out of wedlock destroys his capacity care for her so blanche is usually left lonely and sexstarved while hammond is sleeping ellen blanche gets back at hammond seducing the studly mede and bearing his child hammond and his father cannot stand the idea that blanche has given birth halfblack child although it is okay that ellen was pregnant hammond so warren kills the child letting it bleed death after birth and hammond poisons blanche hammond then finds mede shoots him twice in the shoulder and pushes him into giant cauldron of boiling water yes you read right the ends hammond getting his revenge boiling mede alive judging only the plot mandingo is pure sexploitation the main purpose of the seems be getting as many blacks and whites into bed together as possible only the slightest commentary on what that would mean in th century southern society when mandingo was released in it was still bit of shocker see miscegenation on screen in such graphic detail this way the movie could revise cinematic history while attracting large audiences of curious voyeurs dramatically mandingo is weak and unfocused and historically it is mostly confused if one were judge history this it would be easy walk away the notion that the entire system of american slavery was based on sexuality not economics not once in the do we see any of the slaves working except for few house servants the men spend most of the time sitting around while the sole purpose of female slave seems be free sex for the owner there is historical basis in the notion that slave owners often slept their female slaves but mandingos overwhelming emphasis on this aspect of slavery gives the movie the unpleasant taste of cheap sex flick although there is plenty of violence fights vicious beatings shootings and the aforementioned human boiling sequence thrown in for good measure some tried write off mandingo as blaxploitation one of number of quicklymade lowbudget films appealing black sensibilities in the early seventies but it is not that easy mandingo was studiofinanced paramount pictures and produced dino de laurentiis the grandiose italian producer behind such notorious productions as the bible the remake of king kong and the illfated dune the director was richard fleischer veteran who was best known for several special effectsladen action movies including leagues under the sea and fantastic voyage as well as such superior suspense films as the narrow margin the script based on the supermarket bestseller ken ostott and the subsequent play jack kirkland was penned norman wexler who had been nominated for an oscar two years earlier for his work on serpico james mason perry king and susan george were wellknown and respected actors mason already had three oscar nominations under his belt and ken norton appeared have promising career so why is mandingo so bad number of reasons including the fact that all those experienced filmmakers behind and in front of the camera did lousy job wexlers script is pure poor hokum bordering on the offensive it combines stereotyped slavetalk yessuh massuh stereotyped southern white trash talk fer whutre you gittin outta bed and stereotyped contemporary militant black talk if you see me hang you gonna know you killed black brother fleischers direction is clumsy especially during the fight scenes and all the actors give weak performances especially susan george whose constant shrieking finally becomes laughable nevertheless credit should be given where credit is due despite its exploitative nature mandingo was one of the first movies take an alternative look at slavery until then there had been kind of underlying racism in all films dealing slavery even classics such as gone the wind can be seen as inherently racist its glossing over the subject matter mandingo reassessed the south and showed that it was not all beautiful plantations green fields and pretty sunsets but all this is constantly undermined the films negligible pointofview it claims see things from the black perspective but the entire narrative focus is on the soap opera tales of the white owners little more maturity and different handling mandingo might have been an effective worthwhile while it portrays many sensitive aspects of slavery it never deals them the issues the movie brings up are worthwhile but wexlers script refuses move them beyond surface level of trashily vicarious viewing there is great deal of potential in honestly exploring the nature of sexual relationship between slave and owner but mandingo never does it steven spielberg touched on that same topic in schindlers list looking at nazi officer writhing in inner turmoil because of his feelings for jewish maid the difference between that and mandingo is that spielberg dealt the situation in fair unexploitive manner that focused on the inherent human dilemma mandingo is satisfied simply show some skin and because of that its trashy potboiler nature overshadows any potential social good it might have accomplished

ladybugs is typical comedy that relies on three supposed guarantees the pathetic team who beats the champs cross dressing and the presence of rodney dangerfield this picture does not play like comedy for children so who is it aimed at and why is it told like minute sitcom instead of feature rodney dangerfield stars as chester lee total schmuck working at huge corporation he obviously does not have lot of self esteem and thinks he has kiss up get ahead he does volunteering coach the companys girls soccer team what shock learn chester and his assistant julie jackee know absolutely nothing about the game and the players seem know even less did not laugh but for some reason it did not annoy me that much chesters fiancee bess graff thinks he got promotion in addition the coaching position and of course she has slacker for son who is doing poorly in school and is kicked off the sports teams jonathon brandis is nice surprise as matthew who agrees dress up as girl named martha help out chester probably because the girl he has crush on plays on the team what original story ideas what we get is just another retread of the underdog sports team mixed some cross dressing unfortunately the is not smart enough play upon the drag aspect in fact it downplays it so heavily it is totally unbelievable could it be any more obvious martha is boy he only wears girls wig without any makeup and they do not even give him falsies brandis does not bother mimic girls voice either then there is pointless scene where chester and matthew shop for dress but for what reason martha is only seen on the soccer field why would they buy dress for her just when we think the martha character is going be useful she disappears and the story wanders aimlessly looking for new plot pick up on when bess discovers what is really going on she breaks up chester and the relationship is forgotten about and the focuses on the soccer team and the tension between chester and his boss this could have been less bad had it been the cliche sports comedy but it feels the need go off on tangents that are completely unnecessary and bad at that there is just too much of sitcom feel here especially during the socalled serious moments and all the confusion between the characters have seen worse movies than ladybugs but for some reason it contained some sort of bizarre charm so even when it turns sour it does not seem as bad as it is dangerfield finally gets his respect in the end but at what price

the happy bastards quick movie review the concept of enjoying stupid comedy is best realized as keeping it stupid really shift gears even once and the audience can be thrown miserably out of control sadly that is the case kingpin directed the farrelly brothers the duo that brought us there is something about mary and dumb and dumber since the duo directed and did not write the script can assume that is part of the problem the story seems good enough pro bowler in the the name of roy munson woody harrelson is sitting on top of the world his popularity has gone through the roof and he is getting his career off the ground then however he runs into ed mccracken bill murray rival bowler hardly any real consideration for well anything these two form an illtimed relationship that involves risky betting and before roy sees it coming eds abandoned him and he is about lose his hand in bowling ball machine forward seventeen years later where roy has become quite the loser complete mechanical hand tornup car and of course the occasional knocking up of the uglyass landlord avoid paying rent for while however he finds glimmer of hope upon visit local bowling alley where he runs into an amish kid named ishmael randy quaid who has quite the bowling arm the kids help he figures he can be known again particularly at the biggest bowling tournament rapidly approaching in reno nevada of course the amish kid needs some coaxing particularly when you consider well he is amish this leads some of the best comic scenes in the such as roys process of removing horseshoes or milking the cow finally the duo get on the road and along the way pick up an additional helper beautiful hustler played the gorgeous vanessa angel the main problem had kingpin was not the fact it was not funny in fact it does have some rather hilarious scenes in it such as the aformentioned above and roys explanation of not having children something involving cheese grater but that is just it scenes there is couple of really serious scenes that throw off the entire momentum of the movie like the abuse angel takes from her hustler exboyfriend mean was this really necessary could not have this been handled just bit wackier mean this is comedy why throw ethics in particularly in farrelly brothers vehicle where hair gel can be easily mistaken that really ruined it however and that is too bad the acting is top notch especially from angel and murray and the really funny scenes are worth noting still if you are going think dumb think dumb all the way through ok at least the farrelly brothers got back on track mary or would still be little bit irked

shagadellic groovy baby smashing adorn the page ad for this movie tabbed as the comedy in america as of may th did we attend the same movie at minutes it seemed overlong like snl skit on steroids and at any length it seemed unfunny yes the sets and costumes were an interesting exaggeration of pop frills and yes the concept dealing s secret agentpop icon played myers awakened from his cryogenic slumber battle his arch enemy dr evil also played myers in the present day had great deal of potential fun costumes and scenery and potential do not movie make so lets throw in hefty dose of bathroom humor do not get me wrong like good bubbles in the bathtub joke as much as the next person but have this type of humor be the funniest thing about your movie is waste of yuor talent and my money but the way things work these days in the movie business all has do is call itself the funniest and people will believe it do give this stars because of the sets costumes and sadly unmet potential

robin williams this time without beard returns drama in this sloppy sickly sweet fantasy few redeeming features apart from the incredible effects he plays chris nielsen who meets annie annabella sciora and promptly marries her they have two great kids who sadly die in car crash just when it could not get any worse chris gets killed in car crash and goes heaven where he meets his guide albert gooding jnr annie cannot take the grief anymore and kills herself all sounding like good fun so far the penalty for suicide is go hell and chris goes on mission try and rescue her using the help of the traveller max von sydow based on novel twilight zone writer richard matheson what dreams may come is clunky manufactured material doused extra load of sugar this is the worse spielberg spielberg never made everything is wrong about this movie the performances are forced and the audiences fail relate any of the characters williams puts on convincing upset face but that is all it is face there is no emotion behind it scioras performance is lazy and bogs down the whole she may look pretty but she cannot act max von sydow is k as the traveller if nothing special cuba gooding jnr thankfully adds some bounce his performance and is certainly the best performer in the it is shame that his character is so flat and and offers no room for improvement all the performers have work soppy script that tries it is best get some emotion going but never takes off the ground there are _some_ scenes could be real heartwarmers but the faceless characters do not help get anything out of the performers while films like t used great actors music and direction pull of masterful hearttugging scene what dreams may come is haphazard expecting the emotion come out of the scene automatically instead it is all rather boring sure the music is pretty michael kamen and the cinematography is not bad eduardo serra but there is something lacking the script does not help filled hopeless romantic clich and dud speeches richard matheson can write some awesome science fiction stories sadly this novel would look embarrassed in bargain bin let alone being converted into million vehicle for robin williams despite being set in heaven what dreams may come is mightily depressing the rushes happy ending but everything before this is very very sad and black just adds make the ending even more hopeless and stupid but there is one redeeming feature about this failure of movie the special effects heaven and hell are truly incredible places and the actors fit perfectly the virtual sets but despite this what dreams may come proves be nothing but the biggest disappointment of instead of raising questions about existence it raises boredom sadly recommend you give this miss better luck next time robin david wilcock review you know for kids norville barnes

the catch phrase for disneys rocket man is one spoken fred randall harland williams the bumbling idiot computer programmer turned astronaut who continuously wreaks havoc everywhere he goes it was not me he proclaims over and over as the aftermath of his stupidity brings about looks of disgust from the others well when it comes this movie being as horrible as it is williams cannot take all the blame but he sure cannot justify himself his own simple tag line either fred has dreamed of space travel since he was young boy turning the clothes dryer into mock space shuttle and staring out wideeyed at poster of the earth as yearold fred has not grown up much but at least he is somewhat closer his goal now designing astronaut software for nasa when an astronaut for an upcoming mission mars becomes injured nasa calls on the person who knows the programming inside and out fill the void fred yes although he is an obviously klutzy moron nasa does not think twice about throwing him into rigorous training program so he can assist one of the most important events the space program and time itself has ever known for the first part of the we watch as fred takes on the training program much like an amusement park he laughs he screams but he never once breaks sweat or views the preparation as anything more than childs play his passive approach the program eventually leads many recordbreaking feats much the dismay of cocky counterpart mission commander captain overbeck william sadler who once held the records overbeck will regretfully accompany fred and two others the red planet one being astronaut julie ford the stupids jessica lundy and the other being chimpanzee who is much more civilized than our antagonizing protagonist from here on out we are subjected one lame gag after another dealing snot laxatives and flatulence you know standard kid movie material almost sounding like poor james stewart impressionist williams is awful in his first starring role we get the feeling that if jerry lewis and peewee herman were related and produced an inbred offspring williams would be it while he is not as annoying as other actors who cater zany stupid comedy he is just as unlikeable say it more understandably jim carrey might annoy you more but this guy is even less funny why because while he possesses the stupidness needed pull off such role his performance is too understated and boring classic comedic dunces were generally oblivious their own idiocy stan laurel for example was so innocent in all his troublemaking that we were immediately fond of him peter sellers as inspector clouseau was so selfassured and confident that when he did something as simple as trip it was humor at it is best williams on the other hand cannot garner the pity he needs make us love him in all his antiglory as for the rest of the cast including some bigger names in smaller roles beau bridges and shelley duvall nobody is worth watching whatsoever this is just another example of the fastfood equivalent of cinema massproduced less than mediocre over priced and hard stomach giving it oneandahalf stars is extremely generous but even will admit laughing few times the amazing thing is that even in theater packed little kids laughter was something rarely heard even from the children must admit that it gave me more respect for the kids when they did not crack up over every little thing then again maybe they were asleep some people might think critics are harsh on kid movies claiming adults are not the targeted audience and therefore are not meant and will not enjoy them sadly it is also true that kids will enjoy almost anything if it is presented right twohour still shot of dog cartoonish voice over could entertain lot of toddlers out there but would that make it as artistic as beauty and the beast could easily do the same thing and saying that parents perspective is not important is quite poor theory have when they are the ones who take the kids these films in the first place

based on the novel set in joseph conrad victory spins tale of pair of lovers heyst william dafoe and alma irene jacob who seek refuge on heysts isolated island however their idyllic world begins crumble upon the arrival of mr jones sam neil martin ricardo rufus sewell and their servant pedro graziano marcelli who have come steal heysts rumoured plunder while the novel is largely complex in characterization the sadly transposes conrads characters into lacklustre leads the most disappointing being heyst himself conrads heyst adheres religiously his late fathers ways of detachment and isolation his ascetic lifestyle is thrown into question when he meets alma helpless orchestra girl who charms him her voice the struggle embrace the arrival of alma into his solitude however is lost in mark peploes director and writer diluted version of heyst without properly establishing the crucial details of heysts character all that is left of conrads main character is very shallow treatment of his internal conflict between detachment and human involvement on the one hand actualizing the subtext is mammoth task though not impossible but on the other hand dafoes flat acting cannot be excused as an attempt at stoicism in the end we are supposed witness heyst renounce his philosophy and finally come an understanding of what it is love another the final transformation while perceptible lacks the cathartic revelation is undeniable in conrads novel its absence in the is unforgivable the seems more concerned about moving the plot along when so much has yet be said about the relationship between the two complete strangers alma is supposed have overcome great emotional barriers in the relationship namely heysts underlying philosophy of detachment heyst himself grapples the struggle against heysts ignorance of true human involvement accounts for much of the greatness of almas love for him jacob fairskinned gentle and yet passionate handles the role precision detailing nuances where possible unfortunately she is let down superficial script the couples relationship develops too hastily leaving all subtlety effaced and replaced blatant showandtell approach all we know of the characters are mostly explained their lines alone this is unsatisfactory when so much of the turmoil experienced the two stem from their buried thoughts and emotions the sketchy handling of their relationship stands out as sorely as dafoes american accent an inappropriate one since heyst spent most of his life in london the other characters such as schomberg jean yanne the owner of hotel and mr jones sam neill also fall short of conrads meticulous characterization while schomberg should have been more menacing and vindictive mr jones should have been portrayed as something more of an enigma sam neils caricature of slightly stout effeminate and softspoken gentlemanatlarge nullifies the effect intended conrad who describes mr jones as an insolent spectre on leave from hades endowed skin and bones and subtle power of terror poor characterization aside kudos goes rufus sewell for his excellent portrayal of ricardo secretary mr jones reckless ruffian capable of murder sewell his cockney accent and large expressive green eyes becomes the true terror of the unholy trinity masterminding deceitful plans behind jones back at the same time we are entertained the foolhardiness of his plans despite the authentic setting and marvellous cinematography bruno de keyzer very few images are left behind for us savour after the has ended sourabaya and its surrounding islands and volcanoes may have their charm but mean nothing once the fails capture the essence of an epic is what victory deserves be the delicately interwoven complexities in the love story are lost an inadequate production at the end of the we are told that perhaps almas victory was in teaching heyst how love hollow victory indeed the flying inkpots rating system wait for the video little creaky but still better than staying at home gotcha pretty good bring friend amazing potent stuff perfection see it twice

a couple of criminals mario van peebles and loretta devine move into rich familys house in hopes of conning them out of their jewels however someone else steals the jewels before they are able get them writer mario van peebles delivers clever script several unexpected plot twists but director mario van peebles undermines his own high points haphazard camera work editing and pacing it felt as though the should have been wrapping up at the hour mark but alas there was still more minutes go daniel baldwin cannot believe am about type this gives the best performance in the outshining the other talented members of the cast r

chill factor is carbon copy of speed one notable exception instead of speeding bus we now have an ice cream truck the truck is driven arlo cuba gooding jr and mason skeet ulrich who have been instructed dying scientist transport deadly chemical weapon military base the name of fort mcgruder this particular weapon nicknamed elvis must be kept below temperature of degrees or else the shockwave will gooiffy everything in mile radius that would be pretty nasty the power of elvis is revealed in the opening scene as dr richard long david paymer conducts test on an isolated tropical island long accidentally melts soldiers and defoliates virtually the entire island due an enormously miscalculated safety distance the commanding officer general brynner peter firth is sentenced years in prison for the murder of his troops upon his release the general is intent on tracking the good doctor down snatching elvis and selling the weapon the highest international bidder protecting the fate of the world is drifting hamburger flipper ulrich and feisty ice cream delivery man gooding jr who must elude brynners men and get elvis safety at fort mcgruder all the while of course they must keep the weapon below degrees this proves be tricky among the wild adventures arlo and mason partake in is trip down treecovered mountainside in boat and fist fight on top of moving vehicle they also crack few dozen witty retorts that we are supposed find amusing put it simply will use clever pun chill factor should be put on ice director hugh johnson has mixed elements from speed broken arrow and the lethal weapon series create lifelessly bland cocktail of chase movie when there is some occasional action the audience seems oddly detached from it perhaps that is because we have already waded through pool of clich and boring dialogue all material that is been used before and lot more spice take the villains for example they are typical stereotypes of every terrorist that has ever walked the silver screen they speak lines that have been recycled profusely from one movie the next divulge important plot details while holding their enemies at gunpoint and act in very predictable ways the tagteam of gooding jr and ulrich sounds much more exciting than it is frankly am not sure can accept cuba as an ice cream man suppose it is better than him dressed like giant hot dog selling jumbo frankfurters on street corner gooding displays one single emotion in this movie is frequently on display in lines like i am gonna get on yo ass like last years underwear and the incessant sputtering of oh sh this is virtually the same character he played in jerry maguire and as good as it gets but where gooding was once an exciting actor he now seems dull and endlessly monotonous at least he is bit more captivating than ulrich who has all the films worst dialogue but does nothing noticeable enliven his character the supporting cast includes every personality you expect pop up is also wasted be fair there are few brief moments of serviceable action and did chuckle few times one example is when ulrich an employee at darlenes diner is at the counter when brynner walks through the door you own this place the general asks yeah ulrich says they call me darlene these little tidbits of humor are mainly welcome in this weak disappointing wreckage of an action as speed clone it could have benefited from lot more suspense and perhaps god forbid even some decent writing sadly walked away from chill factor only wondering how much fun it could have been

warning the following review contains spoilers cast gary sinise don cheadle connie nielsen jerry oconnell kim delaney tim robbins elise neal jill teed jody thompson bill timoney written jim thomas john thomas and graham yost directed brian depalma running time minutes the first big event movie of turns out be anything but gary sinise stars as an astronaut who is removed from mars mission when his astronaut wife maggie kim delaney becomes ill and passes away don cheadle is then given the mission along russian couple and young hotshot when strange whirlwind shot from the top of mars mountain range attacks the crew of the mission sinise and robbins convince their superior let them neilsen and oconnell perform rescue mission for whatever crew might be remaining what they discover on the surface of the planet will dramatically change their lives forever although no one watching the will come away profoundly affected before ever saw the was aware of the promotional campaign dr pepper every time would see bottle of the soft drink the mission mars logo was emblazoned upon it little did know that the plot would be taking back seat the product placement of the drink and several other products dr pepper saves the day at one point and dream sequenceflashback features jerry oconnell shoving mms in our face these are but couple of the ridiculous examples of product placement scattered throughout the clich are also the order of the day mission mars dialogue and character motivations are all lifted directly from countless other science fiction films that have all done it better and more style even independence day lifted all of it is premises from other scifi films was better than this and do not like independence day films like space odyssey the abyss and close encounters of the third kind are all blatantly stolen from and poorly at that there is even sequence where rover is traveling through canyon and could not help but whisper utinni myself and wait for jawa quickly hide in the rocks before the rover could get glimpse of it this also features one of my alltime least favorite movie clich the he would have wanted you have this moment where one character gives another trinket that yet another character is established as constantly having and is usually made fun of the character who ends up getting all sappy over it later on scenes like these always bother me when they come out of nowhere in regular films but in as clich ridden as this it is particularly irritating ennio morricones music is usually considered be some of the best stuff in the projects he works on but here it is dreadfully overbearing his music sounds like it came straight out of vincent price movie in certain scenes at other times his music is unbearably overdramatic one sequence involving daring spacewalk rescue is given particularly cheesy sting when it is discovered that the grappling hook device used for the rescue will not reach its intended target mission mars is push button filmmaking the greatest extreme events are set into motion that are obvious anyone who has ever seen movie and seem like they are just there evoke an emotional response in the audience we are apparently supposed be upset that tim robbins character removes his helmet in deep space and kills himself save his wife but felt extreme boredom coupled twinge of disinterest what makes it all worse is that fact that there is no real reason that robbins character needs turn himself into popsicle except invoke an emotional response could think of at least one way save him and the nasa clowns in this are supposed be smarter than am during the finale when we are finally introduced the translucent conehead kittyfaced aliens that we ostensibly sprung from we are presented some of the most ridiculously cartoonish cgi ever put just slightly worse than the plane crash at the end of air force one or the hell scenes in spawn brief history lesson about where we came from is proffered then sinise is whisked away be the rest of our people he does this because his late wife proclaims in video he watches early on that this is chance step foot where no one else has from the press have been seeing this receive it is apparent that mission mars will be dying quick death at the theater am sure the first weekend or two will be huge but once word gets out people will stop going let us just hope the upcoming red planet is better than this and is not hurt the negativity this is generating would venture say it will not be worse than this waste of time pg

retrospective city of the living dead review mike watson copyright mike watson once heard someone describe the films of italian schlock horror director lucio fulci as dimwitted and golly just about all other words fail me when confronted dog like city of the living dead although the late fulci managed some rather good thrillers in his career this is not one of them two points in the movies favour the impressive camerawork of sergio salvati and occasionally evocative score fabio frizzi keep things from falling totally into the abyss but and large city of the living dead is failure and like most cinematic failures it comes down bad writing dumb performances and lousy direction the story starts in new york when during seance medium katherine mccoll sees vision of priest hanging himself in the town of dunwich massachusetts for reasons we will not go into here this opens the gates of hell must be closed all saints day or the dead will rise and walk the earth the medium apparently dies of fright during the seance but awakens in her coffin in the graveyard the next day and is rescued crusty old journalist christopher george that scene in itself is howler why would you bust open coffin large pick axe when you know someone is alive inside and do not cadavers have various things stuffed in them and drained out of them before they are buried anyway off the two of them go dunwich save the world where various grisly goingson are already happening as all saints day approaches fulcis graphic gore is in evidence once again but here it only serves further highlight the films flimsy script and plodding direction the dialogue in all manner of speaking is unspeakable not bad in the quotable sense like an ed wood but bad in its sheer dullness or blatantly obvious lets explain the plot type approach mccoll does not have clue who her character is deadly serious one minute frivolous the next she at times is genuinely hard watch and the geezer the actors name escapes me who plays the town psychiatrist becomes even harder stomach than mccoll as the progresses christopher georges performance is salvageable but he gets his brains ripped out in the end zombie and we do not care in fact we do not care for anyone in city of the living dead though in other fulci films that has not mattered so much when he was on form as stylist and an ideas man as he was in the beyond as director some of fulci idiosyncrasies are incredibly silly and annoying here he constantly uses extreme closeups of peoples eyes ridiculous technique suggests an attempt convey the emotion that his dialogue and actors are not capable of and despite some gruesome violence he barely manages single scare in the entire longtime collaborator fabio frizzi talented but always erratic offers patchy soundtrack that veers between eerie gothic death marches and woefully inappropriate electropop that is quite frankly embarrassing fulcis other films of this period may be flawed house the cemetery the beyond the black cat but they are nonetheless films more inspiration atmosphere and better dialogue than this turkey for completists only

you know the plot dimwit shady past is seduced into committing crime only be doublecrossed fatal femme in palmetto the dimwit is harry barber woody harrelson reporter who is just been released from prison he was framed the gangsters and corrupt officials he was investigating enter la femme rhea malroux elisabeth shue the sexy young wife of the richest man in palmetto florida rolf hoppe she and her stepdaughter odette chlo sevigny have plot extort from the old man harry will kidnap odette after groping both women harry agrees as everyone except harry can see he is being set up as fall guy sure enough before long harry has dead body in his trunk and the cops on his tail his brotherinlaw tom wright an assistant da has hired harry be the press liaison for the case so harry gets front row seat for his own manhunt and we get watch him sweatliterally there are several plot twists of coursea couple of them even took me surprise apparently every woman in palmetto is raving horndog and they are on harry like he is the only bone in the kennel shue vamps so broadly that expected tex averys wolf show up her incredible performance in leaving las vegas seems have been fluke here she could easily be mistaken for melanie griffith shues character is supposed be savvy schemer but she comes off as brainless bimbo in addition shue and sevigny the kennel includes gina gershon who filled the dimwitwithashadypast role in bound as harrys girlfriend nina when harry gets out of jail she licks his face now there is horndog the parts are so overplayed that little push palmetto could have been an overthetop parody of noir la romeo is bleeding as it is it is best watched at am on showtime the love scenes seem have been written for one of that channels soft porn programs anyway palmetto has wellknown director volker schl ndorff who is best known for his adaptations of major literary works especially the tin drum suppose he must have been drawn this plotbynumbers script the same admiration for classic noir that led scorsese remake cape fear schl ndorff tries hardhe makes an interesting motif out of the ubiquitous palmetto bugsbut nothing can freshen up this stale script

the cometdisaster flick is disaster alright directed tony scott top gun it tells the story about an asteroid the size of texas caught on collision course earth and you thought that dinky little comet in deep impact was trouble jeez after great opening in an american spaceship plus the city of new york are completely destroyed comet shower nasa detects the said asteroid and go into frenzy they hire the worlds best oil driller bruce willis and send him and his crew up into space fix our globel problem that is like sending mouse into cat carrier is not it the action in armageddon are so over the top nonstop and too ludicrous for words had sigh and hit my head my notebook couple of times was not alone plus see wonderful actor like billy bob thornton is like armageddon is waste of the actors talents the is just reel show off bunch of snazzy fx shots the only real reason for making this was somehow outperform deep impact producer jerry bruckheimer fails armageddon

years ago robin williams made _jumanji_ brilliant achievement in special effects but travesty on nearly every other level the same can be said for _what dreams may come_ boring illogical weepiewannabe that left my senses numb do not get me wrong love breathtaking special effects and pulsepounding imagery _brazil_ is on my personal top ten _the city of lost children_ is great because of its outlandish scenarios even love __ and _last year at marienbad_ being in the minority amidst my friends _what dreams may come_ imagery aside has little daring thought complement its imagery the daring thought it _does_ have is never fully realized it is idea of plot is so lukewarm that it insults the bigger questions it raises it would have been better if the filmmakers rid the of the live action sequences put on an electronica soundtrack and sell it as one of those popular _minds eye_ videos robin williams plays chris nielsen who dies too prematurelynot only in the story but before we have chance really know and care for him the director vincent ward and the screenwriter ronald bass have chosen tell his life story in flashbacks while having the foreground story focus on his experience the afterlife big mistake it would have been far better take the halfhour or so needed tell his life story first ala _it is wonderful life_ so that can build up respect for him so could know and possibly care for him his children and his longsuffering wife played superbly annabella sciorra instead the filmmakers insult my intelligence rushing into the story expecting that the grow in depth as it progresses it does not so in the afterlife chris learns that people still do not meet god that our thoughts are reality and time does not exist there hmm ill grant one of those silly giant ideas for the sake of the narrative the not meeting god part still irks at me but perhaps there was no possible way it and give it due respect that said this alternate reality still makes no possible sense read on chris wife commits suicide since suicides go hell chris would be separated from his wife forever the important question is is heaven really heaven if you are separated from the one you love good question and like good thoughtprovoking questions dont like it when the filmmakers deviate from the question _loathe_ it when the filmmakers deviate from the question so that the becomes popular rescue especially rescue does not take its underlying premise seriously _really_ loathe it when its story is no longer run logic but special effects hey chris did you forget your thoughts are _real_ they are more _real_ than the physical world according the newage screenplay so why dont you conjure up positive thoughts of annie and let that run wild and then she would appear before you and you two would live in happy bliss for eternity because there would be no movie thats why and albert the angel played miscast cuba gooding jr says bluntly thats fantasy umm if your thoughts are more real than the physical then fantasy is not fantasy but real surely some eastern meditation specialist would be able tell you that and if you happen think that you are an unimaginative person and that your thoughts are not big enough sustain you for eternity well in all due respect that is why do not subscribe this theology all due respect another idea based on time pause does not exist here so chris spend your eternity annie as she is on earth reliving your favorite memories or hang out her when she was growing up youve got eternity perhaps you can hang around long enough and learn not freak her
