the original _babe_ was my favorite movie of sleeper hit that transcended its target audience being surprise commercial and critical success it had no marketing tieins limited its final take thus babe arrives budget greater than the money made in babe plush dolls vending machines hawking tshirts and macys thanksgiving day balloons arrive for holiday moneygrubbing too late this is sad review write because babe not only does _not_ live up the original but it does not even come fraction of it should not expect that sequels modern fairy tales match their predecessors magic but this tries too hard and loses its charm consider driver applying the accelerator great intensity unaware that his car is in neutral imagine me if you will _scream_s jamie kennedy explaining the rules for sequels like babe there must be _more_ talking animals there must be _more_ slapstick comedy there must be _more_ songs for those mice sing that is cute keep the story cards break up the action that is cute too even though the pig gets wise made no sense given the context of that story partition there must be action however illogical that will conjure up pivotal scenes from the original the trademark song that nobody remembers the words the baaramewe secret code the thatll do pig thatll do now throw in the limitations james cromwell now hot commodity has limited time on the set or maybe he did not approve of the script christine cavanaugh the voice of the original babe demands more money paltry considering the million budget out g daily comes in noticable results george miller the director is more wellknown for his dark futuristic mad max films and his twilight zone segment not for kiddie fare and no he did not direct that _andre_ in the special effects are impressive _but limited_ babe talks but most of the time from single shot repeated over and over again babe is center screen looking straight into the camera happy smirkregardless of whether he is happy or scared or tired season now the original elements as we will find out are straight from the screenwritingishell bin change the venue into the big city this has been praised as wildly original excuse me did not _home alone_ do this several years ago how about the muppets even _the bad news bears_ travelled tokyo sorry no dice side note give the city fairytale look george miller crafted fantastical fantasyland that merges the landmarks of the worlds great cities and yes it _is_ impressive but this too is overused repeating the same view over and again on multiple occasions and for the most part babe _remains in the hotel_ ii given the limitations of cromwell the human element is taken over the boss wife played magda szubanski stretch she is not lead actresstype she is not funny enough in her physical comedy and she is simply embarrassing in some of her pratfalls have her arrested falsely on drug charges have her accidentally incite riot biker dudes and scantily clad babes have her bounce around on bungee cord at prestigious benefit dinner was hoping for little smirk during these scenes but felt sorry for the embarrassment that she put herself in am restraining myself from talking about the dark nature of the the violence the scene where pit bull dangles from the bridge head submerged underwater even the best fairy tales have bit of the macabre in it as the brothers grimm have demonstrated no my problem is the story or lack thereof _babe_ is sent out save the hoggett farm but once in the city that story is forgotten being goodnatured pig in the midst of the cynicism of his environs is nice but other than rescue that aforementioned pit bull what did babe actually _do_ without giving the ending away the farm is saved from leftfield quirk that had nothing do the pig speaking of pig or pigpigpigpigpig the word pig is so overused had they changed it an expletive and had the pig be al pacino could have been watching _scarface_ this is screenwriting further cannot explain the deep gnaw at my gut in the many scenes where accidents happen good people in fantastically elaborate setups had it been cartoon and the victim be an equivalent of elmer fudd maybe my reaction would have been softened but farmer hoggett his wife an elderly mickey rooney much too irreverent quick splice those singing mice into those scenes the is not colossal failure did like glenne headleys schmoozy chimpanzee liked the pink poodle the dog on the cart who momentarily thinks he is in dog heaven and weird looking guy who may have been doublycast as an airport employee and judge but most of the time was looking down in boredom or in embarrassment over the hackedup script them singing mice those chapter partitions the proficient acting of the animals none of these can compensate for story let me spoil the final scene farmer hoggett looks at pig proud says thatll do pig thatll do that is it hope did not ruin it for you but tell me this what the heck did that pig _do_

at first was intrigued the strange cast and odd creatures on the galaxy quest trailer but that was before saw the now my view has completely changed it is time embrace for impact because this is very bumpy ride the story begins the cast of galaxy quest including jason nesmith tim allen alexander dane alan rickman gwen demarco sigourney weaver signing autographs at convention they meet fans who dress up in costumes fans who worship the ground they walk on and group of aliens called thermians who believe that they are the ultimate saviors against the dreaded alien colony lead sarris robin sachs of course they are unaware of this until they actually begin performing their duties and meet the ugly aliens themselves thus begins the long adventure help save the thermians the movie plays like really bad star trek episode in fact it is worse do not even think trekkies will appreciate this weak spoof because quite frankly it is just not funny all the jokes are basically collected observations from the series one such continuous joke involves simple crew member who believes he will die in space because no extra on the tv show ever lives as proven in the star trek series creative jokes like this may seem like clever idea but not when they are used death person can only take so much we do not need be tortured especially when you have pay for it it is pretty bad when even tim allen is pitiful it is not like expected an oscar worthy performance form him but few laughs would have been helpful speaking of acting fine talents were wasted as well sigourney weaver was here show cleavage well at least it worked it is pretty bad when the only entertaining value of the is cleavage it just shows you how disgraceful the really is alan rickman however was not so lucky after his last hit dogma he embarrasses himself doing this sloppy mess it is just shame see talented actors and actresses throw their ability away when the could not get any worse thankfully some nice special effects pop up like many big blockbusters armageddon the haunting name few they rely heavily on effects help boost the films box office results times it works but unfortunately we have shell out hard earned money and suffer through this junk when will it stop am getting tired of being suckered into seeing such trash it may look fine and dandy but we need at least have story is that too much ask obviously it is when galaxy quest finally ends it literally crash lands aside from the impressive looking creatures from industrial light and magic it is an embarrassment the cast and it is embarrassing the science fiction genre it is not the least bit fun nor was it entertaining the only place where this movie belongs is infinity and beyond

the makers of spawn have created something almost as vacuous as this summers other comic book adaptation batman and robin both films make the mistake of adapting for the screen not only the look of their graphic counterparts but also their monosyllabic dialogue and emptyheaded character motivations in panelsized morsels implausible plots and rambo esque dialogue are often overshadowed the artwork but on thirty foot silver screens it is much more difficult dismiss the shallowness behind the pretty pictures spawn is ostensibly about an assassin named simmons white who is framed corporate baddie played without irony sheen then set on fire and left for dead though the movie skimps on the next few plot points heres what could determine said assassin then becomes the leader of satans army under the tutelage of flatulating midget named clown leguizamo grating as always he is renamed for reasons unbeknownst spawn and granted really cool costume that enables him become something of human chameleon but when spawn spies on birthday party for his child he realizes that he cannot be the evil superdemon he is expected be and he sets about avenging his untimely death typical of summer blockbusters spawn is an effectsladen ninety minute rock video while the visions of hell are laughably crude think the virtual reality sequences of the lawnmower man spawns prehensile outfit and the action sequences are truly something behold but the storytelling is completely lacking in emotion spawn longs for his wife but they do not have single scene together before simmons death conflict who will triumph is not anybodys guess and believability not that expected it so many questions are left unanswered and am sure they will not be addressed in the inevitable sequel while last years the crow city of angels suffered similar problems its narrative was lazy and somewhat incoherent it had atmosphere spare and genuine moments of hypnotic power spawn is an inyourface screaming banshee of these guys know how graft comic book onto celluloid but they have not the faintest idea how make movie

phaedra cinema the distributor of such neverheardof classics as soft toilet seats trailer the movie and the one armed boxer vs the flying guillotine has sneaked its latest release the sculptress into few theaters this weekend hoping cash in on handful of halloween holidaygoers looking for right good scare the sculptress is scary proposition all right but not in the way its producers intended from the outset it is easy see why some of the larger more reputable chains are not carrying it the looks like straighttovideo release from the early that is been dusted off not very carefully and reissued in theatrical format that staple of schlocky zmovies jeff fahey the lawnmower man plays washedup shakespearean actor lacking in some basic people skills when he is not reliving his glory days in his ramshackle nob hill apartment screaming scotchinduced hamlet soliloquies well into the night he is out and about on the streets of san francisco stalking loose women faheys dobie sizes up his victims actually just one peep show performer name of sylvie dressed like one of the guys from kraftwerk and approaches them in the ridiculous attire of bavarian count replete cane dark glasses and false beard just in time for halloween do you have castle sylvie asks dobie seductively when he flashes the bulging contents of his wallet outside coffee shop jah ze many turrets is dobies perplexing reply the real star of the and use that term extremely loosely is katie wright who plays the sculptress of the title sarah is new in town studying at the prestigious sf art institute under the mentorship of genius frenchman played the beretwearing patrick bauchau that is convenient because sarah would one day like live and work in paris you will not believe the films final shot its cheesy eiffel tower backdrop and rosemarys baby inspired imagery bauchaus character criticizes sarahs work publicly her clay busts keep turning into gargoylesperhaps she is possessed an incubus but he still manages talk her into dinner whereas wright does decent english accent her talents pretty much end there on the other side of the wall dobies troubled past is succinctly summarized in scene in he thumbs through an old scrapbook of newspaper clippings headings like actor delivers stunning macbeth actor courted studio actor renounces for priesthood and prostitute fingers priest in sex scandal the films plot could have been just as easily condensed artist moves in next door shakespearean psychopath yawns ensue so dobie rants and raves and sarah chips away at large blocks of granite till way past their bedtimes late in the their paths finally cross mindnumbing results nobody else in the apartment complex appears mind all the racket but one old dear does go ballistic when sarahs bathtub overflows no we do not see wright in the tub or fahey for that matter and the gore quotient is virtually nil so for horror the sculptress is surprisingly lacking the only thing worth looking at is san francisco and writerdirector ian merrick manages make even it look dreary windswept and deserted the sculptress is not even bad enough be fun luckily limited release has made it easy avoid

here is movie that sadly follows the hong kongrecipe of moviemaking and storytelling the letter these kinds of movies are marked an eyeopening sequence that introduces us the main characters lifeanddeath plot in these characters become involved the inclusion of host of inconsequential characters ridiculous subplots and sunglasswearing henchmen that is not say that do not like hong kong influenced movies however it is quite obvious that these moviemakers have not clue that the american filmgoer needs more than hiphoptalking thugs and stupid sight gags observe the opening sequence band of hitmen are about storm an apartment led melvin mark wahlberg and cisco lou diamond phillips they are waiting for their partner cut off the power so that they can storm the apartment the help of infrared goggles however their partner is unsure of cable cut he is undecided this happens for about seconds the audience finds some humor in his foolishness the lights suddenly go out cisco is surprised and says whoa let us go and they storm the apartment in very nicely executed sequence the big hit of the title refers kidnapping that happens quarter of the way through the needing cash cisco devises plan kidnap the daughter china chow of wealthy japanese industrialist jiro nishi however the daughter is also the goddaughter of paris avery brooks who is ciscos and melvins boss infuriated and insufferable paris commands cisco uncover the mastermind of the kidnapping during his investigation cisco singles out melvin as the ringleader and paris orders his capture and execution melvin must now find way stay alive the way do you know how the investigation takes place ciscos partner makes the ransom phone call believing that his call will not be traced because of trace buster that prevents tracing but mr nishi has trace buster buster counter that ciscos partner has trace buster buster buster but nishi has trace buster buster buster buster and so on there is no doubt that this is an interesting world in they live and there are lots of issues that we would like know more about how does melvin justify his profession his fiancee what goes on among this clique why is cisco at odds melvin there is actually lot of potential material that could have been explored but it seems that no effort is made go in that direction and instead we are given notsoengrossing plot filled oneliners silly sight gags extraneous subplots and tomfoolery and have not even mentioned his financees visiting parents who want them separate nor melvins mistress nor the pimplefaced video clerk demanding the return of an overdue video and on and on and on if the big hit signals the future of hong kong style movies that are made for american audiences then shoot me now

after the huge success of the exorcist in sequel was inevitable and sadly like most horror fims that make money the filmmakers decided make ridiculous sequel that makes absolutely no sense at all and me was extremely pointless wasting linda blair and max von sydow completely needless dumb sequel flopped in the box office and never gained much success though it is voted as one of the worst sequels of all time agree start the story it is four years later and regan is being tormented memories of what used be now priest played richard burton is trying figure out why this demon tried possess regan and now the demon somehow wants possess her again maybe she was good or something now they must try stop this demon from taking over regans body before it is too late some of the bad things exorcist ii has in it is linda blair she had no need revive her character and she is really terrible in this she brings it down lull and in places it seems like it just stops in its place and does not go anywhere louise fletcher is alright for what it is worth but she could have done lot better than this the direction john boorman is that of confused stylish nature that really could not figure out in fact had no idea what was going on in this the script was jumbled the plot was jumbled and the ending is just laugh out loud hilariosly bad for those exorcist fans who have not seen this one recommend renting it actually gave this one high rating if it were any worse it would have deserved zero pumpkins went easy on it however because of the fact that it has bit of good direction but nothing else im not saying like the now so dont start going anywhere bad bad bad movie

the people who populate the movie are shallow selfabsorbed and selfindulgent in other words they perfectly mirror the era as well as the movie this feature depicts is the story of that wellpublicized new york disco studio the inplace in the where anybody who was anybody went be ogled photographed and pampered the difficulty was written and directed mark christopher is that his script takes no point of view christopher neither condemns nor glorifies the legendary excesses that were studio hallmark he keeps an uninvolved distance thus keeping us from forming any emotional attachment any of the protagonists the movies one main asset is the surprising performance mike myers as steve rubell the famous owner of the nightspot he is part rebel part dreamer part shrewd entrepreneur he is smart enough and childlike enough pander the dreams and desires of his clientele yet stupid enough brag on tv about hiding profits from the irs myers in his first straight character part is in turn appealing and appalling at one moment he can try pressure male employee into sexual situation then at the next moment apologize for his bad behavior and offer the young man handful of cash the story is told shane oshea ryan phillippe new jersey lad who dreams of crossing the river the big apple shades of john travoltas brooklynbound tony in saturday night fever eventually shane does come new york attracts rubells eye and is admitted the promised land his looks get him job as busboy and he is later promoted the prestigious position of bartender where he mixes and makes drinks for the rich and famous shanes dream is meet soap star julie black neve campbell fellow garden stater but both characters are so sketchily drawn that even when they do hook up it is no big deal the chemistry between shane and julie is nonexistent is very cold uninvolving movie it is all strobe lights and glitz all substance it is sort of like the musical era it covers

i have always been kevin kline fan silverado fish called wanda pirates of penzance and even his hamlet on pbs great performances the minute saw the trailer for this resolved see it besides the fact that kline starred it looked like hilarious got sucker punched the trailer an extent however as also thought wow if there is this much funny stuff in the trailer there must be ton of laughs in the rest of the oops packed up the wife and headed les cinemas del diablo my name for our local multimultiplex the began the concerns an englishdrama teacher at suburban high school named howard brackett he loves poetry and great literary works but his class is more interested in his famous former student played matt dillon would put in his name but my wife will not let me take notes during movie and have forgotten it they continually interrupt his long poetic expositions fawning questions about him brackett has been engaged another teacher played joan cusack for three years and has finally gotten up the gumption marry her the wedding however becomes the big question mark of the as this famous student of his says during the live oscar broadcast that brackett is homosexual kline spends most of the first twothirds of the frantically trying convince everyone that he is not the whole town begins examine every detail of his life and begins identifying all those things that confirm his sexual preference his closest friends do not help matters bringing nothing but barbara streisand laserdiscs his stag party there are some genuinely hilarous moments one involving tape geared towards helping men assert their masculinity kline is hounded gay reporter played tom selleck who waxes poetic on the benefits of coming out while at the same time doing his best exploit the situation for his own sleazy tabloid machinations the movie moves along fine and slowly builds the climax of the wedding kline stands at the altar and is asked take his vows if you want be surprised do not read am going reveal the ending instead of saying do in front of his parents and most of the town and even some cameras he says am gay this is where the movie in my opinion falls apart most of the humor in the had come from klines insistence that he was straight while at the same time loving poetry and being senstivie guy dressing well and occaisionally acting prissy it reminded me of the effeminate heterosexual sketch from saturday night live it was funny it was sustainably funny and klines performance made it doubly so however after the wedding the drags on they should have attempted come quick conclusion but it then gets into the serious side of what he is done he reconciles his parents and his friends some of had turned on him there are several scenes seemed like waste of time the scene his mother and her friends was hilarious seemed pointless and the scene tom selleck in the bar joan seemed pointless finally even though am not catholic found the scene the priest be condescending the preist cannot believe that man was engaged for three years and had not consumated the relationship proclaiming brackett in the third person he is gay it got chuckle from the audience but was distracted it and began tire of the the time the wedding had come and gone found myself hoping it would be over soon much like this review you are saying overall if have quantify it say rising action gets and climax and falling action gets see it in economy time

a month ago wrote that speed was the worst have ever reviewed on paper did not know at the time that would soon encounter and despise batman robin has just overtaken speed as the picture least worthy of your attention this summer as directed joel schumacher who now specializes in batman sequels and john grisham adaptations and is not very good at either r is one long excuse for taco bell promotion the plot has mr freeze and poison ivy uma thurman planning take over gotham city and then the vorld as an oddly ineffective schwarzenegger states is weighted down repetitive asides about the nature of trust partnership blah blah blah but morals are not the point of this filmtopping each bloated confusing action scene next one is the garish art direction and overlit cinematography make this picture oddly comparable the trashy showgirls since when did gotham city become giant las vegas hotel only george clooney comes out on top he underplays nicely and pretends like he is in real movie

call hush stop or my mom will kill or mommy fearest or the hand that robs the cradle call it whatever you want but certainly do not see it unless you are in desperate need of bad movieinduced chuckle hush scores so many unintentional guffaws that it almost qualifies as guilty pleasure chalk its losses up frequent stupidity lapses and apparent postproduction tinkering it was supposed open about year ago the latter of appears have given hush sendoff that is downright infuriating it is too bad that hush is so laughable because the onscreen talent including the pairing of gwyneth paltrow and jessica lange is nothing laugh at paltrow and johnathon schaech play helen and jackson photogenic new york couple on their way spend christmas vacation at his wealthy welltodo familys horse farmestate kilronan jacksons mother martha lange runs kilronan all herself and her genteel southern hospitality makes helen feel welcome immediately even if her first meeting martha takes place while helen is in the altogether caught redhanded after bedroom romp her husbandtobe but it seems that marthas friendly smile masks much more threatening demeanor she is what you would call someone who loves too much martha eagerly deviously wants grandchild and then helen will be expendable as far as she is concerned if there is one reason catch hush it is lange she treats the pedestrian screenplay better than it deserves be treated injecting martha poorly written though she may be little empathy level out the psychoplaying field when she delves into marthas dark side predictable cliches chainsmoking staring in mirrors praying in confessional priest who is not there poking hole in helens diaphragm so she will become pregnant and she does abound but it is moderately entertaining junk because lange is such an interesting actress watch veteran performer nina foch is smart and tart as jacksons wheelchairbound paternal grandmother the rest of the cast looks ill and uncomfortable especially paltrow but can you really blame them the character relationships in hush hold certain amount of promise at least until their psychological impact is blown out of the water sheer stupidity idiotic situations martha yells at nearby horse so it will bolt up and knock helen over compliment idiotic dialogue why did you yell helen yells back at martha and the takes the form of one of the shoddier fill in the blankfromhell flicks ever made you can see through great deal of marthas actions and lies from their conception why do people who have known this woman for years longer than we have never figure things out does nobody communicate or read the newspaper in this town if any of her potential victims thought acted or behaved like normal people hush would be really short movie and then there is the climax and ending abruptly come when helen starts having contractions after eating some pound cake spiked laborinducing drug normally used on horses after really weird chase scene martha calmly knits in rocking chair while forcing helen give birth in bed all herself will not spoil what happens next except say that it is contradictory illogical and probably since am no doctor medically impossible the final scene offers no closure no resolution no confrontation whatsoever it is just there dangling amidst silent displeasure no one should like this ending regardless of their feelings on the preceding material perhaps hush title is plea silence its audiences likely bitter word of mouth while exiting the theater

a big busy boxing satire surprisingly paltry punch the great white hype stars samuel jackson as shameless boxing promoter whose plan boost sagging payperview revenues is invent white contender peter berg challenge his black heavyweight champ damon wayans the logic is that people will pay more see black vs white than black vs black he may be right in an absurdly accurate way but the does not give us reason care as scathing sports spoof hype is just that unfunny unfocused and at times just plain pointless as commentary on race relations it is even less effective the dialogue is the best of this mess lines like jon lovitz exclaiming cannot make caviar out of fish eggs writers tony hendra and ron shelton also do good on the street slang though we never hear enough of it the script is not strong enough though support the aggressive camera work of director reginald hudlin house party he comes across as absolute overkill the great white hype almost turns around at the end at the big match when hudlin attempts an extended gag of rockconcert proportions costumed dwarfs gangsta rappers and the champ dressed as death only then do we get glimpse of the spoof that should have been

i know there were times during this movie that laughed pretty hard the problem is cannot remember them as write this review that is not good sign in booty call jamie foxx is bunz character whom cannot really describe because do not know that much about him only know that he likes shoot dice on the sidewalk and that he does not like relationships just booty calls at three in the morning no questions no commitment bunz has best friend named rushon tommy davidson who seems be bunzs direct opposite on the straight and narrow and currently in longterm commitment whole seven weeks wow rushon wants finally sleep his girlfriend nikki tamala jones but for reason is not totally explained it is going happen after double date bunz and nikkis friend lysterine vivica fox who have never met make long story short the two couples pair off and spend the rest of the evening having their attempts do the deed spoiled nikkis obsession safe sex first she wants condoms so bunz and rushon go out and get them oh no they have be latex not lambskin back the store now they have got get dental dams or therell be no foreplay why are both couples stopped each time nikki makes demand nikki phones lysterine who lives across the hall and tells her she would better be making these demands too talk about coitus interruptus booty call is that does not know whether it wants be regular comedy or one of those overthetop comedies the difference between the two is that in the latter things constantly happen are so far removed from reality in this category for example you have ace ventura private eye on the mild side and airplane at the extreme there are times during booty call where the steps out of its shell and tries for this status but then too often quickly retreats the safety of convention it is disappointing and even worse distracting there are also instances where the screenplay takashi bufford and bootsie parker are those real names does not live up its potential as jokes are left unexploited or even ruined bad writing for instance there is scene where our main characters are in chinese restaurant bunz goes up an asian gangster and speaks him in fluent cantonese much everyones surprise however when asked how he learned the language he goes into this explanation of how he started picking up words from latenight kungfu films and soon gained mastery this negated the ludicrousness of the entire scene if on the other hand when asked how he learned speak chinese bunz simply replied kungfu movies and then moved on the joke would have been much more effective this is because it would have been totally unbelievable but funny because we know it is unbelievable explaining the point and trying make the ridiculous plausible the is not giving its viewers enough credit the inconsistency and uncertain believability unfortunately also raise other questions why are two such disparate people like bunz and rushon best friends why do rushon and nikki fix up bunz and lysterine if nikki is so obsessed safe sex why does not she have some condoms at her own apartment these questions are not answered the screenplay but are overlooked for the sole reason of moving the plot forward very noticeable quality of booty call is the prevalence of unnecessary foul language some movies use lot of swear words but use them under very justifiable circumstances as when they are employed consistent characters pattern of speech other films such as the recent jackie brown use them in ways that almost parody themselves booty call just sticks them in get laughs and it does not work they stick out like sore thumbs because there is almost no reason use them half of the scenes seem occur for no reason the chinese restaurant holdup at convenience store and trip the hospital seem have nothing do the story and are in there for filler this is surprising considering that the is less than eighty minutes long it is too bad that the core of the is not much better since it is comprised of sometimes funny but forgettable dialog refer you the first paragraph of this review

retelling the classic story of joan of arc has been popular trend this year earlier this may leelee sobieski played the passionate title role in the toprated miniseries that debuted on cbs and now director luc besson has delivered his version of the sweeping epic about the teenage girl supposedly sent god rescue france from the clutches of their enemies starring milla jovovich who is predominantly unconvincing as the heavenly messenger accused of being witch the messenger the story of joan of arc is disjointed and overblown historical reenactment that prevails merely as bloated mistreatment of the famous legend besson who is previous work includes the hyperactive scifi the fifth element perhaps entrusted bit too much faith in exwife jovovich because in the messenger the actress is drowning in pool of her own inexperience at first when reports were indicating that jovovich had been chosen for such demanding role was highly doubtful that her marginal talent could carry of such caliber after seeing the rousing trailer my hesitant optimism suddenly skyrocketed milla jovovich looked superb the hopeful propulsion of her stellar performance the messenger looked like timeless epic in the making timeless epic it is not besson is hesitant abandon his unique and flashy style and the story behind the messenger is not entirely suited his demands on the shoulders of bessons choppy and unexciting direction the dissipates into an uninspiring hodgepodge of poorly executed battle sequences and bizarre imagery there is no human exploration into the character of joan or jeanne jovovich merely rambles on about the power of god when we have little or no insight into her visionary objective jovivichs unsatisfying portrayal only helps lead the realization that besson sees jeanne as piece of spiritual cardboard she is just another special effect in this continuous visual feast jovovich does have few isolated moments of sheer power but mainly she looks lost quite frankly do not know of any actress who could successfully navigate her way through the messenger without major fumble the script is chockfull of laughable dialogue and unfortunate comedy as jeanne confronts the uncrowned king charles vii john malkovich and informs him of her heavenly intentions faye dunaway plays charles overbearing motherinlaw and dustin hoffman appears over twohours into the story as character dubbed the conscience all three actors juggle limited screen time although malkovich is uncharacteristically awful the battle scenes are extremely bloody but the presence of such jittery camera work they capture none of the excitement or finesse of something like braveheart there is particularly graphic and unsettling scene early on when jeanne as young girl watches in horror from closet as her older sister is murdered and then savagely raped bloodthirsty english soldier even his fellow troopers are petrified the messenger is also strictly s update on the classic story almost too it seems there is gratuitous use of the fword and barrage of slang terms like she is nuts sprinkled throughout the screenplay was halfexpecting jeanne invite her homeys come chill in her crib but it never happened there is also the familiar presence of bizarre besson humor but none of it comes even remotely close functioning properly it seems terribly misplaced but in catastrophe as jumbled and disjointed as the messenger almost everything does the musical score erric serra is spectacular and the set and production designs are continuously impressive if it was visual excellence that besson was striving for then he achieves his goal but the only time the dramatics come alive in the messenger is during the closing trial in jeanne is found guilty and burned at the stake during these moments the historical relevance and dramatic purpose of joan of arc reaches the audience albeit in faint stream of light that provokes little power or meaning it is just too delayed for besson revive his lifeless interpretation in he is always concerned the wrong aspects the messenger the story of joan of arc is an unlikely and unwelcome historical addition the shelf anyone searching for an entertaining epic is going be painfully slapped an overblown and confusing despite my original hopefulness milla jovovich is not going have worry about thanking the academy

violence is bad violence is ugly violence breeds yet more violence kids do not try this at home this weighty message is not the only barrier enjoying brother but it is certainly one of the largest written directed and starring the infamous takeshi kitano kikujiro sonatine brother is his first made outside his familial japan bringing the yakuza tradition los angeles yakuza translated for the average american is the japanese mafia if you piss family member off or dishonor yourself in any way the usual punishment is public display of selfmutilation usually resulting in the loss of limbs definition of dishonor can be anything from making stupid decision leaving one family for another it would be interesting know more about where these and other customs come from unfortunately the does not give too much of an explanation assuming its audience is aware of kitanos earlier work there are several shots that focus specifically on detailed tattoos that spread across the entire back of the yakuza members leading one assume they would be symbolic of something but you never know what then there is scene in man kills himself in front of rival in exchange for that rival joining the family granted this is one of the best scenes in the movie but it does not make lot of sense instead the two hours are basically spent watching the following people go out and shoot each other talk about it for tenplus minutes then go out and do it again the consistently repetitive discussion of territory during these moments involuntarily provokes yawning there are also plot details thrown in for no identifiable purpose all of the sudden yamamoto kitano has girlfriend he barely speaks her treats her like crap and then sends her away another missed opportunity considering it is such big deal for kitano bring his magic the united states is the combination of cultures rely too heavily on overused stereotypes though slow moving brother does have good elements the action scenes are well directed clearly defined and interesting watch some of the violence is more hinted at than shown produces the luscious squirm that one goes see such films for the actors would be more enticing if they had more do shirases masaya kato loud sarcastic coolness set against yamamotos quietly threatening attitude is truly an entertaining combination their moments together or apart steal the rest of the show also its credit brother tackles the cause and effect of crime realism life of crime is easy get sucked into the first reward of quick cash sure people get rich but they can also lose just as easily it is great moral great cast just not much substance back it up

lauded as genius many stanley kubrick commands superlative filmography that includes such criticallyacclaimed films as space odyssey clockwork orange lolita and dr strangelove or how learned stop worrying and love the bomb now sadly he is added eyes wide shut that impeccable body of work and his final is the first and only blot on his nearflawless copybook kubrick alas should have quit while he was ahead this muchpublicized psychosexual teaseathon its star billing of reallife marrieds tom cruise and nicole kidman is nothing more than one long twoandahalf hours long boring exercise that features kubrick operating talent wide shut kubrick faithless arthur schnitzlers novella dream story has confused eroticism nudity he has confused intellectualism talking slowly he has confused profundity pretentiousness in addition the director has made some strange casting choices leaving sydney pollack in and leaving accomplished performers harvey keitel and jennifer jason leigh out pollack the director of such boxoffice hits as tootsie and out of africa is normally solid in his occasional acting stints but here he is miserably out of his depth and there is not much depth begin unhappily there is not likely be directors cut of this determine whether the decision exorcise keitel and leigh was the right one in fact the exception of the stark blackandwhite credits snatches of baroque music on the soundtrack and many many grainy tracking shots down lavishlydecorated corridors there is none of kubricks trademark brilliance in this it does not help that the story as delivered is ridiculous cruise and kidman who bring little more than marital torpor the project play welltodo new yorkers bill and alice harford he is doctor and she is an unemployed art gallery director and they share central park west address at an opulent party hosted their friend victor ziegler pollack alice gets little tipsy and starts dancing jeremy ironslike hungarian who is singularly determined get her in the sack bill too is seen arminarm couple of models before he is pulled away deal an overdoser back home bill and alice smoke little pot before alices aggressive jealousy kicks in as retribution she confesses her husband that she once had deep feelings for naval officer she eyeballed at hotel where she and bill once stayed this hurtful admission sends bill into tailspin he pounds the streets of the village in his heavy black overcoat struggling blackandwhite images of alice in the grip of horny midshipman it is all way too much for him for revenge bill almost has sex hooker he almost has feelings for underage girl he sees in costume store then he almost does the hookers roommate and he is almost involved in an overblown rococo orgy when an old college chum of his tips him off mysterious passwordprotected party where everyone wears masks and the women are incredible e naked this erotic set piece cultish bacchanal complete chanting incense and lots of strategicallyplaced partygoers covering up the dirty might impress the likes of hugh hefner but it is lot less shocking than it is intended be what is the big deal bill does not exactly do anything other than throw his money and credentials around and alice only ever lusted in her heart whoopdeedoo still they make up at the same agonizingly slow pacewas kubrick notorious for multiple takes paying them at an hourly rate even geniuses have their bad days eyes wide shut just happens be kubricks bad day an unerotic disappointing and altogether pointless end an otherwise memorable career

starring in amy heckerlings clueless two summers ago alicia silverstone proved she was not just another pretty pouty ingenue showing buoyant comedic craftiness that blew all previous jobs namely stint as the aerosmith girl and silly turn as the lethal lolita of the crush out of the water her only work since that gem has been in junes batman robin where she overcame the underwritten role of batgirl now she is the star and producer of excess baggage hopelessly phony that demonstrates how an illcomposed story can drag an otherwise solid performer down its level silverstones emily hope is stuck billionaire father jack thompson who neglects her emotionally in an outlandish plan gain his affection she fakes her own kidnapping emily uses an electronically disguised voice call her dad and set pricey ransom ties her legs together and mouth shut duct tape and locks herself in the trunk of her bmw but before the police can rescue her professional auto thief vincent roche benicio del toro jimmies the locks hotwires the engine and makes off both the car and emily who is still trapped in the back when vincent discovers emily the two do not exactly hit it off she annoys him he annoys her and at the advice of his slimy car salesman partner harry connick jr he decides drive her out the middle of nowhere and leave her there along the way of course they get into whole heap of trouble and come realize that being together is the only way get out of their sticky felonystudded situation it does not help matters that emily and vincent are being trailed cops crooks and even her shady uncle ray christopher walken who is wise his nieces ploys for attention and has mafia connections for at least halfhour excess baggage bounces along fast and efficiently during this time emily and vincent sport engaging personalities as well as nice rolereversal twist she is an awfully aggressive combative victim and he is quite the aloof seemingly vulnerable captor but once it is past its setup the situation suddenly becomes uninvolving as the story tries be too many things at once road movie teen comedy mob thriller drama about family relationships you name the cliche and excess baggage likely covers its territory of course romance develops between the two leads but it all seems forced and thus characterization is manipulated cause the finally happy outcome do you like my tummy emily coos vincent at one point in the huh did miss something the hardedged foulmouthed grrrl is suddenly gone and replaced pair of batting googoo eyes then again excess baggage becomes so weak in so many areas that the personality transplant is not complete surprise supporting cast attempts do what they can colorful but empty secondary roles but the movie is not game enough use them all and therefore seems overcrowded motivations keep shifting resulting in an often confusing narrative scant existing story background confuses matters even worse and adds the growing list of unanswered questions excess baggage has too many characters too much plot and juggles one arm behind its back and remaining shaky hand loved silverstones turn in clueless as an aloof pampered beverly hills matchmaker inspired jane austens emma looking back at the skill she displayed for comedy there it is simple justify any high expectation or enthusiasm that had mustered for excess baggage sadly however excess baggage is no clueless but on the other hand it is clueless

because am scientist that is what we do dr alexander mccabe bob gunton in response why he created evil bats alright folks stop me if you have heard this one genetically altered animals wreak havoc on town and small band of locals assisted specialist in the particular animals field must team up stop the mutant creatures before they can multiply and spread across the earth oh yeah the military is on their way bomb the town as well so they are running short on time sound familiar such is the plot of the destination films release of bats dina meyer stars as the bat specialist sheila who is pulled from her research along her annoying sidekick played irritating deftness leon in order help small texas town figure out why some local citizens and animals have been chewed death recently the help of the local sheriff lou diamond phillips cdc official carlos jacott and scientist bob gunton sheila discovers it is indeed bats who have been genetically altered guntons character be more aggressive and omnivorous in order be used as military weapon have say here that knew exactly what was getting into going into this there is not frame of promotional footage have seen for the that would have led me believe it was going be any good in this respect the never disappointed me this reaches level that transcends the so bad it is good level and borders on the downright insane the effects are awful the script is contrived and for most of the feature was laughing at things that were supposed be taken seriously think challenge anyone sit through the scene where bat stalks baby in crib while another bat terrorizes patron eating at diner straight face thankfully the performances are as good as they can be considering the material the actors had perform dina meyer has always been the highlight of any of the films she has been in johnny mnemonic dragonheart and starship troopers the latter being the only out of that batch any actual merit and this one is no exception while one never really gets the impression that meyers character could be bat expert in reality one never really cares doubt it either she gives as good performance as could be expected plus she is nice look at for an hour and half lou diamond phillips is also serviceable here as the small town sheriff turned eventual hero although when we first meet his character he knows bats are the reason for what is going on in town for some reason later on he suddenly becomes amazed learn that the actual cause of the deaths in town are because of bats the only bad performance in the is that of leons he is relegated the am not sticking around here character and proceeds repeat variations of that line for the majority of the even though he stays anyone who cannot immediately tell that bob gunton the bad guy in patch adams and countless other films is going eventually turn on the gang and side his creations before his eminent death will probably be surprised but highly doubt it even if he had not been the villain in just about every he is ever been in so many obvious hints are given indicate the devious act that it holds no shock whatsoever in fact his death is welcome because it finally starts moving the plot towards the finale if the plot does not sound ridiculous you yet then check out these little tidbits multitude of bats inexplicably disperses when police officer cocks his pistol an entire town disregards the sheriff and doctors orders stay indoors after curfew is instigated causing mass hysteria when the bats come out in full force killing several townsfolk government official blows off shelias instructions wait until dawn install cooling unit in the bats cave that will kill all of them off pulling night job resulting in the death of an entire military unit cavern full of bat feces never ignites when phosphorus flare is lit right in the middle of it finally top it all off this little texas town is showing nosferatu in it is single screen theater for reference our town has over million people in it nearly movie screens and we are lucky even get kevin smiths dogma the most laughable part of the movie though comes from the illconceived bat puppets while the actual bat attack scenes are shot rapid fire editing making the scenes nearly impossible comprehend what is going on the scenes where bat is called upon interact live actor are usually shot more lowkey therefore we the audience get loving closeups of the most unrealistic rubbery bat puppets ever committed being able see the puppeteers arms would be the only things that could have made these creations worse after all of this if you still decide bats might be the movie for you do not say you have not been warned trust me when say that it is lot more fun trash than it is sit through just wish that dina meyer would be cast in more roles or at least choose better films appear in she is definitely talent that is going waste in films like these

the word describe sharon stone is wonder not that she _is_ wonder but rather that wonder how she can be so inconsistent she has dynamic screen presence in basic instinct turns in surprisingly fine acting job in casino but possesses neither of those here stone teams up private school headmasters wife isabelle adjani kill adjanis thoroughly unlikable husband chazz palminteri in comedy of errors and unexpected twists straight out of hitchcock as in homage read steal from it turns out that someone saw them or he is not dead or maybe kathy bates turns in credible if unspectacular performance as an investigative police detective her character is bit dull but realistic although her actions at the end are puzzling adjani is more than satisfactory as the timid beaten spouse driven desperation it is stone that is disappointment among the actors how can she be the epitome of femme fatale in previous films and come off as blank in this one costumed in skintight clothes and looking down her nose at everyone she is someone you would want avoid because she is boring not enticingly dangerous even the threat or promise of lesbian relationship between the conspirators is only half played out on the positive side there are enough unexpected plot developments keep your interest alive that is if you can put up stones cardboard cutout character and scenes directly lifted from hitchs movies

the tagline on random hearts reads in perfect world they never would have met in perfect world never would have seen this movie the biggest flaw is that minutes into this kay chandler kristin scott thomas and dutch van den broeck harrison ford are the only two major characters alive resulting in little doubt that they will end up together at some point during the laborious twohoursandthensome production dutch is sergeant in internal affairs at the district of columbia police department kay is congresswoman from new hampshire although they both think they are happily married their spouses are cheating each other behind their backs dutch and kay are soon widowed when plane goes down carrying their partners they subsequently discover the affair the rest of the is the pointless unrealistic and oftentimes boring story of their researching the sexual relationship that they were blind and getting know each other in the process two sub plots are of little help the already problematic dutch is trying arrest fellow officer task that seems rather ordinary for fare all the great stereotypes get pulled including my personal favorite of the key witness that makes bail and is murdered soon thereafter kays distraction from the films primary focus is her campaign for reelection and attempts shield her year old daughter from the truth about the father she put on pedestal these sub plots could have made for semiinteresting points but the seems afraid explore politics or motherdaughter relations in depth and consequently suffers random hearts two primary characters seem live in shells although both kay and dutch are given their own sub plots they seem never deal anyone other than themselves or each other there is plenty of opportunity dutch having partner and kay having close friends and her daughter but the movie shies away from exploring these relationships veteran actor and director of this sydney pollack and critically acclaimed upandcomer dylan baker both have cameo roles but be careful not blink too much or you will miss them both other than its weak plot it is hard criticize random hearts however it is also hard compliment it had the taken some small risks and more fully explored its extra characters and plots it may have tasted more like well frosted cake rather than the dry one that equates be

in double jeopardy the stakes are high think of the plot as rehash of sleeping the enemy and then rearrange the details and the gender of the stalker the finished product although able maintain the viewers attention is predictable and unexciting thriller an idiotic script alex will take homicide for libby parsons ashley judd is happily married mom leading normal life one night her husband nick bruce greenwood takes her out for romantic escape on sailboat libby awakens in the middle of the night find she is covered in blood and nick has strangely disappeared she follows trail of bloody footprints up the deck where she handles fallen knife like any stupid character and is spotted the coast guard who are responding distress signal sent earlier in the evening nick is presumed dead and although she pleads her innocence libby is tried and convicted for the murder of her husband now please do not think am spoiling any vital plot details because the informative trailer has already spilled most of the beans if you have not seen this preview do not read any further but seriously the inane screenplay douglas weisberg and douglas cook is so elementary that the average viewer will be two or three steps ahead of the characters during the most vital scenes in the movie was anticipating every twist or surprise that eventually popped up on the screen imagine the writers presume their core audience for double jeopardy is very naive group of individuals most unfortunately will be too distracted the moronic plot appreciate the few positive aspects of the production one is tommy lee jones who plays travis lehman parole officer given the tedious task of watching over libby after she serves her sentence in prison jones is always wonderful as an authority figure and he is certainly familiar this sort of role as he played so well in the fugitive and us marshals judd as likable heroin gusto also has chance flex her acting abilities while emotionally unconvincing the actress is tremendously fun in her juvenile role perking up the movie like an injection of antidepressant the actors and their relationship together present the onetwo punch that prevents double jeopardy from derailing itself entirely and now back the plot while behind bars libby learns an interesting little bit of information person cannot be convicted of the same crime twice this law called double jeopardy could be her motive for hunting down her husband who may still be alive yes you heard right the movie degenerates into crosscountry chase where everything you expect happen does the final scenes could have redeemed the are poorly handled director bruce beresford whose previous work centers highly around drama driving miss daisy paradise road ironically it is those elements like the driving force of libby reunite her son that do not quite work here at least double jeopardy is paced well enough satisfy diehard fans of the two stars unfortunately jones lacks some of the edge that he had as sam gerard in the fugitive and the real depth of his character is only skin deep but he and ashley judd are more than welcome considering the material and both have some memorable comic moments judd in particular has hilarious scene in she wards off an oncoming male explaining she has check in her parole officer hmmm perhaps this would have made good comedy it is disappointing because there are the makings of competent action here it is nicely shot and choreographed in downtown vancouver and will entertain those who are not turned off the woeful storyline tis shame that double jeopardy is an adult thriller that would not fool most children

synopsis melissa mentallydisturbed woman who likes smoke seduces doug minorleague baseball player who likes study anatomy work on motorcycles and make out his girlfriend in public library when doug decides stop seeing her melissa maliciously takes revenge on those around him including his girlfriend his mother and his cat comments malicious suppose is an acceptable moview for what it is cheap bmovie thriller rips off dozens and dozens of spurnedpsycholoverwhowantsrevenge films like fatal attraction hand that rocks the cradle etc etc that have come before it malicious however really does not provide very many particularly suspenseful moments the plot starts off energetically enough the main characters are introduced and the affair between doug and melissa begins and ends pretty early on in the it starts drag unfortunately after this melissa will obviously try take her revenge on doug as always seems happen in movies like these but she does so in unimaginative ways that have been done in other better thrillers before she drugs someone she kills family pet and leaves it in the girlfriends apartment and of course she stalks so we see number of shots are supposed be suspenseful where she is spying on doug and his girlfriend will not reveal the ludicrous ending this turkey but warn you that it is both painfully obvious and real yawner john vernon does remarkably good job at playing the notsobright baseball jock who initially gets swept away melissa one of the scripts faults is try pass off character like this as premed student the same cannot be said though for molly ringwald at times she can effectively pull off the obsessed lover routine especially during her silent amgoingtostareyoudown scenes at other times however she just seems somehow goofy and out of place in one particular scene guess was supposed be suspenseful she screeches fk you you bd and throws phone she delivers the line so ridiculously that one cannot help but laugh malicious certainly is not the worst thriller of its kind out in the video racks number of really fat turkies in this genre are out there but it is not all that good or original either feel free treat this maliciously watch something else

warner brothers rated pg mild violence sexual situations minutes director luis mandoki screenplay gerald di pego from the novel nicholas sparks cast kevin costner robin wrightpenn paul newman illeana douglas robbie coltrane jesse james john savage review geoff berkshire am not an overly cynical guy there have been many glossy romances that have carried me away their romanticism over the years however have my limits and also have standards this brings us the subject at hand message in bottle the big ticket romance that warner brothers unleashed upon the movie going public just in time for valentines day the story what little of it that there is involves boring chicago tribune reporter theresa osborne robin wrightpenn dealing her recent divorce and trying raise her young son jason jesse james during brief stay somewhere in new england she finds the titular message in bottle while on morning run the ocean the letter written mystery woman named catherine instantly captivates her upon her return theresa shares it her best friend lina illeana douglas her boss charlie robbie coltrane and the entire city of chicago the newspaper publishes an article about it it turns out that the message was written grieving widower garret blake kevin costner and so theresa travels north carolina and tracks him down he turns out have colorful father paul newman but is otherwise perfectly dull and overly obsessed sailing this is somehow attractive theresa and the two begin their awkward courtship of course she does not tell him that she found his letter she wants but the rules of this type of require him find out later preferably right after they first make love this way garret can get very angry and the relationship can be threatened the discovery of the message and garrets discovery that theresa discovered the message are really the only two noteworthy events that happen during the nearly two and quarter hour running time of this there is truly lame subplot about garrets relationship his dead wifes family he gets into bar fight her brother played john savage and then the necessary tearjerking ending fun way pass the time is take bets on exactly who will die although it becomes pretty clear the second reel the actual death sequence is one of the most ridiculously forced and unintentionally humorous sequences filmed since well since costners the postman message in bottle is one slow moving last year audiences were offered endurance tests such as the horse whisperer and meet joe black but both of those films resemble jerry bruckheimer productions next this they also had redeeming qualities in the form of quality performances and some stand out technical work message in bottle has decent enough cast but they are fighting the material all the way and losing badly costner and especially wrightpenn are both likable and attractive enough cheer for but their characters are simply too boring they also fail generate any kind of real romantic chemistry the supporting players are given very little do the reliable douglas is particularly wasted old pro newman gives his all and occasionally threatens kick some life into this dead horse of confrontational scene he has costner near the end is especially well played however too frequently he just reminds us how unexciting our lead characters are the is very polished on the technical side be sure but it only works undercut the story gabriel yared who previously set the romantic moods of the english patient and city of angels his scores overdoes it bit here caleb deschanels camera makes everything look little too beautiful do the offices of the chicago tribune really need look heavenly the editing steven weisberg is troubling not only considering all that could have been cut out but is also simply messy at times the real offender here is screenwriter gerald di pego working from best selling novel nicholas sparks have not read but have been told is on the same literary level as the bridges of madison county di pego creates one of the most uninspired scripts of recent times its strict adherence clich brings mind such disasters as still know what you did last summer there simply is not an original scene in this the dialogue is rarely better than laughable and this is only accentuated the excessively long pauses every character takes while speaking this is director mandokis first since when man loves woman the solid meg ryanandy garcia romance he is simply going through the motions this message in bottle is easily the worst of the several romantic offerings available in theaters at the moment and vies what dreams may come as one of the most misguided romances of the decade

disconnect the phone line do not accept the charges do anything you can avoid the wretched melodramatic sisterhood dramedy hanging up figured needed get in touch my feminine side and hanging up seemed like an ideal opportunity do so the features an incredible palate of female talent and the capability behind the camera brought mind such sparkling gems as sleepless in seattle and unsung heroes meg ryan diane keaton and lisa kudrow play trio of sisters who once separated career judgments over family ties must reunite when their father walter matthau is admitted into the hospital alzheimers disease while this may read like an optimum opportunity rekindle their relationship and reflect poignancy on the past the script sisters delia and nora ephron is exasperating shapeless dreck teeming emotional fakery hanging up has the overall effect of telemarketer pestering you for two hours while you do not have the option of doing as the title suggests for the first halfhour the ephron sisters use telephone conversations for basis of character development this is an annoying and ineffective device cellphones ring every five minutes and everyone hurriedly rushes along leaving marginal time for the frustrated viewer relate the sisters issues and problems if hanging up was an apple pie then felt as if we were getting the mere crust of the story granted there are few genuine and sincere moments in the but they only help establish that the remainder of the strained emotions are nothing but inferior dramatic muck the most outrageous strategy in hanging up is that after series of largely unrealized attempts at character development we are expected exhibit compassion and courtesy toward the sisters as they join for melodramatic finale we are able identify eve ryan the most open and caring daughter because she is the one who stayed her fathers side as everyone else moved forward pursue impending career georgia keaton the eldest daughter is celebrating the fifth year anniversary of her magazine called georgia maddy kudrow the soap opera actress spends time either contemplating her possible path stardom or nursing her dog ryans convincing performance and diverting cuteness are two of the more agreeable aspects of hanging up kudrow so delightfully eccentric as the offkilter airhead phoebe in friends is totally wasted ditto for keaton who is serving double shift as costar and director time slot that can be difficult priority juggle her frenzy is apparent for chick flick there is distressing lack of chuckles the reliable matthau is reduced chaotic shtick that given his characters situation seems more depressing than amusing even so the peak form of humor in hanging up is represented some of matthaus nasty quips and ryans eternal battle have the aforementioned pooch swallow pill that about accounts for the three or four chuckles you will expel during the my curiosity has suddenly been tweaked discover how such promising and starstudded approach could turn so viciously sour but really it is no mystery the predictable melodramatic filth that is hanging up is certainly not the fault of these actresses pin it on the screenplay attempts clear up vital issues in three or four minutes while spending the rest of the running time in an annoying flurry of phone conversations it is certainly far cry from what one would label as rewarding experience but hanging up should have at least been enjoyable uhuh it is wrong number from the beginning

running time approximately hr mins reviewed jack choo rating the movie starts rather seenish opening sequence rather cool and sets the mood for things come the story propels the audience into neoreality somewhat very close conscious reality but laced weird tinges of blue and red existenz is actually the name of new virtualreality game supposedly vr games are highly popular as is considered legaldrug in this neoreality leigh is the ultimate game creator and introduces her ultimate gameexperience in the form of existenz players are required have bioports embedded in their spine plugs gamepod in order enjoy the immersive experience during secretive betatestingcumteaser meeting for this new game an assassination attempt on life occurs and she runs off fellow bodyguard law is more of realists than anything else afraid that he will lose reality if he begin play these games but requires his help immerse together her into existenz check if the program is still functioning properly after the assassination attempt as they soon discover they are transported between realities within existenz uncovering more than they initially expected existenz has all the cronenberggore that is expected of him even so this is nowhere near his cult classics such as videodrome or scanners not even half as suspenseful as the commercially successful the fly existenz can probably be looked upon as his version of videodrome even so it is poor followup while in most of his famed films his penchant for gore always hit the right note theme of the and plot in existenz the gory sequences are no more attached spirit of the and seem be an act of overindulgence than anything else jennifer jason leigh and jude law both commendable actors looked aloof and missdirected throughout the entire the scripting and acting barely pulls the out of the bgrade category it was obvious that cronenberg worked on really tightbudget and it seems that he handled that pretty well in the production design and values created for this the opening sequence though probably formed considerable portion of the budget is actually quite good existenz is too predictable and cliched in these times years ago it would have been another classic for cronenberg cronenberg fans however those people who enjoy seeing friends getting queasy over mutilation on should not give this miss as some form of appreciation can still be offered you

in china in turned the tables on our national guide and asked him if he had any questions about america guess was expecting some sort of political question instead was dumfounded what was most on his mind in america do wives and their mothersinlaw get along well he assured me in china that they did but am certain if that were true he would not have asked even in china people seem have problems relating in laws perhaps some of lifes most difficult relationships arise when families are suddenly artificially joined marriage man trying relate his new prospective inlaws and viceversa could be the basis of very strong comedy meet the parents does not demonstrate that fact however greg focker played ben stiller has been dating and in love pam byrnes teri polo for ten months and is now ready propose her he will do it during weekend visit meet debbies family and attend her sisters wedding from the beginning the relationship is awkward between greg and jack and dina byrnes robert deniro and blythe danner through no fault of his own the airline has lost gregs luggage and he has ask borrow clothing it is the beginning of game of oneupmanship in greg is nearly always onedown as the games go on greg is more and more uncomfortable and uneasy only contributes the mistakes he makes greg is playing game he does not understand in league he is new but perhaps along the way he will discover some unexpected secrets about his fatherinlaw this had potential in its tale of oneupmanship it has hit on situation that many in the audience may find familiarone that has not been done overly frequently in films but the script jim herzfeld and john hamburg is little too contrived too many coincidences in the story work against greg the script could not decide if the main character was incompetent or simply unlucky certainly he does not help his situation doing everything wrong he possibly could but even when he is trying do the right things nature conspires against him there is an uneven mix of slapstick sequences and human comedy certainly the last part of the feels awkwardly written the main reason see meet the parents is see robert deniros performance deniro plays the suspicious and not little fascistic father as tightly wound and threatening as he can the little judgmental expressions on his face are show in themselves as greg digs himself deeper and deeper into his insecurities but we do not really see much of that digging ben stiller is an affable presence in the but is not really stretching himself playing the role as the nebbish whom so many bad things happen it is nice see blythe danner again on the screen but her character has basic conflict between basic decency and her love for her husband and the script should have given her more do that randy newman has written playful score in the first few seconds of the it does something creative have never heard score do before there is lot of source music that is popular music of the presumably that is what the upper class listens at least in somebodys imagination humor is subjective and some this has been getting some favorable comment but this is comedy that works only occasionally for me would have rate it on the scale and on the scale

the fab of ronald reagan high are four stuckup girls played rose mcgowan rebecca gayheart julie benz and charlotte roldan who overdress like posh spice wannabes their daily ritual is parade up and down the school halls like royalty and their constant reflex action is grab their compacts so they can check their makeup and powder their cheeks under no circumstances will they ever let themselves be seen eating in public in writer and director darren steins jawbreaker it is not as funny as it sounds in fact it is not funny at all stein has taken the black comedy of teen movie like heathers and stripped it of any intelligence wit or charm his actresses toss off their lines so fast that they do not have time add any emotion and all of his female characters have considerably more lipstick than brains the setup for the movie has one of the fab liz who is referred as the princess di of reagan high be killed when prank the other goes wrong the princess di reference is in bad taste as is much of the movie granted bad taste can sometimes be funny but the mere presence of bad taste does not guarantee it lizs girlfriends stick jawbreaker that is literally larger than golf ball in her mouth tape her mouth shut and stick her bound body in the trunk of car when they open the trunk later liz is dead they eventually put her blue and bruised body into sexual position and make it look like liz was the victim of brutal rape these realistic and disgusting scenes of dead seminude teen have pornographic feeling that is hard forget and will likely turn the stomach of many viewer the films dialog not only is not funny it is trite one nerdy young girl introduces herself my name is fern mayo as in hold the mayo when fern discovers what has happened the fab make her an offer she cannot refuse makeup they cake it on her and welcome her the clan the parents in the movie brag about learning parenting skills from watching oprah the teachers fare no better especially in the ridiculous lines they are given miss shayne please cover your bosom one young teacher who has been made up look old and ugly says without any conviction this is learning institution not brothel besides the obvious question of why this movie was ever made there is one other question that would like ask the director why do you have phone number start if you going cover the rest of the number anyway in cameo pam grier plays detective vera cruz who investigates lizs murder as she interrogates the other people she stares at them like they are all idiots proving that she is the only one that gets it am sure that if the hard nosed detective cruz were see this movie she would walk out after about minutes and you would be well advised do the same if you should happen find yourself in theater showing it jawbreaker runs it is rated for violence gore profanity and sex would advise everyone avoid it but if teenagers go they should be older and mature

never fails astound me every time think those cokedup little buggers have hit rock bottom they come up new excavating tool was truly convinced that wild wild west marked studio filmmaking at its most hapless but then along comes end of days prove me wrong this big budget brain dead apocalyptic thriller bludgeons its audience overwrought music grisly violence explosions galore and lots of cheesy special effects the result nothing but groans and yawns even the devil himself is unable produce decent scare in this festival of the inept at the very least end of days should have done us the courtesy of being badenoughtobegood but it cannot even manage that it is just lousy arnold schwarzenegger still recovering from heart problems and batman robin plays an excop turned security agent or bodyguard or something along his obligatory comic relief partner kevin pollak impersonating matthew perrys chandler character from friends he gets involved in some major league supernatural hoodoo it seems that satan gabriel byrne gets shot at world domination only once every thousand years and here thought he would pulled it off the republican landslide of if he has sex year old christine york robin tunney the chosen one their child will be the antichrist or at least brat ah but this deal has more catches than new years eve pass from halfway house the unholy union must take place on december you see is just turned upside down but only between m and midnight no wonder this guy is so cranky and if the chosen one is given refuge in church the devil will not know where she is because he cannot see into the sanctuary you know it is kind of like supermans xray vision and lead walls only evil group of guerrilla catholic priests decide the best way stop the situation is killing the girl arnold chooses save the girl and kick the hell out of satan if you will pardon the expression and kevin meets up an exploding van and has make some decisions of his own oh the anguish oh the humanity oh the writing andrew marlowes screenplay ladles implausibility upon implausibility from the preposterous otherworldly histrionics his handling of jericho cane schwarzeneggers character cane starts the la mel gibson in the first lethal weapon preparing put gun in his mouth due ongoing despondence over the murder of his wife and daughter twenty minutes later he is racing through the bowels
