of new york city deciphering clues that sherlock holmes and kreskin would find baffling when cane meets up christine york he instantly switches terminator father figure mode the young woman serving as surrogate daughter in case anyone misses the connection the camera comes in for close up of christines music box just happens be identical one owned canes daughter subtle marlowe subtle speaking of cameras director peter hyams is just the man take marlowes script and make it even more selfimportant murky and annoying hyams direction shows all the subtlety of gwar video cane running gauntlet of ridiculous action set pieces punctuated loads of big explosions eager satisfy arnolds core audience he even throws in few pairs of breasts as well what guy had the delivered some decent scares or even maintained consistently ominous tone the bombastic clich might have been tolerable but end of days is simply flaccid special effects show the cast is just as ineffective in his early scenes gabriel byrne attempts invest beelzebub some panache but he all too soon turns into just another standard issue monster kevin pollak comes and goes quickly robin tunney comes off like bargain basement winona ryder and as for arnold well he is better actor than casper van dien that should count for something way back in the aftermath the exorcist and the omen supernatural swill like end of days might have passed muster as bmovie but that was then and this is now the xfiles and buffy the vampire slayer deliver real scares on weekly basis and if we want see the devil all we have do is flip on the club and take gander at pat robertsons grinning maw after enduring end of days all can say is get thee behind me satan and while you are at it get thee better agent as well

i have little against remakes and updates of older films and tv series if there is will there is way and believe that anything no matter how great or revered can be effectively improved upon this is the reason that responded so well gus van sants universally panned update of psycho thought it be not only an intriguing cinematic experience but also very onpar an original but do have big problem remakes that are blatantly bad you see the point of remake is or at least it should be iron out the originals flaws and bring the work that much closer greatness or even perfection but what if the source material on the remake is based is not any good begin that is the only cinematic question pondered the bland actioner the mod squad have only seen couple episodes of the late tv series on it is based and be honest did not like it all that much it has concept that and still is interesting group of corrupt young adults all in their early are given choice they either go jail for the various crimes that they all have committed or they can become undercover cops helping the police get into places that they normally would not be able access obviously all opt for the latter option and become undercover policemen and policewomen the three main characters here are played claire danes omar epps and giovanni ribisi of the three only danes has real character ribisis dumbass year old is played exclusively for laughs epps slightly more intelligent one is used create various chase scenes when the squads superviser gets killed off and his reputation dirtied in death the three of them sure that their beloved master was framed go off and investigate on their own discovering corrupt cops lots and lots of expensive whores and very lucrative drug operations all kinds of good stuff the only times that the mod squad comes even close working is in its comedic moments although ribisi is trite actor and his characters repeat movie after movie his man here is really rather amusing when the script gives him chance epps straight man is effectively played against ribisis clueless spontaneity but the rest of the is dull boring and singularly uninteresting drugop action plot is no longer anything new not even teenage action heroes and the way it is executed here it is also nowhere near exciting or suspenseful claire danes character has potential but it is buried under heaps of cliches and her performance is too restrained she could have been tourdeforce but instead director scott silver puts shackles on her and simply does not allow her do anything really significant her role epps and ribisi fare slightly better and do as well as can be expected although their characters are not nearly as rich as danes could have been the mod squad is mindnumbing marketing plot of and teens will jump all over it it is full of bad dialogue scenes and concepts that make no sense and get this drug dealers that like tango other guys in their spare time nothing is remotely intriguing or worth paying for claire danes is no longer alluring mainly because she is got horrible hairdo so that draw is out there are however cool explosions guns and chases may lure viewer into thinking that he or she is about experience an exciting thriller of some sort do not be fooled some may call this escapist fare call it escapeasquicklyasyoucan fare

when the mediums in question are video game and feature has there ever been respective heretothere transformation that achieved any ground higher than noodleheaded mediocrity super mario bros street fighter and mortal kombat were silly stinkers all and now the empty execrable wing commander joins their lowly ranks enduring this spectacularly bad bit of scifi easily the worst of its kind is like watching someone futz around video game for minutes that is say there is little fun be had when you are not the one holding the joystick the movie then is missed opportunity for director chris roberts who created the original groundbreaking pc incarnation of wing commander back in how an interactive brainchild so revered could end up such cinematic pile of junk under the helm of the same guy is headscratcher wing commander story credited roberts and screenwriter kevin droney is clueless chaos melding incoherent narrative and unoriginal ideas it rips off the finest films of its genre top gun and in one scene even those spiffy stereoscopic freeze gap commercials set in wing commander stars freddie prinze jr as daredevil cosmos cowboy who hopes be great fighter pilot like his father before him along the way he plays kissyface his stoic superior saffron burrows at the new galaxy hangout where he is posted comes terms bigots who resent him for his pilgrim heritage do not ask and goes on topsecret mission involving the jump coordinates what no death star plans of nasty alien race known as the kilrathi or something like that given the immensely confusing activity it is hard tell on the other hand what is easy see is that wing commander is big old mess the lame dialogue strains filled such original lines as do not you die on me battle stations and repeated and frequently unanswered calls for medic action sequences fizzle the character conflict garners unintentional giggles the sole source of suspense here is what these kilrathi creeps look like as they are kept out of view until the concluding minutes imagine bearded siamese cats crossed something from s roger corman cheapie and you have got good idea little but technobabble happens for an hour and then it is as if wing commander tries do too much at once when it appears as though the movies about show signs of pulse it instead provides hilarious touch of human drama culminating use for bulldozer that has probably never been seen in this kind of space camp before matthew lillard featured prominently in said sequence is cast as prinzes hotshot partner and though the two are fine young actors recently paired in the hit she is all that they are fighting more than otherworldly evil here rumor has it that wing commander was slated as laterintheyear release bumped up capitalize off this hot casting coup as well as the premiere of the new star wars episode trailer but in my audience there were no females present make googoo eyes at prinze or lillard and many member exited after the muchballyhooed sneak peek since most cineplexes will not be granting refunds the latter contingency commander might rake in some dough but be warned the high wears off as soon as the coming attraction gives way the feature presentation

it is almost amusing watch year old christina ricci get drastically overshadowed in sally potters followup the tango lesson the man who cried the geny actress her cold stare and big black eyes has appeared in an impressive range of films but she does not even come close being the bold heroine the set against the historical backdrop of world war requires her be ricci whose character is shockingly silent and blank showing only the occasional smile or hint of concern shares most of her scenes the astounding cate blanchett quite an amusing sight behold blanchetts lola paris dwelling dancer who befriends the aspiring singer suzie is bold interesting and layered everything our heroine lacks costar of the upcoming lord of the rings trilogy blanchett has good seven inches on ricci sports twice the makeup and dons flashy wardrobe the actress inhabits the role as she always so remarkably does fervor and life that makes you want her hold the screen as the films lead rather than her dull companion important historical events involving hitler and his nazis scatter themselves across the these landmarks serve as the films little conflict obviously the tables are turned in the life of suzie these events whose jewish origin is unknown among her parisian colleagues the man who cried has many aspirations none of come full circle the films close there are forced messages here and there go forward always go forward lola preaches suzie there is romance between suzie and fellow target of hitlers nazis the gypsy cesar johnny depp who like ricci barely gets speak lola struggles her character that desires above all things wealth and men who have it and at the core of all these devices lies suzies desire travel america where her father journeyed after leaving her and her mother years ago the films main problem is that potter is not skilled enough tell the epicsized story of suzie the time periods instability the conflicting social classes the prejudice against suzie from all those around her in her new life serving as both writer and director potter throws in some of each but hardly an inch of depth is be found in any the time the sighinducing climax hits the believability and complete absence of focus leave one ready leave the theater the films falling action is weirdly unsatisfying and unlikely are we really meant believe any of this could happen contrastingly in its moving final scene the man who cried strikes note that is made effective in its ties the emotional beginning of the although it is apparent that potter cannot grasp what she reaches am puzzled as why she reaches for so much in the first place riccis suzie is meant be the films core from the extended flashback at the films beginning the quickly drawn ending everything seen in the in some way relates her so why then does potter spend so much time on subplots involving other individuals the character of suzie is too present for the man who cried work as an ensemble but not present enough for the be riccis the almost constant lack of flow and onenote tone potter depicts the man who cried are somewhat improved upon sacha viernys beautiful cinematography that renders the films various locations wonderfully also worthy of note are lindy hemmings costumes that help depict the area quite nicely and then there is the music from minute one minute ninetyseven there is hardly moment when the wavering skilled voice of an opera singer or the rhythms of the gypsy music do not undercut the action the notes stricken both overwhelm particularly john turturro portraying fictional opera singer dante dominio whose money and reputation catch lolas interest and accompany oftentimes the perfect chords are captured undermine the state of the films characters and reinforce that state potter obviously cares much about each and every musical note unfortunately the same effort is not given towards almost everything else

sandra bullock in high heels and wielding chainsaw yup it is gotta be summer just when you thought the pointless sequel had gone the way of franchise films and directtovideo releases into port slams speed cruise control the gloriously godawful followup the sleeper about bus rigged explode if it slowed below certain speed the gimmick this time is an ocean liner rigged well crash into stuff sound exciting dennis hoppers disgruntled bomb squader the villain of the first has given way willem dafoes disgruntled computer programmer maniac whose main beef has something do having use live leeches kid you not as selftreatment for copper poison ing and said poisoning induced prolonged exposure electro magnetic fields no less calling dean edell so he overrides the boats computer convinces the crew abandon ship and sends the remaining passengers those who could not evacuate in time on col lision course destiny oddly no one thinks just jump off the back of the boat keanu reeves electing not return perhaps he read the script the job of john mcclane goes jason patric sleepers as the second la cop and swat team member that that bus drivin babe annie bullock has dated what are the odds they are on this caribbean cruise for pleasure as are handful of requisite stock characters including deaf teenager who has crush on the hero who also knows how sign and you thought the raptor slam was cool summer movie move wait till you see the feats that this little girl can do when stuck on shipboard elevator bullock is her pesky perky self though she ends up far less screen time than her top billing suggests those paying attention her bikini and tank tops probably will not complain however patric is the main man in motion and that is damn good ecause when he stops talk he is only slightly less monotone than his predecessor his first lol line is ms bullock would like boogie you of course nobody in front of the camera embarrasses themselves quite the way that returning director jan de bont does he also produced this mess is insulting even the most lax summer standards con air buddy fathers day romy and michelles high school reunion murder at heads in duffle bag anaconda vegas vacation meet wally sparks metro bevery hills ninja the relic all is forgiven worse he is spent hundred mil on premise that does not even live up its title there is no sweatinducing motion of the ocean here just two hours of shaky handheld camera work and handful of crosscut exteriors all leading up the big slam when the love boat sideswipes an oil tanker and then plows into harbor town oh how far we have come in twenty years remember the simple fun of seeing locomotive smash into railway station in the silver streak admittedly either of the aforementioned sequences is worth the price of admission it is just the rest of the movie the other hundred or so minutes that is pure nonsense and wonderful nonsense at that know he did not intend but de bont has done one thing right he is created the handsdown funniest of the year so now allow present few more things that made me laugh a box big label fiber optic converter plain english wholesentence computer instructions an entire sequence devoted opening fire door jason patrics character walks onto the bridge and immediately understands everything that is happening a ships navigator who speaks in scottish accent and actually gets say canna override it willem dafoes amazing armmounted keyboard two living breathing adults bullocks character and the first mate who have be told step step how disconnect trip wire from the pin of hand grenade duh no wait screams the ships intercom yet another damn dog in peril fishing reel pontoon plane memories of weekend at bernies

how do films like mouse hunt get into theatres is not there law or something this diabolical load of claptrap from steven speilbergs dreamworks studio is family fare at its deadly worst mouse hunt takes the bare threads of plot and tries prop it up overacting and flatout stupid slapstick that makes comedies like jingle all the way look decent comparison writer adam rifkin and director gore verbinski are the names chiefly responsible for this swill the plot for what its worth concerns two brothers nathan lane and an appalling lee evens who inherit poorly run string factory and seemingly worthless house from their eccentric father deciding check out the longabandoned house they soon learn that it is worth fortune and set about selling it in auction the highest bidder but battling them at every turn is very smart mouse happy his rundown little abode and wanting it stay that way the story alternates between unfunny scenes of the brothers bickering over what do their inheritance and endless action sequences as the two take on their increasingly determined furry foe whatever promise the starts soon deteriorates into boring dialogue terrible overacting and increasingly uninspired slapstick that becomes all sound and fury signifying nothing the script becomes so unspeakably bad that the best line poor lee evens can utter after another run in the rodent is hate that mouse oh cringe this is home alone all over again and ten times worse one touching scene early on is worth mentioning we follow the mouse through maze of walls and pipes until he arrives at his makeshift abode somewhere in wall he jumps into tiny bed pulls up makeshift sheet and snuggles up sleep seemingly happy and just wanting be left alone it is magical little moment in an otherwise soulless message speilberg if you want dreamworks be associated some kind of artistic credibility then either give all concerned in mouse hunt swift kick up the arse or hire yourself some decent writers and directors this kind of rubbish will just not do at all

miramax disinvited online media from press screenings of scream they ostensibly feared that folks like me would write spoilerfilled reviews and post them prior the films february th release dateunsound reasoning you see net critics established enough be on any sort of vip list are professionalsmiramax surely knows the difference between member of the online critics society ofcs and the type of fanboy who posts spy reports at as not it cool news no the mini major was afraid we would let bigger cat out of the bag than whodunit that scream is dismal conclusion the beloved this writer at least franchise something smells rotten in the state of california right from the getgo cotton weary liev schrieber the former lover and wouldbe killer of maureen prescott sidneys mother is juggling phone calls in his luxury car once considered danger society weary now hosts his own talk show cotton clever if dated jab at american pop culture of course new ghostface dials him up and memories of screams unbearably suspenseful prologue in mind we immediately wonder where is the killer the backseat the next car thrilling prospects be sure but actually ghostface is at the weary residence waiting for cottons girlfriend kelly rutheford finishing showering what is missing from this sequence and indeed scream remaining frights most disappointingly the moment when an ingenue is forced hide in wardrobe room filled ghostface costumes one of might spring life is an elaborate and attenuated payoff our other surviving regulars have become estranged sidney campbell is living paranoid existence of electronic gates and passwordprotected locks while dewey arquette acts as technical advisor on the second sequel scream moviewithinamovie stab and gale weathers cox arquette headlines gossipy news program murder reunites them as knifewielding ghostface stalks the set of stab imitating its sadistic screenplayand hishertheir own personal draft climaxes sidneys death the appeal of ghostfaces villainy is that heshethey could be your boyfriend your classmate your next door neighbour or combination of people scream was the first of its kind slasher mystery the guessing game not only entailing who will be next but also who isare the perpetrator and what isare hishertheir motive ironic selfreflection aside parts one and two stand out in crowd that includes umpteen friday the th and halloween flicks because there is at last articulate human beings behind the iconic costume scream the novelty of ghostfaces evermutating identity has worn off some but the character remains conceptually potent conceptually the execution of ghostfaces master plan this time around is creaky because screenwriter ehren kruger has invented new mythology for the world of sidney prescott far afield from what we would come understand in scream and scream the movie gets in the silly habit of saying all bets are off in reference the rules of trilogys third act but there is difference between rule breaking and cheating the departure of kevin williamson who authored the previous screams as well as tidy outline for scream that for reasons incomprehensible me was ignored save the notion of stab kruger needed be reined in tighter and wes craven cravens direction of scream is lazy in most respects how else explain the jay and silent bob cameo the slacker duo of kevin smith movies akin seeing mickey mouse pop up in mulan and more distracting than funny it pains me write this but scream comedy is generally laughless the exception of welltimed performances josh pais as police detective possessed of the same personality he had as persnickety teacher in cravens music of the heart jamie kennedy resurrecting geek randy for the sendoff he was denied in scream and parker posey through sheer force of will as bactress the visuals are much weaker in part three as wellthe occasional sweeping gesture of peter demings camera is pale imitation of the stalking steadicam craven gave us twice before aside in the wake of columbine craven toned down the violence significantly for scream why the sanctimony when scream and scream are still readily available on video store shelves finally marco beltramis music cues the suspense too blatantlydo you recall the tense chase at the college radio station in scream it is mostly silent sting notes are whole lot more effective if they spring from nowhere here they act as the crescendos of an incessantly nervejangling score look at scream as coming from an alternative universe the same place that birthed the godfather part iii and superman iiiwoefully out of synch its prequels scream is nightmare instead of nightmarish and will likely put the horror genre back in mothballs the unintentionally follows the unspoken rule of trilogy t part three must disappoint

a backdrop of new years eve in would seem lend itself great party movie the decor possibilities are endless disco balls had yet migrate into the dark corners of the attic big hair was worth its weight in aquanet and the louder the fashion the better the look but despite this setting these details and soundtrack that includes some plus irresistible hits from the early days of the me decade something is inherently wrong cigarettes better title for this nostalgic mess would be missed opportunities what is it that makes this retrocomedy such downer it is certainly not the cast includes enough hot young talent for several movies there is courtney love cementing her reputation as serious actress christina ricci hot off her shouldabeennominated turn in the opposite of sex paul rudd who gets even more appealing every role kate hudson inheriting some fine acting genes from mom goldie hawn and affleck brothers ben and casey two of the best things about good will hunting perhaps the question is this what drew these and other immensely talented actors such dreary project maybe it looked good on paper cigarettes is composed of series of vignettes as various characters make their way through new yorks festively decorated east village holiday bash thrown jittery bundle of nerves named monica martha plimpton all dressed up in her best cyndi lauper among the potential guests are likeable cad kevin rudd and his best friend lucy love busy bickering over his recent breakup and clumsy but seemingly charming bartender ben affleck who opens his mouth only spew forth bad pickup lines more subplots _many_ more dot the big picture but those listed above are the only ones worth noting in positive light all the other story tangents are as frazzled as cokehead trying solve rubicks cube ricci and gaby hoffman grate as two ronkonkoma gals the kind that have trouble pronouncing hard consonants out have high time in the big city infamously acerbic comedienne janeane garofalo is wasted in what amounts severalscene cameo hudson as prettyinpink klutz recently devirginized reprehensible ladies man jay mohr trips pukes and gets smeared dog poop are we laughing yet the boils down mixture of the good the bad and the gaudy the latter two overtaking the former game performances especially love rudd and plimpton are almost shot down the bizarrely colorful parts and constantly roving focus here combination that mostly sputters when it should crackle too many sidetracks rate as uninteresting and have little payoff until lengthy final montage where we find out many of the performers served as one night stands for each other if this is cigarettes then get me nicotine patches

the premise of the new james wong final destination is that alex browning the protagonist prevents six of his friends from boarding doomed airplane thereby cheating fate however fate is not so easily bested and alexs friends soon begin dying in unusual circumstances essentially this premise is cleverway make slasherflick without the slasher unfortunately this is practically the only clever thing about the as far as teen horror flicks go final destination is better than many there is enough shocking death graphic gore and requisite black humor provide the essential roller coaster type thrill at the heart of the average horror flick unfortunately this also suffers from the worst characteristics of this genre the relationships between the main characters are tenuous and their motivations are meaningless except as excuse setup the next death the scene where two of the characters break into funeral home view the body of their recently killed friend is suppose be scary and dramatic but features some of the dumbest dialogue have witnessed if you are looking for saturday night thriller scare your date this might do the trick other than that wait until it goes into heavyrotation on cable

there is scene in patch adams in patch is in the center of courtroom surrounded people who are giving him lively standing ovation because of his strongworded attack on group of stoic doctors when noticed that the audience whom saw this was reacting the same way realized that was going have hard time finding someone who agrees me about the quality of the picture you see patch adams revolted me beyond all boundaries hated this movie for every second that sat watching it and actively hate it now days later the simpering superficial nauseatingly sentimental images forever plaguing my memories hate every element of the beginning tom shadyacs shameless direction and all the way up the misguided and mishandled themes that the screenplay wants so desperately convey the badness of patch adams is stupefying it is confounding cannot believe can be this bad and yet it is based on real man who probably has good point make in the patch is played the undefeatable and indefatigable robin williams in performance of such insulting pathos and sledgehammer sympathy that wonder now if he is even human in the beginning of the patch commits himself mental institution because he does not want kill himself while there he notices that the doctors do not care about the patients and that the best way get through the patients is treat them like human beings so patch goes on crusade be great doctor who actually talks his patients he goes medical school where he meets truman daniel london and convinces him that it is good help people he also meets carin fischer monica potters the antimale med student who just wants go through the motions and be successful doctor naturally the dean of the medical school bob gunton hates patch and wants thwart his plans even though patch gets the highest scores on all of his exams so patch decides that he is going build free clinic in the middle of nowhere help people any problem they may have and that my friends is the synopsis for what is easily the most abhorrent picture of on superficial level the is not particularly bad would not say the cinematography bothered me and most of the performances seem be exactly what shadyac was aiming for actually liked potters performance even if she is wasted but the fails fundamentally in execution every scene swells grand emotional music played at maximum volume just get us all cry real hard take for instance the first scene shows patch sitting on bus we do not know patch yet but there is sad music and it is supposed make us really sad that he is sad later on patch makes lot of progress he helps dying patient peter coyote enjoy the last days of his life and the music as patch is pushing the patient recklessly through the halls of the hospital is very lively and when that patient finally dies spoiler alert the music is very very sad but the problem all of this is that the music should not be the center of the emotions real drama is characterbased you grow like someone and then something bad happens and you feel it we do not ever grow know the dying patient he is simply vehicle for patchs greatness real drama does not seem forced or present just make the audience cry that is why patch adams is not real drama it goes for every cheap tear imaginable wringing tired and overbearing sentimentality out of every scene even scenes that have very little impact on the overall are drowning in marc shaimans sickening musical score sentimentality like this is indeed bad but it is not as bad as halfbaked simplistic themes you see patch is really great student he aces his tests without studying and does it so effectively that people think he is cheating but patch does not think that memorizing facts is the way become good doctor why do not we see patients until the third year he bursts out every three seconds well patch that might have something do the fact that you need learn something before you go treating patients not everyone has the capability of memorizing facts no effort most of us have study and doctor who really wants help but does not know toe from finger probably will not be too successful in preventing death oh wait almost forgot the point of doctors is not just prevent death but improve the quality of life yes that is true and you can not do that without studying you can not do that without going medical school what patch never seemed understand was the possibility that maybe just maybe it is good idea study first and talk patients later follow the rules bah who needs the rules only uptight doctors follow the rules the real saviors are the ones running around the hospitals big red spheres on their faces and sporting baggy yellow pants and then there is the free clinic issue find shockingly frighteningly idealistic free clinic in the middle of the forest where patients can be taken be helped for free how will patients be transported the free clinic will it have an emergency room or is it just for mental patients and who may ask will pay for it the does give some token attempts question patchs motives think another character asks him how he is going pay for it in addition little bit of meaningless blather about hmos and medical insurance but they certainly do not explore or challenge patchs ideas any meaningful extent reader please understand this am not making any kind of judgment on the real patch adams know nothing about him if his beliefs mirror those of this character then might like have an intelligent discussion him about them but regardless of what the real patch adams believes the themes put forth in this are simplistic and phony and in the last scene the big obligatory courtroom scene that forced my lunch halfway up my esophagus patch does lot of shouting actually robin williams does lot of shouting he shouts lot about helping people and lot of people cry because they are moved his words will not tell you that you cannot be moved his words because too was moved his words was moved in such profoundly negative way that was reminded of how cheap and phony cinematic experience can be patch adams is the cheapest of them all

i have great idea for movie one that cannot miss see have got coolio do song for the soundtrack and about fifty athletes and celebrities do cameo appearances it is about professional basketball so will release it right around the nba finals guarantee added publicity as for what the movie is actually about well that will all sort itself out eventually figure it will be comedy so will throw halfdozen writers at it and take the best of whatever they come up maybe we will put gender spin on it see if we can get some women out see it too eddie is one of those phenomenally lazy films that infuriates me more than any other kind twister as inane as the script might have been at least required some creative technicians mission impossible overwrought plot and all at least involved genuine effort eddie just sits there hawking up formula story without any laughs and makes every possible bad decision when decision is required whoopi goldberg plays eddie franklin new york limo driver and diehard knicks fan who is suffering through dismal season for her beloved team coach john bailey dennis farina has lost control of his overpaid prima donnas and the losses are beginning mount the dwindling attendance inspires new team owner wild bill burgess frank langella try publicity stunt in lucky fan will get be an honorary coach of the team the winner surprise surprise is eddie who becomes fan favorite and eventually the actual coach the knicks continue lose but eddie has some sassy tricks up her sleeve inspire her troops incidentally the knicks eventually start winning please raise your hand if that comes as shock and will invite you my allnight marathon of the bad news bears major league angels in the outfield the mighty ducks the big green cool runnings and little giants awful teams in sports comedies make miraculous turnarounds it is what they do those teams usually involve kids for very sound comedic reason it is funnier when they screw up and they are more sympathetic those _do not_ involve kids usually have actual actors in the lead roles for another very sound comedic reason they generally have developed some sort of comic timing eddie was cast under the misguided premise that it is easier make basketball players look like actors than it is make actors look like basketball players this finds nba players like greg ostertag dwayne schintzius rick fox and malik sealy delivering punch lines as though they were reading them for the first time off bazooka wrapper though sacramento kings center olden polynice has nice moment describing black hole fellow players perhaps that all did not matter anyone because there are so few punch lines and because the whole is one big casting gimmick steve rash directs the spiritless script as though waving flag of surrender and screaming do not blame me just work here perhaps it was patently obvious him that eddie is not movie it is cameo appearance that trips over plot every once in while among the notables who lend their faces this travesty are donald trump new york mayor rudolph giulianni former new york mayor ed koch david letterman letterman regulars mujibur rahman and sirajul islam espn broadcaster chris berman and knicks announcer marv albert as well as dozens of nba players and several nba arenas and those are the real jokes in eddie nothing these individuals say or do is funny you are supposed be laughing simply because you notice hey it is donald trump or hey it is mujibur and sirajul it is difficult decide whether eddie is so bad because it was so shamelessly lacking in imagination or because it cannot even get the cliches in clicheridden genre script right the knicks coach who is eddies antagonist early in the reappears at the end but he is not given chance be the villain eddie desperately needs neither is frank langella and none of the athleteactors have the ability give whoopi goldberg anything play off of that leaves her do her streetwise miss thang routine but no character no sharp lines and no help eddie is not just bad movie formulaic premise it is movie that makes you feel cheated and offended because someone came up poster and marketing plan they had attach an actual movie and you had the nerve believe it was going be comedy

as any reasonable human being would must admit that occasionally am befuddled certain things am befuddled fight club now sometimes our favorite films are panned critics and do not achieve critical success until much later sometimes as much as ten or twenty years later perhaps it is because these films are way ahead of their time perhaps it is because they are so new and complex that only after years of allowing them sink in do we truly appreciate and understand them fight club is either garbage or brilliant but at least right now must lean toward the former maybe am subconsciously affected word of mouth that has been slowly leaking throughout the media for weeks that this is pure gold but if it is sure don see it edward norton plays jack field examiner for major automobile manufacturer his insomnia coupled his compulsive desires fill his world ikea furniture complete himself make him loser at the game of life but when all of his worldly possessions are blown out his th story window he seeks comfort in stranger tyler pitt whom he met on flight home once jack is sucked into tyler world he can get out literally they begin fight club an organization based on brutal and bloody fistfights that signify nothing other than provide those that join sense of belonging as the fight club grows things get out of control and take on cult status beginning one future soldier who proves his worth standing still outside tyler house for three days dare not even begin bring up the last quarter of the since that contains the twist that explains the pointless journey suffice it say was truly disappointed in fincher who previous two films seen and the game put him in very slim category of truly brilliant young filmmakers of the next generation this is not imply any means that he is no longer genius or capable of bringing more masterpieces the table but fight club he has allowed his unique talent for extraordinary vision be distorted silly digital experiments and selfreferencing elements such as talking the audience about what they are seeing telling them that the little blips in the right hand corner are signifiers that the projectionist is changing reels and that slightly altered recurring line is good flashback humor now throughout the coarsely woven texture and overextended plot lines fight club is obviously trying make various social comments about the state of the world today advertisements interoffice politics corporations you name it it addressed though the media are suspiciously absent from the institutions that are referenced all of them play an important role how so well can kinda just tell can really put my finger on it say that starbucks and barnes noble are taking over their respective markets and kicking out the small business owner is no big news is that bad for the world probably not much room for social commentary there we all know that interoffice politics are just that politics so what was the point of all this the seems desperate make point or number of points but couldn figure out what they were all saw was very bizarre social satire that was woven strange techniques bleak visual design and some fine acting pitt carter norton all of them are good even meatloaf is good when you get the end you will most likely be filled questions many of the filmmakers wanted you ask of yourself not them because each of them would likely give you different answer fight club means what you want it mean think fincher just gives you the stuff think about but it couldn be more bizarre and unappealing sure it had shock value but so did seen and the game and they were significantly stronger films

staring george clooney arnold schwarzenegger chris odonnell and uma thurman alicia silverstone well start this off would just like say couple things first is miss michael keaton miss tim burton and would much prefer think that these last two batman films are all like dallas dream sequence not even from the first was batman really the star though he was damn close in the first couple anyway in batman forever and now in batman robin he is almost pushed being bit player cannot really say if clooney who regardless was better than kilmer was very good batman or not he is given next nothing do at all he might as well not have been there and it would not have made much difference now joel schumacher has said that he refuses bend the masses that have hated his films and cheered for the return of buton that he wont make batman brooding and dark fine mean granted batman returns while being an awsome was bit dark sometimes yet his bright neon campy style is just killing anything this series meant me am usually very easy on films loved con air and other films some critics have slammed granted that really was paper thin cliche ridden except for one thing it was fun there is virtually no fun in this at all could not have cared less it will thrill the little ones as theres no violence really none everyone comes out fine in the end like those old tv shows where it ends everyone laughing schwarzenegger is awful mean really really bad and this is coming from regular fan of his work love his movies most of the time and the basic reason is he never says much in any of them he talks all often in this movie would have much prefered have seen patric stewart in the roll believe truely like you have care about at least someone in liked alfred but the reason behind it is cheap shot

even though have the utmost respect for richard dreyfuss as an actor his presence in motion picture does not guarantee any particular level of quality like everyone else dreyfuss has bills pay so he occasionally accepts big paychecks for prominent roles in bad movies consequently while his career highlights include jaws close encounters of the third kind stakeout and tin men his resume is dotted titles like moon over parador let it ride and now krippendorfs tribe let me start out saying that krippendorfs tribe is occasionally funny although never riotously so but that is about its only asset the best word describe this is asinine the target audience would appear be recent nursery school graduates if not for the numerous sexual innuendoes are aimed at someone going through puberty krippendorfs tribe tries be zany offthewall comedy but the makers have forgotten three important rules the first is that some minimal level of plot credibility has exist the second is that viewers should be able identify or at least care about character or two finally and most importantly more than of the jokes have work once upon time james krippendorf dreyfuss was respected professor of anthropology at little bounderby college he and his wife obtained grant seek out lost tribe somewhere in the wilds of new guinea goal they never accomplished shortly after their return from the failed trip krippendorfs wife died and he was left the herculean task of raising three children shelly natasha lyonne mickey gregory smith and edmund carl michael linder on his own now over year later the college wants see the results of the money they gave krippendorf he has spent not on research but on things for his family so they send new member of their faculty professor veronica micelli jenna elfman inform him that he has been scheduled give lecture on his findings when he arrives at the college for the momentous event rather than telling the truth and risking being sent jail for misappropriating school funds he fabricates tale about mythical lost tribe the shelmikedmu provide video footage he films his children dressed in native garb soon much krippendorfs surprise the shelmikedmu are national phenomenon but one disaffected professor lily tomlin is determined prove that the tribe is fraud the only way krippendorfs tribe works is if you assume that all of the characters not mention the viewers are dumber than dirt unfortunately it is impossible like or sympathize bunch of putzes like this director todd holland completely fails develop any character into something more substantial than device implement various dubious gags meanwhile attempts at satirizing the shallowness of american culture e how easily the public can be fooled into jumping on the bandwagon of the latest trend come across as feeble and derivative the acting in underwhelming dreyfuss has definitely not given his all the role of james krippendorf alongside him jenna elfman the spunky costar of tvs dharma and greg radiates perkiness and little else this quality while fine for minute television program quickly becomes irritating in the arena of featurelength movie no one in the supporting cast lily tomlin david ogden stiers natasha lyonne woody allens daughter in everyone says love you excels know that movies in trouble when it is half the length of titanic but seems much longer most of what comes on screen is generic sitcom level material the kind of slop that people will absorb while dozing off in their favorite easy chair in front of the television set if there is any upside it is that do not see much boxoffice support developing for this lame illmarketed miscue krippendorfs tribe will quickly become extinct

movies about teenagers and teenage culture rarely prove be either interesting entertaining or convincing because of one fundamental reason movies are made adults and not teenagers occasionally however films like say anything dazed and confused and the breakfast club will break the mold and offer genuine insight into the lives of those bizarre creatures surround us called teenagers cannot hardly wait however does not instead the writingdirecting team of harry elfont and deborah kaplan manages take every clich found in the teenage genre strip it completely of perception intelligence and wit and turn it into one of the most nauseating cinematic experiences have ever been subjected cannot hardly wait follows group of characters as they attend house party on the night of their high school graduation the main characters are such perfected stereotypes that no analysis needs be provided perfectly understand them there is the average male protagonist preston ethan embry prom queen and cheerleader amanda jennifer lovehewitt football star mike peter facinelli white rapper wannabe kenny seth green computer geek william charlie korsmo and brainy outsider denise lauren ambrose could not stand any of those characters whether it was william getting drunk and signing along heavy metal songs or kenny proclaiming yo gotta have sex tonight all could think of was how elfont and kaplan possibly managed con columbia pictures out of ten million dollars fund their apparently cannot hardly wait is supposed be comedy but it tends fail in this respect because of the fact that it is not funny in all honesty elfont and kaplan should be forced their employers attend remedial classes in humour and when say forced mean it they should be strapped down chair and have their eyes wedged open in similar fashion alex in clockwork orange this is how desperately they need be educated about the concept of humour for instance cannot hardly wait features foreign exchange student who is instructed repeat absurd statements such as am sex machine for some reason elfont and kaplan believe that if this character repeats it enough eventually it will be funny if only elfont and kaplan could recognise the irony that they actually got paid for making this junk now that is funny

way of the gun is brimming surprises some good most bad one of the good ones is ryan phillippes surprisingly halfway decent performance after the actor gained much attention posing and preening through teen swill like know what you did last summer he hinted at bit growth in last years cruel intentions his amusingly contemptuous john malkovich meets james spader performance though his acting in that faltered around the third act mark precisely when the screenplay made his character grow heart presumably appeal his training bra wearing fans and start bellyaching about how he would fallen for his target it was dramatic shift that neither phillippe nor the films director could negotiate but he seems be trying and that should not be overlooked or probably over praised seeing as how at this point he really is not required do much but look pretty here phillippe has procured five day growth of beard his hair askew and his affect altered sound something like james cagney in all his look here see glory it is tough believe pretty boy like phillippe as hard ass but his performance actually helps the illusion unlike ben afflecks puppy dog approach in reindeer games phillippe is believable and not too bad at that as for the plot well that is one of the bad surprises phillippe and the great benicio del torro play two moronic and not even remotely likeable criminals introduced us in the parking lot of rave where they stupidly pick fight about twenty people who hatch scheme kidnap surrogate mother juliette lewis after overhearing that she is carrying the baby of painter scott wilson very well connected wealthy man the kidnapping devolves into laborious shoot out where much damage is done and many are killed but the antiheroes escape the woman while an aging hit man james caan and two scheming bodyguards taye diggs and nicky katt remain in pursuit directed christopher mcquarrie the screenwriter who won an oscar for his work on usual suspects an overrated piece of crime noir in many circles this one included way of the gun is hodgepodge of crime thriller motifs that just oozes eye rolling familiarity unlike phillipe mcquarrie does not seem be growing at all he fills his flick sprawling labyrinth of plot all snatched from movies know have seen before and worse it feels like it the lacks even fresh approach like what soderbergh did out of sight or the limey its clich all of are spewed before us in picture that tries so desperately be hip and gritty without bothering notice how common it is it features characters living code they seemed have picked up in sam peckinpah rather than any thing resembling life even attempts at emotional weight feel strained like in preposterous scene where enemies james caan and benicio del torro stop in their tracks have cup of coffee and pontificate on life philosophy etc did not like the bit much when it first appeared in heat here it is even more self consciously dramatic usual suspects also featured bunch of low lives that seemed live code they learned from the movies worked some degree because of that astonishing twist ending nowadays an astonishing twist per ending is de rigeur never mind if it deems all that transpired before it completely inconsequential thus nearly every character in way comes at least one dirty little secret most amateurishly projected before they appear and it too has an ironic little twist at the end nothing earth shattering like in the usual suspects but admit did not see it coming and smiled however most of the movie feels exactly like the interrogation scenes between palminteri and spacey in usual suspects lot of faux huffing and puffing no rhythm or reason or substance it is just as overplotted as suspects and often dull as any overplotted movie without interesting characters distinctive style or good script would be even the good stuff most of involves james caan doing fine job feels odd and out of place in movie that thinks lines like karma is only justice out the satisfaction are clever at one point caan laments need is the ultimate monkey line so inexplicable he might as well have said love is like hippo ass have seen porno better dialogue and some better plot lines too but rarely has porn offered up such talented cast mean can you even compare james caan ron jeremy caan slips into this role seeming ease he could do this kind of softspoken tough guy in coma but he manages give his character depth and weariness benicio del torro is always welcome though here he plays it fairly straight rather than another oddball character creation like the ones the actor gave us in usual suspects and excess baggage adopting brad pittesque quizzical pout go along his heavy swaggering speaking of pitt his ex juliette lewis is weak link either shouting her lines ear shattering shrillness or waddling about like silly goose nicky katt was brilliant in brief role in the limey here his role is just as brief only he seems wasted he is only kept around for his cold presence taye diggs has similar function cool as ever but never character though the guy has one helluva death scene for the most part way is incessantly talky no reason give hippos ass about any thing that transpires since its characters are never more than simplistic pawns it is vaguely tarantinoish but in bad truth and consequences nm way phillippe in one scene leaping into stupid rant about faggots migrating los angeles you know the routine the final shoot out is pure bargain basement john woo who himself seems be doing bargain basement john woo interchangeable bad guys lining up be shot at but those gun shots sure crack like thunder just the other day was watching an old dirty harry movie on cable and was stunned hear the weak elephant gruntlike sound that emanated from harrys fetishized smith and wesson oh how far we have come

when critics attack seemingly wellintentioned films like patch adams or more recently pay it forward as am about do their opinions are often greeted backlash of angry emails sometimes even mock death threats from those who suppose like be shamelessly manipulated their entertainment even politicians tend dismiss critics as heartless cynics for occasionally dumping on goodhearted films while praising filth like pulp fiction these fill in the derogatory term that you are comfortable tend forget that critics job is review the movie not the message however sweet and endearing that message may be thusly patch adams is not bad because it is about doctor who cares for his patients it is bad because it is calculated piece of brazen audience exploitation similarly while pay it forward may have its heart in the right place though even doubt that stay tuned an explanation is forthcoming it is still an unpleasantly maudlin mess the picture is about an emotionally guarded th grade history teacher somewhat similarly guarded kevin spacey burn scared face and equally singed attitude who gives his class the seemingly impossible assignment of doing one thing over the course of the semester that will change the world year old trevor haley joel osmet disneyfied do gooder who takes care of his alcoholic mother helen hunt comes up the notion pay it forward this entails person doing one good deed call it an uber favor for three others then telling them do the same for three others and before long we are all living in frank capra movie meanwhile in parallel story weasely reporter jay mohr tracks the movement has apparently begun grow pay it forward has odd ideas about tone at certain points it hurls smattering of unnecessary cynicism at us as if that would be the appropriate antidote the unrelenting sappiness at its core it is as if director mimi leder did not have the confidence make pay it forward the way she intended and compromised out of fear that her was not gutsy enough earn the acclaim it has clearly been made for so the picture adds grit child molester propositions trevor homeless man returns heroin after being saved character is knifed while doing good deed etc though it seems shallow incorporated into the proceedings because the itself is not quite sure if it is ready buy into its own utopian blather pay it forward offers crowd pleasing elements for general audiences jay mohrs umpteenth variation on the waspy sleazeball angie dickinsons earthy alcoholic bag woman and the jivetalking black hoodlum heart of gold coming on the heals of the black godlike inmate embodied gabriel casseus in bedazzled this may just be the beginnings of brand new guilty white liberal clich hurray for who actually calls the mohr character nigga and says things like can you feel me leave it pay it forward happily include little minstrel act for our further enjoyment maybe spikes flick was not so misguided after all these scenes feel as if they belong in dopey comedy feel good aspirations rather than the irritatingly saccharine drama that you will find yourself trapped in should you not heed my warnings while the filmmakers have stressed in interviews that they actually hope this is that could make the world better place me the final product has the oily feel of cynical politician contemptuously reciting cookie fortune slogans hopeful audience it is picture that looks be tailor made for academy consideration the main players all previous oscar winners or nominees given big emotional scenes that are practically variations on their most lauded turns one scene in slightly deglamed helen hunt deglamed here means that not only is she fashion victim her look is somewhere between goth queen and trailer park mama hunts hair is also natty and badly bleached verbally castigates spacey feels right out of her as good as it gets oscar clip spacey of course responds in his cultured monotone that could be straight from his low key american beauty performance maybe the actor should get an award for coming off the least self consciously irritating though how can he not even when he is emoting spacey seems somehow shielded wry indifference the usually talented helen hunt is the worst offender in one atrocious touched an angel moment hunt slaps osmet immediately covering her mouth the guilty hand in that very same stroke and said hand still on said mouth she actually begins convulsing dry heaving really then and am not making this up she scurries the kitchen tearing the place apart in frenzied search for alcohol the scene is so hokey it could very nearly be construed as parody of hackneyed tv movie blowups it is all very theatrical especially hunts performance feels like pathetic plea the academy for another oscar pay it forward has the dubious distinction of being that could be used as an argument for why actors should not get academy awards the picture unknowingly affirms that oscars transform nuanced talent into overwrought expressionists even haley joel osemt the wunderkind who was nominated for an academy award for his unforced performance in sixth sense seems more divisive about his expressions and inflections his acting has become broader less intimate it is as if we can make out the little munchkins thoughts boy this outta floor em naturally osmet is made play one of those onlyinthemovies children martyrfigure who cleans up after his mother lectures her on the ills of drinking and even fixes her up on date his intellectual teacher never mind that the two could not be more dissimilar his mother is trailer trash dopey and the teacher is one of those dennis millerey intellectuals who hides his insecurities behind vast vocabulary nevertheless this little nudnik goes out of his way bring the pair together in scene that recalls parent trapish cornball antics but oh how we love bright articulate selfsacrificing children who pick adults up their bootstraps and guide them through life they are so adorable of course the blame cannot all be hoisted onto the actors though the exception of the little kid they probably should have known better instead the brunt of it should be passed on mimi leder who directed one of the most thrilling episodes of er then went on make two awful genre films in row the first being the peacemaker witless postcold war george clooney vehicle and deep impact one of the two films of squander the premise of earths possible demise crazed meteorite the first flick was sunk an over reliance on clich and complete absence of any kind of emotional involvement not aided an ending actually centered around the diffusing of ticking time bomb complete digital read out apparently present for an invisible audience deep impact has more in common pay it forward it is movie that treats earths impending destruction in awfully simplistic terms completely ignoring the havoc that would so obviously take place if the world believed its planet would be goner within days the was full of inspirational speeches where people really said nothing though the sappy score swelled up make it appear as if they were being profoundly touching in pay it forward leder continues in this vein her intermittent dollops of cynicism seeming almost like rebuttal see my movie is not as na ve as you might think she seems be saying no it is just horribly confused

where do begin okay how about this starship troopers is one of the worst movies hit theaters in long time in fact it might even be the worst major release come out in years or even decade this is bad beyond belief would not suggest paying money see this there is good chance you will regret it if you see it for free you could still want walk out go right ahead the movie starts off cheesy scenes set in the future world of buenos aires here we meet the group of horrendously bad actors and actresses playing obnoxious easyto despise withapassion characters that have love triangles love rectangles and love hexagons screwing up their life before long they all go off and join the military primarily in the interest of having sex the other youngsters that joined they train they strut around nude for no reason whatsoever after an hour of making the audience scream in agony they start fighting bugs the big bugs look nice even though their design is only okay unfortunately the fights are boring since we want all of the characters dead anyway cue more agony then some characters have sex then some more die who cares cue more agony the movie ends the audience runs out their cars vomits over the pavement and attempts drive home unfortunately after that torture they cannot think straight do not pay attention the road and many are in ugly car wrecks you remember how batman robin was bad well batman robin kicked this movies sorry butt people starship troopers does not succeed as an action movie it does not succeed as drama it does not succeed as war movie it does not succeed as comedy it does not succeed as satire it does not succeed as parody it succeeds as being horrible terrible gutwrenchingly bad wanted run away from that movie every minute but paid my money and owed it others see if the movie got any better so stayed it never got better frequently it did the impossible and got worse the movie as written acted directed and basically just feels as whole like it is about on the mental maturity level of free willy the whole thing feels like movie that only threeyearolds could enjoy except for the ridiculously gratuitous blood and gore and pointless nudity it is written for little children but children should definitely not go anywhere near it of course recommend the same for everyone do not go anywhere near it verhoevens got streak going now his last movie was showgirls he seems be trying see how bad his movies can get before people finally stop coming showgirls was failure but it appears that though it will be lucky make near its budget this movie will still do okay grosswise is it really all bad well no troopers has about four or five lines of dialougeshort humorous scenes that are actually funny mostly from the do you want know more commercials that pop up throughout the story promoting the joys of the joining the troopers so that adds up about seconds of entertainment and still about one hour minutes and seconds of miserable torture am totally confused as the way that some people are really enjoying this movie but do admit it so if you are willing possibly put yourself through torture go ahead and see it and decide for yourself if you love it or hate it do not know how anyone or any thing could love this movie but hey each his own feel free give it shot of course in the interest of saving your souls do not recommend it but guess what alien resurrection comes out november th and having already seen some of it and having read the script assure you that it will blow pretty much everyone away though opinion on starship troopers is reasonably split it will be difficult find someone that will not like alien resurrection when they have seen it this is possibly the years best intense action or at least one of the best if you really want see alien warfare that is played out intelligently and seriously see alien resurrection please avoid this

adam sandler turns up the charm in his latest romantic comedy the wedding singer unfortunately that also has the effect of softening his edge he is nowhere near his peak of happy gilmore not that it was much of one he is certainly not helped here rather frail plot the year is letting the whole obsess nostalgia adam sandler is nice guy robbie the titular wedding singer who entertains at the local reception hall belting out his interpretations of classic hits robbies life is thrown into turmoil when his fiancee linda angela featherstone leaves him at the altar however things are looking up when he meets julia drew barrymore waitress at the hall she is the perfect woman but for one small flaw she is engaged be married slick junk bond king glenn matthew glave so most of the deals the slow realization robbie that he and julia are in love and his attempts stop the wedding as far as plots go it is pretty thin and tired one fill the gaps the wedding singer delivers heaping spoonfuls of nostalgia from boy george michael jackson from miami vice dallas from the first cds the last rubiks cubes this revels in all the minutiae and then there is the music learning lesson from the successful soundtracks grosse pointe blank and romy and micheles high school reunion this packs more songs in the than the running time will allow as result most songs get maybe lyric or half but you can almost see the bright gleam in the record executives eyes the wedding singer vols and while the nonstop riffs get incredibly tiring at least they distract you from the plot at least last years my best friends wedding stirred up the standard keep your true love from marrying someone else plot making the rival nice person here glenn is such lowly rat of man that you never see what julia saw in him barrymore on the other hand is simply charming as julia leaves us adam sandler he is at his best in the when his nice guy persona fades little such as when he has breakdown on stage during wedding reception when he is in full niceguy mode he is more pathetic than endearing the boasts several cameos most notably steve buscemi and jon lovitz but none of them work well at all buscemis role as drunken best man simply fails be humorous lovitz on the other hand as rival wedding singer makes you long for his good old days on saturday night live where he was actually funny the only cameo has some appeal is guest appearance classic rocker during the films finale surprisingly one of the only plotrelated scenes actually works adam sandler still has some work do before he can become dependable leading man while he attempts change his image in the wedding singer the end result is no net gain

arriving in barrage of hype the blair witch project is one of the biggest box office success of the year however like the golden child although blair witch has made lot of money it is not very good donahue williams and leonard play themselves as three students who set out make documentary about the blair witch myth the is made up of the camcorder footage they recorded means grainy footage and woozy camera angles although events start of normal they get weird pretty quickly while the threesome argue more and more as the journey goes on although an interesting premise the blair witch project amounts nothing more than missed opportunity the biggest mistake the makes is let three mediocre actors the chance improvise most of the dialogue is adlibbed and still manages sound like poor bmovie the script eventually degenerates into shouting matches the fword included lot sound like students there are breaks in these arguments where some creepy events occur but then it is back the shouting and swearing gets very tiresome very quickly if wanted see three people get lost in the woods shout lot and swear would go on scout camp but no the audience is meant get some entertainment factor out of this but am not quite sure how the supernatural parts of the are actually interesting especially if close attention is paid the story developing first twenty minutes no music and no budget work the has depend on natural psychological scares are sometimes well delivered sometimes not never really felt truly scared during any part of the although there is small sense of fear underlying throughout the however because the actors are so irritating the scares are lost when it eventually reverts back heather saying what the ck is that lot and mike giggling like loony there is also the niggling fact that these student filmmakers do some really stupid things the main problem is the fact that even though these hapless bunch could be killed at any moment and are hopelessly lost heather still insists on filming it all the gives half hearted reason why she should want do this but it is not very convincing also the students have no idea how survive in the woods such as following large river flowing through the woods civilisation there are also some parts where the amateur camcorder footage is obviously staged heathers apology being major one the blair witch project in the end just fails deliver suppose if you have been lost camping before the may deliver some chills but this is no use for the other of the paying audience who have not been lost in the woods apart from the final minutes the is mind boggingly unscary and the shouting matches get hideously dull the spook scenes are short and far between and any other horror movie could probably achieve the same amount of fear that these scenes provide although good idea it is not executed well enough be fun scary cinema experience it is worrying fact when the website http www blairwitch com is better than the

the s army utilizes number of books known as field manuals stipulate the specific way in almost every action imaginable must be done one particular field manual is known as the fm among other things covers the practice of saluting under the saluting section is subsection covers how salute is rendered military work detail in the presence of superior officer the salute is rendered the highestranking individual present when the superior officer comes within six paces of the detail and is dropped when the officer passes six paces from the detail in any event the salute is rendered only the man or woman in charge rather than the whole group almost at the very beginning of the generals daughter we see generals motorcade passing work detail everyone salutes it looked impressive but it just was not right that little bit showed me that someone either did not do the appropriate research or made the conscious decision go style over substance for the scene in fact this would serve as metaphor for the rest of the picture as it seems director simon west tried so hard craft atmosphere and flash that he forgot coherent story and good characterization are also crucial good movie what results is that looks good but like that one scene just is not right the first fifteen minutes of the is good example paul brenner john travolta is an agent for the armys criminal investigation division undercover at georgia army base investigate an illegal arms sale prior the transaction the buyer gets whiff that brenner is not the unscrupulous supply sergeant he is supposed be and later that night attempts kill him shooting up the houseboat on brenner is living so ensues cat and mouse action sequence ends like certain scene in raiders of the lost ark we will just say that it involves propellers brenner then receives new orders when the commanding generals daughter captain elisabeth campbell leslie stefanson is found naked bound and dead on one of the bases training ranges he is teamed rape investigator sarah sunhill madeleine stowe uncover the truth about the peculiarly gruesome murder what want know is why the whole action scene the arms buyer was even necessary it gives no insight into brenner other than the fact that he is little cocky does the arms subplot turn up later no so why add this extra running time the the answer it looked cool or how about the atmosphere the beginning of the generals daughter presents us imagery of the deep south thick trees dirt roads sultry colors over water all backed up bayouesque music nice immersion in the setting but it soon does not matter for when the films plot shifts over the murder investigation so does the entire mood no attention is paid the location of the story and the music is altered fit very generic thriller theme did the filmmakers start out thinking they were making different movie instead of creating cohesive atmospheric theme for the entire we get the distraction of one of theme followed another just because the director thought he should show off some of the countryside the above examples also serve illustrate that inconsistency is another problem this movie as have already mentioned an entire section of the does not jibe the rest and the characterization only adds the difficulty brenner who comes across as man little respect for authority suddenly snaps in the presence of general campbell james cromwell and utters some of the corniest yes sir i have ever heard he even delivers an emotioncharged monologue about why he will work so hard catch the person who killed the generals daughter even though he was totally flippant about the whole thing just couple of minutes previous sunhill who initially comes across as professional investigator utilizes couple of blatantly illegal methods obtain information and even revels in her ingenuity both characters are protagonists but it is hard get behind them when their personalities are all over the place and in some cases simply unappealing could imagine that during filming west would shoot scene then take the actors aside and tell them let us do it again but this time want more say this because although travolta and stowe are normally very good in this they overact in most of their scenes an even worse offender is clarence williams iii as the generals aide colonel fowler swear the guy says all of his lines from the position of attention far cry from his days as linc in the mod squad cannot help but think he was acting from wests direction couple of side characters including west point psychologist john beasly and young female private ariyan johnson make their scenes nearly impossible bear the only two actors who seem have escaped wests influence are james woods who provides good performance as colonel moore elisabeths mentor at the psychological operations unit and timothy hutton as colonel kent of the military police woods relishes the role of man whose job is playing peoples minds and does so without ever taking it over the top hutton just kind of hangs around but at least he was not overacting have not read the nelson demille novel on this movie was based but will bet more than few dollars that the story was better in book form the movie version has got characters come and go little or nothing do except fill up space or provide bits of information seem neither mean anything in terms of advancing the story nor reveal any significance once the whole story is finished every time we are presented some new aspect the case west gives us more of that flash playing it up like it is the most momentous discovery ever but the information is not used the investigators at all instead when conclusions are drawn they are such tremendous leaps of faith that you wonder if successful investigations are not based on facts but lucky guesses instead the army should have saved time bringing in brennan and sunhill letting them play game of twenty questions the suspects then letting them guess who the killer was would have been over in half hour the finishes sort of bookend featuring the same style and southern scenery as the very beginning literally during the closing credits we get see brennan get in his car and drive off then we get see sunhill get in her car and drive off they both seem kind of happy maybe they were driving away from simon west

i do not appreciate it when thriller manipulates the viewer into thinking the plot is interesting when in fact it is ludicrous in the case of the generals daughter the plot is more than capable of intriguing you certain point but at this juncture in the story the movie begins fall apart like crumbling cookie this predictable summer thriller is only sporadically involving and that is unfortunately not enough compensate for all of it is detailed flaws get past one moment early on where john travolta exercises his southern accent and you are likely survive this entire movie travolta plays criminal investigations divisions officer paul brenner who is working undercover at military base when another situation arises the apparent rape and murder of young female officer leslie stefanson it turns out that the victim is the daughter of general joe campbell james cromwell let the investigation begin the assistance of fellow cid investigator sarah sunhill played rather onthesidelines madeleine stowe brenner uncovers what appears be an intricate and bizarre homicide case things begin get marginally engrossing when we meet colonel moore james woods former commanding officer of the deceased who has few secrets up his sleeve woods submits another scenestealing performance here as he oozes authority surrounded clouds of smoke emitted from his cigar echoes of his supporting role in true crime in he duked it out clint eastwood in enjoyably profane verbal exchanges he makes every moment believable here though the intense dialogue comes care of confrontations travolta as the two send mindful knowing glares across the room there are many scenes such as this in the generals daughter in the veteran cast performs splendidly under pressure but the circumstances that tie these meetings together are difficult absorb director simon west con air shows watchful eye of delivering stylish looking thriller but he fails miserably when it comes the intellectual part of it the generals daughter is more often than not predictable and unexciting mess it does not help matters that the plot is virtually actionless dragging it is heels all the way at mindnumbing snails pace few brief action scenes marvelously handled in the editing department show that the movie could have delivered such more proficient package from director who does such great job of staging explosions and miraculous stunts suggest west should stick mindless riproaring action features and attempt avoid future projects like this still the movie is certainly not without it is merits the
