acting is very good from the majority of the experienced cast the performances range from commanding travolta electric woods stiffasaboard cromwell who does not show off his real talents here madeleine stowe manages hold her own for while but as the female lead in an actionthriller she does not pull through sufficiently one of the problems the execution is that it is very predictable from minute one had few doubts about the identity of the killer in question the script even unwillingly points him out for us using familiar techniques hide his guilt until the unmasking toward the end in all fairness we have seen many of the devices used in the generals daughter put greater effect in other films the secrets behind the girls mysterious death are explained gradually but the resolution we have tunneled through so much malarkey that it feels unnecessary and surprisingly silly the generals daughter is not terrible movie and it is involving enough sustain viewers attention span for certain period of time but it just could have been so much better

at one point in this movie there is staging of an opera that goes completely wrong but one member of the crowd stands up and cheers thinking the performance was planned and applauding it for their efforts that is dirty work in nutshell very different kind of movie this is not movie that can easily review the critic in me analyzes the structure plot acting characters and tells me this movie is terrible but the norm macdonald fan in me had me rolling on the floor laughing this movie plays more like an hbo sketch comedy than movie it is one note concept mitch and sam need in order bribe doctor give their father heart transplant before other more needy patients realizing they are very good at revenge plots they open revenge for hire business eventually running afoul of rich businessman played christopher macdonald who after roles in happy gilmore and veronicas closet seems typcast in this role who sends them destroy building that mitch learns is the home of his girlfriends grandmother thus leading them plot against the rich businessman on the night of the grand opening of new opera house first the critic in me the plot is the standard poor guy vs evil rich guy device where the main character meets the girl of his dreams along the way heres the catch none of the characters are sympathetic they are all selfish jerks who do not care who they hurt in their attempts do whatever they want the jokes are juvenile crude appealing the worst elements in people there is jokes about prostitutes the homeless beastiality anal sex there is even subplot that is developed it seems only make jokes about infidelity and incest and loved watching it was huge fan of norm macdonalds sarcastic tothepoint comedy on saturday night live and this movie is an hour and half of it norm macdonald takes joke strips it the core and tells it like it is dry wit like the scene were he and his friend are learning the ropes at new construction job the foreman goes over the basics mitch and sam do not understand how do they get out of it admiting they lied on their resumes and do not know thing about construction and surprise they get fired the characters are incredibly meanspirited there is father who is loud and obnoxious gambling addicted doctor played chevy chase who tells sam of his fathers condition saying if were gambling man would put lot of money on death the businessman cole who always has his dog spunky and does who knows what it and then there is mitch and sam who thinking they can get destroying building ponder how their actions would ruin the lives of the residents too bad we have do it mitch says heres movie where every joke that is executed as it is set up where you see every punchline coming where every spot profanity could be used and then is used at least the is honest and makes no mistake that it is anything more than idiotic but at least it is not dull and it is not predictable and that is the way it should be it is sketch comedy and if you are fan of norm macdonald you will love it the jokes are crude the characters are mean the core the attitude of the movie is that it just does not care if you do not like norm macdonald or stupid movies then you probably will not like this one the jokes are crude the characters are mean the core the attitude of the movie is that it just does not care so before seeing this one tune your mindset and prepare for slew of norm macdonald humor gay animal sex prison rape jokes uncaring characters and one last performance from chris farley the critic in me says but give it an just could not stop laughing

the new austin powers continues movie tradition begun in the eighties produce something anything that will get the high school and junior high kids in the theater because they buy more soda and popcorn than senior citizens the usual hallmarks of this filmmaking tradition are all here gross humor sex jokes silly sight gags more sex jokes and the is strong contender in the current race be cruder grosser and more outrageous than that last what the is not however is funny the plot centers around the return of dr evil who goes back in time steal austin powers mojo liquid red stuff in it extracted from austins pelvis gives austin his sexual prowess and the charisma defeat his enemies austin must go after him and returns the swinging sixties where free love and sexy secret agents had their heyday almost avoided this because did not like the original but the films premise sounded like an excellent comic vehicle and the received many good reviews wish had stuck my first impression myers is trying be the jerry lewis of this generation and he has the talent do it at least as an actor but the material he is working here much of it his own falls short of anything resembling comic genius this movie tries carry the day sight gags about drinking distilled feces fivehundredpound fat mans butt crack and barrage of sex jokes aimed at the level of the average year old after some of these scenes one has wonder how gross the next generation of films will have go get an audiences attention the direction also helps the achieve new low point in cinematic humor for the most part felt as if was watching saturday morning chalderns live action tv show there is no sense of comic timing or subtlety the director just throws the material at us giving us nothing except the hope that anyone camera could be director am sure the will have appeal many of the under crowd at least the ones who have yet discover literacy certainly the movie is directed towards the generation that prefers everything described as in your face kick you in the teeth take no prisoners actionverb blah blah blah if you see the and you find you are not laughing there is nothing wrong you it just means you grew up since seventh grade

you know never really wondered what the tarzan films would have been like had tarzan been an old man while watching instinct could not help but acknowledge the way the carelessly rehashes the wellexplored themes of those earlier movies even beside the tarzan comparison instinct just is not very good it is painfully idealistic manipulative and silly did not hate it it is simply impossible for me hate any starring anthony hopkins furthermore most of the acting is quite good but can recognize instinct for what it is beyond my subjective admiration for the actors involved can also recognize reasons for wanting make instinct and it is pretty clear that this could have been good massive script overhaul and director less interested in imitating movies like patch adams things start off in the predictable way as director jon turtletaub introduces us our hero theo caulder cuba gooding jr an ambitious young psychiatrist under the supervision of an experienced old psychiatrist donald sutherland caulder soon finds himself involved in the case of his life the one he thinks will make him famous the subject is ethan powell hopkins an anthropologist who has been living among gorillas in africa for the past two years powell has been charged the brutal murders of several men in africa and it is now caulders job find out of he is mentally competent enough stand trial through series of short sessions caulder tries put together the complex psyche of powell even though it really is an old man version of tarzan much of this central idea is rather interesting as said hopkins is captivating for every second he is on screen he has way of convincing us that he is not acting that he is actually man who has just spent two years of his life living family of wild gorillas the character himself is not very interesting he is just an anthropologist who really likes gorillas but hopkins makes him interesting subtleties both in speech and action gooding jr does strong work opposite hopkins playing caulder as an intelligent and flawed individual the screenplay written gerald di pego and suggested novel daniel quinn gives us no background information on caulder but that seems be the point he has no time for friends because he is obsessed his work nonetheless these two actors are essentially the entire list of things that are good about instinct unfortunately filmmaking this inept can mangle the effect of even the best acting turtletaub and di pego are both guilty of instincts artistic failure for they work together make the dumbest most clicheridden environment in their characters are live and they do so means of brainless subplots first we have the prison warden subplot the prison warden is evil and wants stop caulders progress at any cost if this means taking caulder off the powell case then that is fine there is also the prison guard subplot the prison guard is played john ashton the prison guard seems enjoy mercilessly beating upon the psychotics under his supervision and he is instrumental in helping the story along its obvious conclusion then there is the daughter subplot in maura tierney playing the daughter must look very upset lot of the time after all she is the daughter of deranged man if some of this stuff sounds familiar that is because they are all devices that have been used and reused in countless other films the evil doctor in patch adams is not unlike the evil warden here the offensive caricatures of mental patients lack the depth that the similar portrayals in one flew over the cuckoos nest had ashtons evil prison guard pales in comparison clancy browns in the shawshank redemption hopkins performance will undoubtedly remind audiences of his turn in the silence of the lambs and then there is the whole tarzan thing is more than little bit obvious through the entire perhaps what irritates me most about instinct is the halfhearted attempt at philosophical depth the message powell brings back from the wild is not subtle one he thinks that humans are takers that they expand and kill and that we should all just live like gorillas can sympathize that but only when it is in compelling this is the kind of stupid movie just like patch adams in big group of characters psychotic inmates in this case rise against the evil forces oppressing them tearing up playing cards what does any of this have do man who has just spent two years of his life gorillas if all the subplots of instinct had been left on the cutting room floor we would have had thirtyminute movie far superior the twohour one that watched today if the central idea had been developed beyond the old man tarzan premise then we would really have had something interesting movie that does not rely on the strength of its actors

in the finale of disneys mighty joe young foot tall pound gorilla holds frightened young boy in its clutches as it topples from crippled ferris wheel and plummets the ground upon impact rugged everyman and perennial dogooder bill paxton rushes in containing the emotional crowd an earnest move along now folks there is nothing see here ok so those are not exactly the words he uses but it is probably one of the few clich not uttered in this unnecessary remake of an unnecessary remake of that mother of all monster movies king kong mighty joe young was an update of that classic creature feature also based on merian coopers original story years after kong it appeared the world was ready for new take on the beauty and the beast fable now some years later at least according disneys way of thinking the world is ready for one more not so the onlyand mean onlyreason see the version is for the special effects and these unfortunately run hot and cold todays joe young is designed and produced specialeffects whiz rick baker who has been wowing audiences his stateoftheart makeup effects since schlock incidentally featured bakerenhanced gorilla joe is combination of animatronic effects computer graphics and that old standard man in monkey suit while there are occasional flashes of brilliancebakers had lot of practice simian effects after all including gorillas in the mist greystoke the legend of tarzan lord of the apes and the remake of king kong there is also some surprising cheesiness one of the films most embarrassing moments is when paxtons band of african trackers first encounter and pursue the largerthanlife primate in scene unashamedly ripped off from the lost world jurassic park paxton jubilantly extols the beasts majestic gait at the same exact moment as joe and the computer effects driving him stutter halt also if the films producers had wanted us focus our attentions on the titular ape they should not have paraded female lead charlize theron trial error around in seeminglyendless wardrobe of spaghettistrapped tops even joe seems distracted at times the piles on the clich like there is no tomorrow including the predictable plot anthrozoologists ship gigantic gorilla a where urban havoc is inevitably wrought predictable villain lithuanian think overheard someplace predictable love story bill and charlizesurprise and predictable denouement twas boxoffice receipts that killed the beast kids raised on men in black nonmonkey effects also baker are going find ron tremors underwoods outing little lame comparison while certainly better than king kong lives itself lousy sequel not particularly good remake mighty joe young proves how the mighty keep falling

an attempt at florida noir palmetto fails at the most fundamental levels it is slow moving uninvolving and plain just uninteresting harry barber woody harrelson is an exnewspaper man just out of jail after being framed for crime his luck has not been the best but things are looking up when mysterious woman rhea malroux elisabeth shue approaches him proposition she wants harry help her and her stepdaughter odette chloe sevigny pull off fake kidnapping scheme get out of her stingy but rich husband felix rolf hoppe at first all harry is expected do is provide threatening voice on the phone and collect the money of he gets keep but as the deed is carried out things are not what they seem and harry gets caught in the ensuing storm palmetto pulls out all the stops achieve noir but the effect never quite comes together it is got the sultry florida heat seductive women and even curvier plot twists but the whole thing smells of paintbynumbers sure the right ingredients are there but the end result is much too artificial lot of the problems lie the script though providing some genuine surprises is packed full of leaden dialogue and bland situations even the plot twists do not seem flow well the rest of the story some of them for example come from so far afield that they seemingly only make sense because the writer needed twist for example harrys spontaneous job offer or the whole typewriter situation the characters are mostly lifeless played type but not much more woody harrelson plays harry such imbecilic thickheadedness that it is hard even picture him as an exjournalist elisabeth shue vamps it up but does not add anything special the role chloe sevigny gives terrible performance trying be sexy year old but she just leaves bad taste in your mouth some of the supporting cast notably gina gershon and michael rapaport give stronger but in the end meaningless performances and top it off the pacing of the is much too slow as the movie grinds halt you are given too much time wonder why you are wasting it watching palmetto if you are in the mood for this type of movie you would be much better off going out and renting some classic noir

this is worth seeing for those who want see what mick jagger looks like when sporting an abe lincoln beard the rock and roller is asked carry the as the action antihero of australian legend ned kelly the socalled robin hood of the aussies but he fails be convincing in my opinion he is better suited play gene kelly than ned kelly the opens bw prologue of ned kelly bravely going his execution then it goes technicolor and ned is seen in what goes for flashback coming home from jail after year sentence see his mom and reacquaint himself the large kelly family this scene is set in in the background we hear the booming voice of waylon jennings as he sings shel silversteins lyrics tells of neds hatred for the british rule and hope for ireland be republic ned says debt must be paid as he hears voices from his dead father his classdivided country and his conscience all telling him get revenge so begins neds romp through australias outback seeking justice for all the wrongs his people have suffered he begins stealing horses after complaining about the unfair tax law on horses that stray favors the rich landowners when he is only he forms gang causing him hide the rest of his life from the police who put price on his head of two thousand pounds when neds mother clarissa kaye is jailed on false charge of abetting criminals and sentenced years ned offers surrender in exchange for his mothers freedom when the authorities refuse the kelly brothers go on robbing rampage burning mortgages of the poor found in postal vaults and murdering some soldiers rampaging through the outback they gather sympathy among the poor and lower classes who do not trust the traps police spoiler follow in the next paragraph in the climax kelly and his gang plan ambush train british police but someone kelly trusted tips the police on the train and kelly is trapped in saloon and captured neds brothers commit suicide rather than be taken alive but kellys gang escapes as ned heroically has the police go after only him and his brothers as they become decoys this was flat presentation hardly touching an emotional button on what all the fuss was about over ned kellys call for justice jagger did not have prayer in succeeding in this dry script offered ian jones and tony richardson the story failed focus on australia seemingly more british than australian under richardsons lackluster direction all jagger seemed do was proclaim his innocence and vow revenge soon became shrill cry if you want see better about ned kelly catch mad dog morgan much truer and more daring version dennis hopper giving much better characterization of ned kellys madness something this could only do in hohum manner

i think we should as responsible citizens all get together and stop jim carrey from making another movie he is changing the cinema as we know itand for the worst would willingly rewatch batman and robin rather then again sit through this miserable collection of filmic momentsprologues epilogues etc the premise lawyer cannot lie for day ho ho normally movie made from this premise would be terriblemr carrey suceeds in making it unwatchable laughed onceand was laughing at the sight of everyone else laughing grinding does not begin describe it pounds on your head so forcefully and so unstoppably that if you are normal person you leave feeling sick when it is not trying be funny it is trying be melodramaticbut it is just annoying stupid and sappy at best this movie is intended make people laugh yes not be voted best picture of all time sight and sound but it fails on every possible level it fails be funny it fails be insightful it fails be suspensful it fails be fun they should pay people see it it suceeds on one levelit makes me want get down on the ground and start thanking orson welles for having lived if you go in the intention of coming out alive please make sure that you are overly fond of boob fart pimple and fat jokesotherwise you will go insane yes literally insane stark raving mad it is boring stupid melodramatic and in the end ugly reccemond it strongly ed wood

the best thing in fact the only good thing can say about dark city is that it made me want go see a confidential again or go rent body heat see william hurt do some real noir or even god help me palmetto alex proyass new movie screams atmosphere screamed too get me out of this theater new line cinema spent millions of dollars creating the expressionistic noir visuals and paying the actors and does not have any way get it back paid for matinee screening and do not have any way get my money back either you will hear lot from other critics about the look and feel of this movie will admit that the cinematographers and costume designers and set artists and cgi graphics geeks all worked hard create stunning nightmarish future world where it is always late night in complete rotary phones and automats and fedoras have got news for you fellows do not care how hard you worked or how visually stunning this movie looks you wasted your time and mine working on movie without plot without clear sense of direction of where it wanted go without soul or reason care the movie starts out ohsopromising john murdoch rufus sewell is lying in bathtub in the sort of seedy hotel that in real life would have been boarded up long ago there is dead mutilated prostitute in the other room surprise as he has lost his memory the phone rings it is sinistersounding man claiming be his doctor telling him flee for his life all well and good right wrong apparently someone decided that the audience was just bit too dim figure out the intricacies of the plot this is getting be popular assumption in so the actual beginning of the movie is not sewell running for his life rather it is voiceover narration the aforementioned doctor keifer sutherland explaining exactly what is going on and who is responsible it is as though sam the piano player had told us that rick and ilsa had been getting it on in paris in the first three minutes of casablanca no wait that is not fair casablanca it is more like watching new plotline at the first of the show or if you want know how really feel having an offscreen narrator explain that gilligan will not be getting off the island in this episode from here the coherence of the plot goes down faster than insert monica lewinsky joke here the characters just wander around the city aimlessly and bump into each other for no apparent reason and that is what moves the plot what we are left is string of unanswered questions that do not make any sense we are given aliens unlimited omnipotent powers yet they forget use them at critical moments and get themselves killed we are given hero who can tune into these same powers yet he only uses them when it is convenient the plot we are given whole long list of loose ends that go nowhere usually critics will say that an actor playing an underwritten part is not given much do in this movie no one is given anything do sewell is given the impossible role of man who does not remember anything and plays it like um man who does not remember anything the aliens are tall pastyfaced and bald and wear long black cloaks and fedoras remind us that they are evil and there is child alien as well straight out of an anne rice novel sutherland is saddled limp twitchy eye and breathy accent remind us that he is in league the aliens its credit dark city boasts two impressive bits of casting william hurt is perfectly cast as the worldweary inspector charged catching the man who is murdering prostitutes all over the city jennifer connelly playing sewells love interest is given two alltoobrief moments on screen as lounge singer and turns in the sexiest performace this side of jessica rabbit but instead of the dogged policeman and the femme fatale given central treatment in the script the way they would be in any selfrespecting noir movie they are almost tangiential the plot such as it is the problem dark city is this it is bad science fiction movie pretending be noir the essence of noir is not as proyas seems beleive breathy dialogue or snapbrim fedoras or tall bald evil villains who would make peter lorre curl up in corner dark city has not one bit of intrigue moral ambiguity suspense or anything else that keeps us coming back the noir classics dark city is like the intricately carved door that kate winslet floats on in titanic it is an exceptionlly wellmade and intricately designed piece of flotsam sailing around and around the middle of the ocean going nowhere

the happy bastards second review american pie the summer of raunch continues spread into theatres this latest yuk fest filled sick jokes and teen dialogue aplenty if you go expecting dawsons creek you are in for problem if your expectations are lower and better might add you will enjoy the hell out of american pie the movie casts several unknowns the only real recognizable one being sctvs own eugene levy as happygolucky dad the story revolves around four high school seniors who have one goal before the school year gets out get laid that is pretty much it throughout the movie little sick comic bits are sprinkled throughout including memorable scene involving an apple pie will not give it away but you probably know what it is and an internet broadcast gone horribly awry of course the movie has some slightly sentimental bits but they do not drag the movies humor content down that bad most of the actors get their job done but it is levy who is hoot father who tries talk sex his son the help of some curious visual aids could not stop laughing during this movie and if you can stand all the raunch and the sex references then american pie is for you if you are one of those conservative types well will bet you are having fun at home while this south park and austin powers ii plays in theatres now are not you

_in brief _ this needs no introduction if you have not heard of it then you must have been up in space on sabbatical and if you have not seen it well suspect you are in small minority first things first is it all it is hyped up be well yes and no it is good and there is lot like about it but it is not without its problems when saw the first trailer for titanic it was when went see bean last summer think my intial reaction was as not that downright sick make disaster movie out of such dreadful reallife tragedy mean what is happened hollywoods scriptwriters have they run entirely out of new ideas gads whatever next asked myself how about an action based on hiroshima starring jean claude van damme was not entirely filled anticipation but then was not alone in that respect it is when it came out in the cinema rave reviews well mostly and anyone whod been see it seemed disturbingly obsessed it that started take notice did not see the until several months after its release time my sister had seen it about four times so went slightly more open mind but still did not think would enjoy it much did yes and no mainly yes am happy say the first hour or so was beautifully done not so much because of the scripting will talk about that later but because the recreated ship and sets were stunning look at as was camerons directing and the performances of the principal cast were so strong that the human aspect of the story the romance between rose kate winslet and jack leonardo dicaprio was enchanting the is told via flashback gloria stuart playing the elderly rose in the modern day you knew that course well it is an often effective device use in storytelling though sometimes it can fall flat does it work here in script form it does not add all that much the story what does add lot the story is gloria stuart whose stunning performance is the strongest most moving of the her presence brings much deeper level of passion and depth the story and though her appearances are relatively brief the would have suffered without her also impressive are dicaprio and winslet who wholly succeed in rising above the often poor dialogue and the bond they form is both heartfelt and moving it is an old story you know forbidden love ala romeo and juliet but it works and jacks rescuing rose in both literal and figurative senses and teaching her live life for what counts was pointed and touching in fact enjoyed the first half of the lot largely because winslet and dicaprio bring such and charm energy the romance it is engaging touching and very enjoyable there is more than tinge of poignancy it as well simply because you know it is not going be happy ending leads us the second half of the we all knew it was coming am sure director cameron was looking forward eager anticipation it because as he is stated in interviews the real thrust of the story for him was the sinking and the jackrose romance was merely manipulative plot device get you emotionally into the think that understates the importance of the romance as found it far more enjoyable than an hour of watching people die the iceberg arrives and the captain announces that titanic will have sunk in about an hour and it is an hour my goodness we do not miss second of that hour gratuitous well perhaps not todays standards am sure there is been far worse produced under the banner of entertainment in other films but certainly was not prepared for how shocking and graphic the last hour or so would be not that would expect the word understatement be part of camerons vocabulary he who brought us such umm vivid films as terminator and aliens is it overdone thought so understatement can sometimes work wonders in conveying tragedy no no one expected happy ending but did not quite expect the horrendously shocking and powerful scenes we were bombarded throughout the films second half still whether it was overdone and heavyhanded or not if it was the shockfactor cameron was after it worked because was shocked and moved in fact spent most of the last hour in tears you really could not help but get emotionally involved whether it was wishing someone would knock that dreadfully psychotic fiance of roses overboard or desperately hoping that rose would rescue jack or that jack would rescue rose or that they would both survive perhaps the most harrowing scene was when the ship has sunk and those that sunk along the ship freeze death on the water surface the bit where rose lets go of jacks hand while promising she will never let go in her heart was particularly heartwrenching and the sight of rescue boats sailing amid the ocean of corpses was pretty powerful image put no fine point on it loved the ending however was both moving and slightly uplifting following the horror of the past hour and half so we have established that the is powerful and moving if the last hour was rather excessive have not mentioned the script plotwise it is ok though the jackrose relationship was beautifully developed but have feeling that is the actors credit if anything as for the dialogue well titanic is set in it is period drama but saw very little indication of period in so far as the dialogue is concerned did they really use phrases like goddamn it back in the turn of the century doubt it would someone talk like this do ya love the guy or what doubt it is such dialogue as saw the iceberg and see it in your eyes now not just bit clumsy yes it is little more attention dialogue would not have gone astray and cameron himself is blame he wrote the script stick directing dude but its more than redeemed the acting dicaprio and winslet on fine form ably supported strong cast star of the show was gloria stuart though why did not she win that oscar after all they were throwing oscars at titanic left right and centre but gloria was perhaps the most deserving nominee directingwise cameron does spectacular job like said his vision was bit excessive but at least he directed it well have not even mentioned james horners beautiful score utterly heavenly though when your dad and sister play the soundtrack lot you do start get bit bored it have finished my rant lasted lot longer than thought it would just leaves couple of questions was it worth all those oscars hell do not talk me about oscars bloomin farce it was deserving in number of departments though last question is it as some suggest one of the best films of alltime nope do not think so it is certainly one of the most powerful and memorable films have ever seen but do not think it quite ranks as one of my alltime favourites and as for the fact they are reportedly making titanic well guess that is typical for you

in some respects rush hour is the ultimate exercise in cliched filmmaking the hero is the renegade cop that prefers work alone the cop in question cannot solve the case until he gets in trouble all chinese people are somehow involved in the criminal element the duo must always be completely mismatched the hero has say some smartassed comment before and after shooting someone however that does not necessarily make for bad rush hour is jackie chans first major since the dismal the protector proving once again that can learn many things from foreign markets ie hong kong jackie chan is given much more free reign than before still some diehard jackie chan fans may be disappointed as even chan himself has voiced displeasure over the length of the fight scenes he views as too short according one interview this takes familiar theme of east meets west jackie chan is lee the straight laced inspector who is imported help deal kidnapping case while chris tucker is carter the loudmouthed destructive cop that is promoted the fbi help him or at least so he thinks also another classic notion in action films the fbi must always get in the way of our heroes despite the necessary conventions of action films rush hour is some of the most fun you will spend and hour and forty minutes watching jackie chan continues be one of the most exciting martial artists on the big screen continuing perform his own stunts and dazzling audiences his flashy kicks and punches chris tucker familiar from his whiny annoying role in the fifth element is more palatable complementing jackie chans straightlaced character however jackie chan still maintains his comicslapstick edge as expected of him and his films perfectly downplaying the fishoutofwater routine through his characters attempts at mixing into american culture he makes up for the down time his character experiences when he is in action however you will be amused and dazzled still being inventive in the use of objects beat people up in this case steering wheel serving tray and barstool jackie chan proves be the pioneer of slapstick kung fu chris tuckers character may come across as irritating yet is also humorous since he is not physical actor the level of jackie chan he uses his main weapon his mouth hence the tagline fastest hands in the east meets the fastest mouth in the west while dialogue is not necessarily shakespeare it is appropriate for the and still very funny while not necessarily poignant attempts at character development and growth between characters come off surprisingly well lees knowledge of american pop culture that is the beach boys when contrasted against carters lack of knowledge of chinese culture makes for an interesting scene where lee teaches carter the kung fu disarming trick while carter teaches lee hiphop dance moves while rush hour is not at the same level as police story and known in north america as supercop and jackie chans first strike respectively it more than makes up for the poorly received films operation condor and mr nice guy its appropriate mixture of high kicks and lots of laughs it makes for fun as well it is true departure from jackie chan films as it is missing one common element whiny female costar

my fellow americans is movie that at first glance looks have little substance or movie that we have all seen million times two lifetime rivals thrown together and then the fun begins this is exactly what happened in this movie but fortunately they managed do it in an interesting and funny way the movie starts quick and do mean quick glance of two presidents russell kramer jack lemmon and matt douglas james garner william haney dan aykroyd and ted matthews john heard are the new president and vice president there is scandal that arises involving kickback from contractor and haney is positive that he buried that years ago he finds scapegoat in kramer and now everyone wants kramer and douglas dead this movie was exceptional for many reasons one being that they found people lemmon and garner that have good chemisty together they worked very well as unit and they mirrored each other perfectly one being ladies man and one being the old man will let you fiqure is also they found people that know their parts as govenment officials well it seemed me that garner played almost exactly the same role that he played in the distinquished gentleman except then he was congressman experience counts for lot

in the muse albert brooks plays steven phillips screenwriter who after winning humanitarian award for his work is dumped his studio they claim that he is lost his edge and his agent is quick agree them he knows that he needs write something fresh and original and quick or else his career will be over so he turns his best friend jack jeff bridges another screenwriter who is enjoyed success after success on the way over jacks house steven sees jack helping an attractive woman sharon stone into cab and begins think is he having an affair when confronted jack relunctently tells him that this mystery woman is in fact muse mythological figure who is believed have inspired all creativity and has helped him garner his success she does not do any actual writing he is told but inspires you steven is excited what he is hearing and asks jack call her up see if she will take steven on as new client jack arranges meeting between the two and suggests that steven bring her present preferably something from tiffanys after the meeting the muse sarah decides take on steven but at price she wants suite at the four seasons and wants steven perform odd tasks for her like bringing her salads in the middle of the night stevens wife andy macdowell sees him at food store and questions him about why he has tampons in his wagon steven confesses everything and although at first suspicious she later allows sarah move into their guest room and eventually into their life the only question for steven is if the muse is worth all the trouble he is going through for her and that is question only time will tell the muse is albert brooks sixth as writerdirectoractor he cowrote monica johnson and although it is good movie it is not up the level of his best works defending your life and mother the problem lies in the script and for movie that relies on its dialogue for its humor there are not nearly as many laughs as they are chuckles despite few good oneliners it has great premise but does not deliver up it is full potential but like albert brooks in this and think that we can all identify steven phillips little bit he may whine and complain but he just wants support his family and be happy and like sharon stone in this movie too it is nice change of pace for her and also enjoyed the cameos featuring the likes of rob reiner james cameron and martin scorsese and although the muse does not have as much say about as robert altmans the player still left the theater feeling good and that is something wish got out of more movies

plot good ol texan kid suddenly gets play firststring quarterback on his high school teams football team in town where football is considered religion the coach is just about the biggest ahole you would ever want meet who will do practically anything win the good ol texan boy does not approve of said mans methods critique fun football movie this was obviously geared towards the teen market mtv behind its production big tv star actor in the lead role rockin hip music galore and plenty of ta having said that enjoyed the look and feel of the movie thought james van der beek gave solid performance loved the slick sounds and yup loved that ta actually thought this was comedy going in but overall it plays more towards the dramatic than comedy also enjoyed jon voights performance as the stubborn dick coach as well as many of the other character players on the team this is not classic any stretch of the imagination but it might teach some kids the hard lessons behind the fun game of football or just allow them have good time for about an hour and fortyfive minutes in the movie theatre or in the comfort of their own home depending on where you watch this stuff all in all would definitely watch this movie if you like football play football or want your kid succeed in high school football you could also watch it if you like teen flicks lot of cute guys and girls running around doing their stuff and did mention the ta little known facts about this and its stars james van der beek actually started acting after concussion stopped him from playing football in real life he is the oldest of three children and his father is cellular phone salesman while his mom runs gymnastics studio he is born in connecticut and received for his role in this actor scott caan who plays football player tweeder in this is the son of famed actor james caan in real life that is right he is sonnys son actress amy smart who plays van der beeks girlfriend in this movie also played the main stars girl in the outside providence screenwriter peter iliff also had part in writing the screenplays for the harrison ford patriot games and the keanu reeves surfing flick point break director brian robbins might be best remembered as the cool dude from the tv series head of the class his name was eric mandrian and he generally wore long black trench coat on the show the book mox james van der beek is reading on the sidelines in this movie hidden inside the teams playbook is slaughterhousefive kurt vonnegut jr the high school fight song played at the pep rally is the texas am war hymn

i have admit that disliked this initially it certianly is not for every taste and it is sheer torture sit through if you are in restless mood that said if you are in the right mood it is absolutely incredible this was my second favorite movie of and would have been shooin for first in almost any other year perhaps the big turnoff for many was this films unconventionality would be hardpressed compare it any other that have seen it is very very artsy incredibly slow and amazingly it works beautifully on my second viewing realized that the follows the three act structure did not think it had any sort of structure at all when first saw it the first act serves set up the characters sort of it exists even moreso set mood of tension and restlesness and perhaps even feelings of boredom and then it is shattered the intense violence of the second encompasses most of the movie the majority of the is one extended battle scene intercut brief flashbacks and voiceovers the artsier elements do not detract from the action but add it they succeed in briefly letting the viewer peek into the minds of the soldiers only be suddenly yanked back into reality when the battle resumes the battle scenes are amazing second only saving private ryan in my opinion they are brutal horrifying and at times beautiful due the amazing cinematography the second act is as immersive brilliant and haunting as any that have ever seen the only problems come during the first and third acts malick takes little too long get the started although the initial scenes consist of two soldiers experiencing nearedenlike paradise while going awol and the preperations for battle are effective and necessary hints of pretentiousness sink in the is just tad too artsy near the beginning and lot of people that disliked the movie probably gave up on it because of this the final act is effective at winding the down but the problems from the first persist it is bit too long and comes over as pretentious at times that said there are two sequences one where soldier gets devastating note from his wife and another where one of the main characters is killed that are nothing short of incredible the performances are phenominal all around the two standouts are nick nolte and newcomer jim caviezel both of whom should have been nominated for oscars nolte is riveting and intense as the colonel in charge of the operation his character is hard mean and somewhat reckless the lives of his men and yet nolte somehow manages evoke sympathy for him caviezel is forever questioning the nature of war his place in it and if there is any deeper meaning the hell that he is going through he is absolutely perfect genuine sympathetic sincere and yet strong when he needs be although restricted relatively small role sean penn is also very good as the companys pessimistic seargent as how it stacks up saving private ryan it was my second favorite movie of ryan was my first it is really hard compare the two they are so so different so will not beyond saying that spielbergs had more of an impact on me however the two are comparable from the standpoint of quality can easily see why someone would the thin red line above ryan highly recommend both of them and consider them be the two best war movies ever made all in all the thin red line is filmmaking of an incredibly high order it is slight faults are easily offset the sheer brilliance of what is done right it is real shame that it tanked at the box office films this unconventional powerful and thoughtprovoking do not come along very often

it was rainy friday afternoon in columbus when persuaded friend see matinee performance of mstk tm he had never seen any episodes of the show and have watched scant few due its unsocial airtime on comedy central and the uneven nature of many of the episodes for those of you not familiar the premise dr clayton forrester beaulieu wishes take over the world finding the worst ever made and unleashing it upon an unsuspecting public achieve this he in the words of the tv series theme is missing in the movie bumped mike nelson nelson on the noggin and then shot him into space and is monitoring nelsons reactions the movies he is forced endure rather than succumb the sheer awfulness of many of the movies nelson spends his time making wisecracks the help of his two robot companions tom servo and crow robot the format of the show consists of nelson servo and crow making their comments while silhouetted against the movie being watched and breaks every minutes or so for segments set on the satellite of love the ship on our heroes are marooned only two things are different in the movie the absence of forresters sidekick tvs frank and the slower pace of the jokes this latter change is presumably deliberate avoid the viewing audience missing some of the best lines while laughing from the previous joke for their big screen outing the producers have chosen this island earth classic and one of the first sf films have special effects budget larger than the average grocery bill unfortunately for that but making it ideal mstk fodder acting and dialogue appear have taken back seat the effects todays standards are less than impressive nelson co make jokes about everything from japans dominance in the world market star trek the state of disrepair of seattles kingdome and most of them work unfortunately the segments set outside the satellites movie theater seem out of place and are not particularly funny but at least they are fairly short the big question about this movie though is why presume it was an attempt gain larger following keep support behind the series rumours of its impending demise circulated for some time before the plug was eventually pulled few months ago but the format gains nothing from its transition the big screen there are no special effects dazzle you no action sequences keep you on the edge of your seat and no use of digital surround sound so it seems pointless spend per person see this movie when in few months it will be out on video and you can watch it for and not have sit in room full of popcorn addicts nevertheless mstk tm provides more laughoutloud opportunities than any you are going see this year and thoroughly recommend it anyone pulse given its uniqueness hesitate grade it against other films but it fulfils its claims and so in the class of unsubtle comedy films whose laughs come at the expense of bad bmovies it does well

the uncompromising nudity bared throughout petrice chereaus intimacy has already garnered much notoriety but it is in the naked faces of fearless actors mark rylance angels insects and kerry fox welcome sarajevo that the tender ache of emotional resonance is discovered sharp intelligent eyes that reflect experience and maturity rylance and fox are refreshingly detached from the false glamour of idols their sex scenes together are bracing in their raw honesty in the acceptance of flesh and messiness less apparent but no less remarkable are the astute observations of behavior revealed through those carnal beats of haste and hesitance often without single line of dialogue not aiming for the spiritual poetry of in the realm of the senses or the philosophical transgressions of crash chereau keeps his sexual odyssey firmly grounded in terms of straightforward character development that may be the very reason why intimacy seems unerringly impressive but never particularly significant on more than tactile sensory level the themes of human isolation are barren and obvious science project devoid of any especially groundbreaking hypothesis intimacy does manage stand out from lesser portraits of human interconnectedness and pinteresque rummages through psychological dirty drawers okay kill me shallow though it might sound it is amazing how much is filled in through an inspired cast perceptive camerawork and imaginative ways of treating the love scene those ingredients are too assured and confident merely dismiss as icing on the cake especially since they are the substance of the cake itself adapted from pair of short stories british novelist hanif kureishi intimacy weaves desperate lovemaking between two strangers in london every wednesday jay rylance and claire fox meet in his cluttered dank apartment for an hour or two of sexual release from their uninspired lives he is been head bartender at posh restaurant for over six years she is mystery him but her glum workaday appearance reveals similar dissatisfaction they are both married but his relationship has curdled into an embittered separation as the weeks draw on jay obsessively takes it upon himself uncover claires personal routines in his attempt gain fuller semblance of who she is he opens wounds that had not existed before singlehandedly corrupting the fantasy if it were not for few unnecessary subplots involving jays brother and his bevy of disgruntled coworkers this minimalist premise might be described as modern fable on the perils of wish fulfillment chareaus restless camera once again wielded superb and everattentive cinematographer eric gautier is less appropriate here than in his family transitoriented those who love me can take the train the scenes that linger are the still ones where rylance and fox separately pensively attempt carry on their makeshift household routines these are often captured in lingering unblinking wide shots that view them stranded amidst their drab workplaces and homes separation proves haunting in melancholy series of intercut shots as rylance and fox undress on opposite sides of the room crawling across the floor meet in the center despite being as restless as fly during the hyperactive restaurant scenes all the better blend in hustling crowd of gabby trendsetters you would be hard pressed find single uninteresting image intimacy takes an interest in its sordid world of the lowermiddle class lonely pubs and busy shopping streets it also understands the people who inhabit those spaces viewing them sympathy scraped raw an evaluation would be incomplete without highlighting the great timothy spall the robust scenestealer of many mike leigh collaboration as claires cuckolded husband this jocular heavyweight plays out his handful of bitter pill scenes the unforced menace and selfeffacing embarrassment of his imposing bulk bangs in his eyes his mouth forming into quizzical pouts and dry smirks he may seem the fool in his barroom encounters opposite sarcastic gleaming mark rylance whose jay has arrived on the scene looking stir up some trouble but spall is no one trifle his overreaching best pal demeanor suggests mind abuzz secret passageways of guile his pointed questions only na ve if you choose not read into their crafty insinuations in his unassuming way spalls carefully etched interpretation of hostility buried under mountain of surface propriety may become one of the most criminally underappreciated performances of the year but maybe also one of the best he is that good

george little jonathan lipnicki wants little brother after mr and mrs little hugh laurie and geena davis visit the orphange they decide adopt stuart talking mouse voiced michael fox george is not so fond of his new brother when stuart arrives at the little house and neither is snowbell the family cat voiced nathan lane george and stuart eventually bond while preparing for remote control boat race but snowbell wants stuart out of the house he is unable live the taunts of other neighborhood felines saying it is ridiculous that mouse has pet cat stuart little is mix of live action and computer generated imagery cgi the character of stuart while obviously computer generated image grows on you as the progresses and you will soon see him as much more than mere special effect there is also great deal of animal training involved this as many of the supporting cast are actual cats computer animated mouths so they can speak it is fascinating watch these cats give performances without an actual mouse interact stuart little is charming family there are some great laughs in the movie script cowritten the sixth senses night shyamalan no less some moments that can only be described as too cute the boat race sequence is what won me over and even the majority of the oneliners common nowadays in childrens films or films featuring nathan lane are tolerable kids and parents will love this one stuart little is available on dvd from columbia tristar home video there are two different dvds on sale one contains the in full frame and the other presents the in its original theatrical aspect ratio of both versions feature choices of either dolby surround or dolby digital audio both versions also contain the following extras and hang in there me here there is lot of them full length audio commentary track director rob minkoff and animation supervisor henry anderson full length audio commentary track the visual effects supervisors an isolated score track an interactive trivia game an interactive featurette that goes step step through eight of the effects in the making of documentary that originally aried on hbo and stuart little readalong story you can read yourself or have stuart read for you there are also three music videos and six theatrical trailers called thecatrical trailers get it it is funny for stuart little and five other columbia tristar releases the adventures of elmo in grouchland madeline the nuttiest nutcracker muppets from space and baby geniuses the only bad thing about this entire dvd did not want be reminded of the awfulness that is baby geniuses dvdrom features are also on the disc including web links and demo of the stuart little cdrom game but wait there is still more there is section called basement treasures where you will find the auditions of the films animators six deleted scenes you can select view or without commentary from the director visual effects gag reel production gag reel and an incredible eight minute storyboard sequence detailing the original concept for the boat race scene commentary from the director the first commentary track features director rob minkoff and animation supervisor henry anderson they give insightful and detailed thoughts about the films production minkoff likes point out scenes where other screenwriters came in and polished up the script namely writers like scott alexander and larry karaszewski who wrote the people vs larry flynt and ed wood and lowell ganz and babaloo mandel who wrote splash and multiplicity among others anderson is very appreciative of the animators who worked him and often points out animator worked on each scene as they occur the second commentary track features visual effects supervisors john dykstra and jerome chen who discuss more specific details of the effects in the movie fans will enjoy the informative first commentary track serious animation buffs will love the second one now know this is slightly off topic but it is related specifically this dvd so must voice this now one of the music videos on the disc is for song called need know group called angels this video features four midteenage girls the singers obviously having slumber party the girls ask ouija board need know who do who do who do as the song begins they then sneak out of their house and along the way they strike pose and their slumber party pajamas are magically transformed into middle class streetwalker outfits then they head party and dance suggestively the guys while singing lyrics like will be your pleasure all the time just say the words that you will be mine um what the hell what does this have do stuart little how is this in any way song suitable for kids movie let alone video suitable for kids movie on dvd when the video concludes the words be continued appear oh cannot wait see who they have slept when the toy story dvd comes out kids will not care about most of the special features on this dvd but those of us who can sometimes be turned into kid at heart thanks winning family sure appreciate them this is the way do dvd good movie loaded great features at reasonable cost the diney people could learn lot from columbia tristar

countries and legal systems that take the rule of law principle seriously had forbidden judges and juries make judgements in all matters that could involve them personally luckily movie reviewers are not burdened such legislation otherwise small pool of very special movies would be forever ignored this reviewer in case of star wars science fiction epic george lucas the consequences would be even more severe because that is very special for tens of millions if not hundreds of millions of fans in any case objectivity is something seldom seen in star wars reviews because undisputed majority of reviewers rate it as one of the best if not the best of all times those who do not usually have some difficulties in hiding their artistic snobbery the author of this review must also concede his inability use cold objective standards in reviewing this like so many previous reviewers must note that watched star wars for the first time twenty years ago and that remained enchanted the experience ever since perhaps it was childlike fascination until then unimaginable wonders that happened long time ago in galaxy far away or perhaps it was the rush felt minutes before the opening shots my expectations already pumped up serialised comic books and novelisation had read before anyway watching of star wars was one of the most important movie going experiences of my life and it was also unmatched for many years come because very few movies managed have such strong impact on me like george lucas epic star wars was not just important movie for me or the millions of fans who probably share the same sentiment it was the defining moment in the history of modern cinema until than american motion picture industry was in limbo social turmoil in practically destroyed the old and new authors filled the void mostly using hollywoods financial and technical resources create serious personal or artsy movies as result audience traumatised of dark reality of vietnam and watergate did not want see the same dark and serious content on the silver screen george lucas its science fiction epic was among the first come into rescue the audience responded unprecedented enthusiasm and huge financial success of the movie later backed supplement industry of toys books comics role playing games and other merchandise slowly began change the face of serious adult movies artistic ambitions faded into oblivion and were replaced industrial products of blockbuster philosophy one of the biggest casualties of that trend was the science fiction movie genre until science fiction movies were mostly in bproduction domain in late bigger budgets for science fiction did not look so strange anymore thanks the great success of space odyssey but the same success coincided the surge of pesimism and science fiction was as bleak as the rest of its production mostly dark dystopic movies however in star wars showed once and for all that this genre can be inspiration for popular movies even among the audience that usually does not like it as result seriousness in cinematic science fiction began fading away although some good dark and cult quality sf and continued be filmed until early after that science fiction continued be considered synonym for family entertainment ironically the man responsible for star wars was in its time considered be member of new generation of young movie authors who made artsy and personal films in early george lucas established himself the dystopic sf movie thx and nostalgic drama american graffiti both movies were considered personal in its time despite latter one becoming very popular in sense star wars is an also very personal and the thorny way the final production shows that commercial considerations were against it not for it but unlike many personal movies of the era its personality was in line the wishes of the general audience the plot set long time ago in galaxy far away begins in time of civil war the evil empire is threatened rebels who want restore the old republic in order quash any opposition the empire had built death star superweapon powerful enough destroy whole planets the information about death star acquired rebel intelligence is being transported princess leia organa carrie fisher when her ship gets intercepted imperial cruiser princess is arrested imperial warlord darth vader played david prowse and voice james earl jones but the information is being sent nearby desert planet of tatooine via two humanoid robots cpo anthony daniels and rd kenny baker those two robots are sold the family of luke skywalker mark hamill young restless man who wants leave his farm and become space pilot his adventure begins when rd escapes because the information must reach mysterious local hermit obi wan kenobi alec guiness old man is actually the last surviving jedi knight member of the ancient order that defended republic through the use of mystical force after some hesitation luke agrees join obi wan in his mission save the princess while the old man would teach him the ways of the force their small band comes the colourful spaceport of moss eisely where they hire the spaceship owned rogue pilot han solo harrison ford and his furry sidekick chewbacca peter mayhew critics who do not like the movie especially those who cannot forgive lucas for his contribution the quashing of new are prone point the lack of originality on the surface they might be right lucas himself admits that he found lot of inspiration in the lore of old westerns wwii aviation movies old sf cliffhanger serials of the and yet the most obvious element would be akira kurosawas samurai classic the hidden fortress on the other hand those who had spent last two decades studying the movie death would say that the inspiration for star wars went even further into collective subconscious of western civilisation hinted some mild tolkien references the others would find the authors element within the story star wars could be seen as an anti establishment young longhaired easy going natureloving heroes are fighting against old uptight and oppressive forces who use supertechnology in most demonic purposes even out of its historical or social context star wars is an impressive as strictly technical piece of the seven art george lucas direction is very good the clever editing and wellpaced segments between action and dramatic buildup characters are welldrawn and deliver all the necessary ingredients both for the space opera and blockbuster we have comingofage hero damselindistress somewhat toned down due the popular feminist trends of the time reluctant helper benevolent mentor diabolical villain and finally comic relief in form of two nonhuman characters some of the actors are very good alec guiness in his most famous role date james earl jones whose voice is enough cause unease peter cushing as an incarnation of pure evil in human form unfortunately the same cannot be said for the main leads among the main trio of mark hamill carrie fisher and harrison ford only the last one had the character threedimensional enough launch his further acting career the thing that looked like the most important segment of star wars phenomena during its initial release was the new level of special effects technology often comparisons space odyssey another groundbreaking sf were citing the sheer number of effects as proof of the lucas superiority over kubrick however the special effects john dykstra and john stears are indeed impressive even after two decades although special edition did improve them significantly yet they are not the most remembered trademark of the movie that honour should definitely go the oscar winning soundtrack john williams whose work on star wars is probably the brightest gem in his brilliant career newer generations of viewers might be somewhat deprived of the enchantment that still holds those lucky enough witness star wars original release yet even if they are immune the george lucas magic they should watch this nevertheless perhaps only become familiar something that is essential part of contemporary culture

frequency the number of times specified phenomenon occurs within specified interval as the number of repetitions of complete sequence of values of periodic function per unit variation of an independent variable etc do not worry when watching the thriller frequency you will not have know what the heck frequency means the premise although it may sound complex is very basic on the big screen new york cop john jim caviezel finds radio in his house allows him communicate his new york firefighter father frank dennis quaid who died thirty years ago immediately john warns his father that he will die trying stop fire in an abandoned warehouse when frank takes his advice and survives the accident he was not supposed the two eventually realize that changing that one moment in the past they have created whole new future in serial killer murders johns mother and nine other women it is now up john and frank use their special connection and save thirty years ago make present time better place told you that was not confusing overall was very pleased frequency it is occasional sappy moments perfectly synchronized its suspenseful serial killer scenes usually do not buy those cheesy love you dad segments in movies but this one surprisingly satisfied me maybe because the plot is so creative and universal that believed that this is how most people would act when talking dead relative frequencys creepy premise left me thinking once the ended what if what would do would help my own family or save historical figure from being assasinated or stop some kids from shooting other kids or buy stock from yahoo character in the does the latter humorous consequences frequency also reminded me of the fantastic back the future both share that change the past slightly and you will change the future heavily warning the changes between the present and the past such as different newspaper headlines or people disappearing and reappearing in photographs are very similar both are also wonderful feelgood family films that can attract number of generations the only difference worth noting is that frequencys final scene does not set up possibility for lucrative sequel already in the making there are some problems the though first there is major flaw in the story towards the end that is somewhat distracting email me if you have seen the movie and want know what think it is the plot must have confused even the filmmakers who frequently no pun intended switch from while telling the story another problem is that the supporting cast including noah emmerich and andre braugher are underused while in the is not enough the aforementioned actors steal every scene they are in frequency was pleasant surprise for me and the audience saw it who cheered at the end even if you know what is going happen or if you think the preview ruined the movie for you like it almost did for me check this movie out you may be surprised as well

psycho meets the exorcist no holds barred blurb like that sounds like desperate publicity for some low budget third rate ripoff but no this tacky plug comes from the poster for suspiria perhaps italian horror director dario argentos most consistently successful what impresses most in rewatching this surrealistic supernatural thriller is that argentos directorial flair and stylish visuals are matched nearfully coherent narrative screenplays have always been his achilles heel confusing subplots gaping holes totally illogical incidents and reactions no question argento has always been better director than writer fortunately he gets the plotting pretty well right suspiria taking his cue from book thomas de quincey called suspiria de profundis the films storyline suffers from no major lapses in logic provided one can accept the premise of ballet school being front for coven of witches jessica harper plays an american who travels germany further her studies in dance arriving at the school late at night in driving rain she sees girl leave and run into the storm in clearly distressed state what happens next and do not make the comparison lightly is murder sequence that for intensity shock value and sheer directorial flair ranks alongside alfred hitchcocks infamous shower scene in psycho it is quite possibly homage hitchcock but its baroque sets graphic gore and brilliantly chaotic musical accompaniment the gothic rock group goblin this stunning sequence remains very much argentos own though nothing else quite equals the intensity of suspirias opening minutes the continues be never anything less than engrossing as harper begins her own investigations and slowly comes realise this is no ordinary ballet school we meet an assortment of slightly sinister characters most notably the head ballet teacher played alida valli in another one of those delicious souroldmatriarchfromhell roles she does so well several more violent murders ensue including startling scene in deserted square where blind man is well would not want spoil things now would and the films climax staged amid secret corridors and hidden rooms has gothic ghoulishness that is most impressive the english language versions of most argento movies usually suffer trimming and not just for the violence deep red and phenomena for example have been appallingly hacked about fortunately the cuts suspiria about minutes in this version have not adversely affected the the dubbing of the italian actors into english is quite competently done too excepting one appalling and unintentionally hilarious effort conversation between harper and professor about the history of witchcraft in the region and the soundtrack it is interesting imagine what power the would have lost if it had been scored someone else as it stands the use of goblins music in suspiria is outstanding apparently argento played the soundtrack on location while filming so the actors could hear the music as they acted out their parts stereo video player adds greatly the viewers overall experience even better see suspiria in cinema where you will get the added bonus of widescreen and the colours deep reds eerie blues superb use of shadow and contrast the cinematography of luciano tovoli whose more recent credits include reversal of fortune and single white female is uniformly superb nod also must go production designer giuseppe bassan for his wonderful baroque interiors these kinds of settings are crucial the atmosphere of argentos more surreal excursions the other most notable example being inferno on bassan also worked suspiria is the that broke dario argento into the major league of european directors and it is fully deserving of its cult status the gore is at times little excessive and overstated that is always been one of argentos shortcomings but overall this is fascinating compelling example of italian horror

jackie brown entered theaters little fanfare and lot of expectation even though advance publicity on this one was fairly limited the audiences waited for the showings heightened anticipation this is after all the first movie quentin tarantino has directed since the highly touted pulp fiction say he has been inactive in between would be tell falsehood since he has been involved in such projects as destiny turns on the radio desperado four rooms and from dusk til dawn he was also called in at the last minute help punch up the screenplay for crimson tide am willing wager the debate over silver surfer is the only true silver surfer was penned him tarantino contributed on and off screen these films but never took the directors helm nearly four years since gaining notoriety on the scene and making john travolta star once more tarantino returns he can call his own the opens up an homage the graduate jackie brown pam grier on one of those airport people movers as the credits are displayed in front of her jackie is flight attendant for air cabo flies back and fourth between los angeles and cabo san lucas this makes jackie convenient cash courier for gun dealer ordell robbi samuel jackson who is currently keeping his money stashed in mexico however while bringing fifty thousand dollars back into the s for ordell jackie is apprehended fbi agent mark dargus michael bowen and atf agent ray nicolet michael keaton who catch her not only the money but bonus of couple of ounces of illicit drugs jackie did not know they were in the package the cash but that is of no consequence the authorities who threaten jackie couple of years hard time if convicted of course dargus and nicolet are just using the sentence get jackie turn over the big fish ordell ordell uses honest bail bondsman max cherry robert forster get jackie out of jail but while max is immediately attracted her jackie is more concerned about her immediate safety since ordell killed the last one of his operatives who got picked up the police sure enough ordell shows up at jackies apartment that evening and tries silence jackie for good but she borrows maxs pistol and manages turn the tables on ordell instead of closing the irony circle and relocating bullet from the pistols chamber ordells head jackie proposes deal since ordell wants get his money out of mexico jackie will get back up her old tricks and be courier for him once more but this time for more substantial fee fifteen percent of ordells half million dollars gun in his face how can ordell not agree itself this premise might have been interesting enough carry the however we are also introduced number of double crosses make us pay attention and think jackie claims be bringing the money in for ordell but she is also making deal the feds as well as max the throws us off every once in while leading us believe the deal we thought was authentic is actually sham but it is in no way done the extent that we feel jerked around instead it is actually nice departure from the predictability is prevalent in so many of todays movies at least this has little imagination most of the performances in jackie brown are above par pam grier of whom had never taken notice before plays jackie mix of confidence and vulnerability makes her character believable samuel jackson has kind of mesmerizing quality about him as he handles himself in situations where you know he is in total control robert forster is thoroughly likable because he comes across as such an honest guy trying do his best never mind that he belongs profession where sneaking into guys apartment zap him stun gun is simply matter of course he is just so downtoearth the nature of his job really does not occur us even when we are shown him bringing handcuffed woman prison or when we see the tools of his trade in supporting roles are robert de niro as louis gara recently paroled friend of ordells and bridget fonda as melanie one of the girls ordell keeps around town unfortunately de niro is basically wasted as his lines are few and far between and then they are mostly clipped sentences in this he is not really de niro but stereotypical de niro uttering things like little bit and pretty much fonda on the other hand plays the slightly spacedout melanie satisfactory relish and cuteness such that even when she is annoying louis we are taking her side as is characteristic of any in tarantino has had hand the dialog is quick and snappy it grabs our attention and is actually interesting and in many respects this makes jackie brown needs few visuals the lines are form of art in and amongst themselves do not count tarantino out when it comes using the camera however there is scene where max is unwittingly watching dry run of money exchange and he is not really sure what is happening but composing the scene just so his realization of what is going on is felt simultaneously the audience we look at the screen and think gee that is clever and then think the same thing about how the induced us into that wonderful feeling of catching on although tarantino is not afraid drag out shot for dramatic effect it unfortunately works varying degrees in this there are shots where character is simply driving and we watch this person and somehow get an idea of what is going on in his or her head this is tribute both direction and acting however there is at least one other scene where we follow jackie through mall and she is looking for something desperately looking for something we get the idea of the frantic nature of her search but we follow her for so long that we end up not really caring about what she is looking for but instead hoping she will just stop overall viewing jackie brown is time spent well some flap has already been made about the language used in the but it is really not much worse than many of the other movies out there today in fact one might even be able say that the way in these offensive words are employed almost cause them parody themselves and therefore transcend their own offensiveness go see the and see what mean

directed pixote hunt hendel butoy eric goldberg james algar francis glebas gaetan paul brizzi conducted james levine composed ludwig van beethoven ottorino respighi george gershwin dmitri shostakovich camille saintsaens paul dukas sir edward elgar igor stravinsky rated scripture references samuel ephesians chronicles in walt disney released filmed experiment fantasia was blend of two art forms
