such actions americans remain undecided the oscars apparently shunned the movie because it was an embarrassing and sensitive livewire what they have ignored is actually great picture woody harrelson as the lead character reprises his role as tohellwithmorality tohellwiththelaw and tohellwiththesystem antichrist that we last saw in natural born killers and he is outrageous and convincing as nihilistic atheist who nonetheless loves his exstripper wife dearly the latter is played abandon conviction and sensitivity all at once courtney love who is the real star of the show and really snubbed of an academy award best actress nomination if not of the award itself edward norton plays their jerky lawyer the relationship between harrelson and love brings out another great paradox superficially they are immoral outcasts who have had it coming woody gets shot and becomes paralysed from the waist down and courtney dies of aids gods damnation but in the powerful love they have for each other each standing the other in turn the two leads highlight the question how much is the nihilist still moralist and in the american context christian if they can love and care and feel just like anyone else on personal level friedrich nietzsche once talked about how the atheist must uncover for himself the full consequences of atheism ridding himself of all moralchristian influences go beyond good and evil this is great picture no doubt and love it personally because it is moving funny ends open american optimism blah blah but like it and admire it because it comes from fine american tradition that dares raise difficult questions and call into doubt ideas and doctrines that otherwise are used as catchphrases there are times when movies go beyond the story they tell and reflect something of hidden realities this movie is not so much about larry flynt but about americans and american society

the ring is probably one of the creepiest movies have seen in years but then again have always had this phobia of asian born horror films remember when was kid was scared as hell those green faced longhaired floating ghosts donning their white gownseuuugh the ring really brings back those memories and its grips me long after the movie has ended unlike the horror films coming from the west am pretty much used the gore and visual effects so much so they become rather bland nowadays there is really no scary movie from the west for long time if you have something in mind please tell me this japanese flick is supposed be based upon stories written the stephen king of japan is also heard televised over the air in japan the revolves around mysterious videotape will bring death for sure the person who watches it one week prior viewing journalist and her husband stupid enough tests the so call urban legend and ends up having week before she meets her doom she and her husband then goes on search for the origin of the videocassette get the root of the whole curse the hopes of freeing themselves the ring plays on the senses like no other horror today visual subtlety minimal music and an intriguing plot puts the audience within an aura of suspense throughout the entire very well done indeed especially for that does not have single trace of violence and gore now thats something budding horror filmmaker wannabes should consider looking into just an idea of how visually powerful the is it is in japanese and subtitled in chinese both of cannot understand at all ok had friend who gave me gist prior watching but he revealed very little the twists in the plot leading an unforgettable climax will definitely leave an impression on the audience will have you at the edge of your seat

deep rising is one of those movies the kind of movie serves no purpose except entertain us it does not ask us think about important questions like life on other planets or the possibility that there is no god screw that it says boldly let us see some computer generated monsters rip into decapitate and generally cause irreparable booboos bunch of little known actors heh them wacky monsters gotta love em of course since we can rent about thousand movies the same kind of story must give that little extra oumph get people in theaters that is where deep rising fails is good thing confused let me explain despite all them flashy effects and big explosions deep rising is still at heart good ol movie luckily it is very good movie the worst cliches in movie history are b movies bread and butter therefore things that would destroy serious movie actually help us have good time while watching movie of lower calibre of course we know there is big slimy creature behind that door that one person will wander off be picked off said monster and we always know persons or person will make it out alive we just do not know when or how horrible it will be went see deep rising my expections low and my tolerance for bad dialogue high imagine my surprise when discover that deep rising is actually well pretty darn funny at times funny movie well that is new these flicks are not supposed make us laugh except for few unintended laughs once while and before you know it treat williams wes studi and famke jansen appear on the big screen hey know them guys and gal from couple of other movies cool familiar faces so far so good our man treat is the hero he will live wes is staple of movies he is the token victim we know he will buy the farm but he will take few creeps him on the way out famke is the babe nuff said there is also guy glasses the guy glasses always dies black person movie buffs know that the black guy always dies never fails and very funny nerdy guy ah comic relief how can we possibly explain having kill him let him live after the first fifteen minutes felt right at home know who root for and who need boo too and gum chew please kill me suffice it say that for the next hour and half jumped out of my seat few times went ewwww about dozen times and nearly had an orgasm over all the explosions and firepower our heroes were packing am man we nottice these things all in all would recommend deep rising if you are looking for good time and care leave your brain at the door but bring your sense of humor and excitement in you the acting is decent the effects top rate how best describe it put together the jet ski scene from hard rain the bug attacks from starship troopers couple of james bond like stunts and all those scenes from friday the thirteenth and freddy where you keep screaming do not go there he is behind you and you end up deep rising for creepy crawly goodness tight tshirts major firepower and the need go the bathroom every fifteen minutes from seing all that water

vampire films as well as other horror films are usually dumb and predictable bmovies meant scare us cliches and simple shocks it is therefore interesting watch neil jordans recent that is not only visually stunning but has also plot worth making movies about based on anne rices novel interview vampire is long dark trip hell the opens gothic quire and dark streets of presentday san francisco the camera slowly find particular window shape of young man is visible in the darkness so you want me tell you the story of my life the mysterious man is louis brad pitt twocentury old vampire telling his story fascinated interviewer christian slater his tale opens in louisiana just south of new orleans where louis falls victim the vampire lestat tom cruise given choice between death and eternal life as one of the undead louis chooses the latter decision he will forever regret everlasting life and eternal youth promised him lestat turn instead into never ending suffering damned eternal hunger for blood and longing for peace louis cannot kill the impunity of lestat but sate his hunger he must feed and the blood of animals is not enough eventually he pierces the neck of griefstricken young girl named claudia kirsten dunst whom lestat then curses his unholy form of resurrection so that she can be surrogate daughter both himself and louis for while they are one big happy family but all things end and claudias growing resentment of lestat fuels bloody confrontation when luis and claudia break loose from lestat they travel paris where the eurovamps santiago stephen rea and armand antonio banderas who introduced them bigger world of the damned director neil jordan the crying game together the talented director of cinematography philippe rousselot and composer elliot goldenthal has created an incredible atmosphere as the begins there is an incredible palette of colors beautiful sunrises lush golden fields green forests inkyblue clouds and blending sun when luis is born darkness everything suddenly changes dark velvet lit only the silver moonlight the beautiful production design dante ferretti wonderful costumes and art direction malcolm middleton recreate the multiple historical periods in the from the renaissance new orleans and the beautiful rococo paris of the th century our present days the casting is likewise good involving some of the most famous and beautiful stars of ireland and spain the controversial casting of tom cruise as lestat is incredibly effective cruise is energetic sinister charismatic wild and bloodthirsty cruises lestat likes seduce young women before exacting his dark red sustenance alarming swiftness the victims switch from sexual excitement outright horror as his murderous purpose becomes clear kill them mercifully but do it you are what you are for do not doubt you are killer that is how lestat is teaching luis but behind that furious facade is anger and loneliness that he carries through the centuries and tries smother nightly rampages brad pitt is equally convincing as the vampire human soul antonio banderas and stephen rea are effective but since they play more or less secondary characters their performances are almost invisible the greatest performance in the comes suprisingly from the young kristen dunst who manages create an incredibly emotional and believable character the world is changing around the little child but she does not she remains unchangeable child for all eternity only her wise dark eyes reveal her age ironically the films only miss is the script anne rices novel is very interesting read and her script is rich colorful and emotional but it is also tiering and too melancholic at times resembling soap opera claudia is that what should do let you go my father my luis who made me who will look after me my dark angel when you are gone luis everything will be alright claudia do you really believe that and then they hug emotionally moments like those displayed above and luis selfpity is bit tiresome however rices script is otherwise strong and well structured bringing up humor and comic episodes that were more or less hidden in the book when lestat finds claudias dead dressmaker whom she has killed he cries out who will make you that dress now be little practical never in the house moments like that are both entertaining and appealing neil jordans direction is beautiful and sensual as he plays interesting issues like eternity homosexuality love and loneliness his gothic saga is not meant scare but display these issues differently wrapped up in mystery his new original picture brings vampirefilms new height

casually smoking marijunana in their bedroom discuss the previous nights flirtations they both discover that they both knew about the flirting bill starts talking about what women can provide in relationship and gets alice extremely angry in her hazy state she tells of an opportunity she almost acted on cheat on bill not caring about the possible aftereffects bill gets called away when one of his patients dies and goes console his daughter when his patients engaged daughter makes plea for his love and affection he is struck images of an affair that never occured between his wife alice and naval officer he sees opportunity as betrayal his wife and before they can continue they are interrupted as he strolls home he encounters hooker seeing another opportunity arise he follows the hooker home they toy around but before the act ensues alice calls his cell phone he breaks the date the hooker and heads back out into the night he passes lounge and notices that his old medical school buddy is playing so he heads in when he meets the friend the friend reveals that for extra scratch he plays these strange parties while blindfolded bill is intrigued and wants go one nick reluctantly sets him up directions and password what follows this is short meeting where bill obtains costume for this party and meets young girl leelee sobieski and her father the young girl has drawn his eye but her young age and the prescence of her father deter this from happening he gets the party is say the least strange affair after partaking in some strange religious right women and men pair off for the orgy end all orgies woman warns bill in disguise that he should leave before he is exposed as fraud at the party he is detained after second warning where he is outed for not being in the group after is possibly in danger and the woman that warned him has died am trying save bit of the here it is worth sitting through get this point this is only about minutes at this point this is strange because they all serve show why they are bad in ones life recommend this highly on many merits cruise and kidman are rarely together for longer than minutes after the opening scene and the secrecy that shrouded the should hopefully be apparent as why it was kept once you see it for yourself

one fun activity for parents during the holidays is suggest an old and see if they can interest their kids although blackandwhite films are frequently viewed as suspect ones in color are greeted more of an open mind and if you can find colorful action even if it is from six decades ago then there is real possibility of take home hit so it was in our family when we wandered over the classic section of our local video store the other day and picked up copy of the adventures of robin hood high spirited version of the walter scott story nominated for the academy award for best picture and winner of three oscars for erich wolfgang korngolds melodramatic music ralph dawsons fast paced editing and carl jules weyls lush sets the is probably best remembered for errol flynns charismatic acting as sir robin of locksley k robin hood flynn his handsome figure and toothy smile charms the audience while clearly having high old time himself let me cut the chase and say that the tape was indeed popular in the rhodes household the littlest rhodes jeffrey age liked it so much that he viewed it at least three times and maybe more will let him discuss his fascination the picture in his usual section at the end of the review simply stated the derives its success from being one of the best of its genre the swashbuckler robin smile from eartoear fights off hundred men without scratch although the picture can be considered as little more than s james bond the production values and the acting raise it above that level robin hood is classic story of rich and poor robin steals from the rich and gives the poor as every schoolchild knows in this movie however he seems much less interested in income redistribution than in fighting for his king and country robin his courage and athletic skills serves as role model for kids and the lovely olivia de havilland playing the dreamyeyed lady marian fitzswalter the story has heavy romantic overtones filmed in the typical richly oversaturated colors produced early technicolor the flesh tones are overly pink and there few color subtleties match perfectly the wonderfully exaggerated acting of the players in scene after scene the picture charms the audience who would not fall for robin as he shows up incognito win the archery contest even if the outcome is so clearly preordained and of course he does not just win he does so splitting the other mans arrow watching the picture today does provide some jarring moments sherlock holmes as the villain sir guy of gisbourne for example just does not seem right even if basil rathbone did have reallife identity outside of his most famous role and then there are those wigs from the makeup department so bad they look like rejects from mel brooks comedy as was popular in the cinema of that era people die the most gentle prick of the sword and without any nasty bloody holes spoil the wardrobe or the looks bad guys are banished rather than killed and lovers go off handinhand doing nothing more explicitly sexual than kissing the result is wonderful fairy tale of movie delightful cartoonish figures rarely makes such high quality family films like this anymore so try savor the old ones when you can the adventures of robin hood runs it is not rated but containing absolutely nothing offensive it would get g rating and is fine for all ages jeffrey thinks the is great and gives it he recommends the movie particularly for people who do not likely bloody pictures he hates the sight of blood in movies his favorite parts are the battles and the ending and his favorite characters are robin and king richard ian hunter

swashbuckling adventure that can be enjoyed both children and adults steven spielberg may not have directed he only executive produced but his touch certainly is evident in this movie and he knows money making winner when he sees one the mask of zorro has the hallmarks of blockbuster big action funny comedy and the pacing of rollercoaster hopkins plays don diego de la vega otherwise known as zorro fighter for the people he is eventually captured don rafael montero stuart wilson who also unintentionally kills his wife the cuts twenty years later where vega still wants montero dead however he is far too old now and trains up thief alejandro murrieta banderas become the new zorro banderas motive avenge the death of his brother who was killed at the hands of captain love matthew letscher who rather tastefully keeps the head in jar in one of the more graphic scenes in this family movie the scene set the movie goes on full blast sword fights aplenty and witty one liners banderas and hopkins have marvellous chemistry as the two zorros playing each other off ease hopkins seems come off little better but banderas does some excellent work as the bad guys wilson and letscher seem one dimensional but they go through the bad guy shtick in an above average way the audience does hate them cannot be bad catherine zetajones also pops up as hopkins daughter and although she provides little more than the usual female lead she delivers charming but one note performance the chemistry is excellent between banderas and jones there is delightful little scene where banderas and jones have sword fight and every swipe an item of clothing gets slashed until jones clothes fall off all together the director fresh from the enjoyable goldeneye handles the perfectly the action is well done and fast paced the comedy put across well the cast help lot but the direction is still outstanding although the is very long the plot keeps chugging along and there is barely dull moment however the is little over indulgent and it could have been trimmed it manages hold the attention thankfully and the adventure and charm holds right up the last reel screenwriters john eskow ted elliot and terry rosio have unfortunately written an cliched and one dimensional script although they have bought zorro up date big explosions and wild action the plot itself is barely existent there is lots of little sub plots hanging around but there is nothing substantial bring them all together the main story seems be the fact that rafael wants buy california using gold stolen from the guy he is buying the land off this sets up for temple of doom type plot where we see peasants slave driven into getting the gold from little mines however this does not seem appear until nearly over hour into the so the is never quite sure where it is going in the end however zorro provides action and comedy in spades it suitable for everyone so put the guilt behind and put some more money into spielbergs bank account you will not regret it

rebel without cause is such an important in american history because it is true analysis of youth in america that everyone of all ages can relate everyone feels that they are different in some way that they do not belong in some places and rebel without cause successfully shows on screen these universal emotions no matter what generation you belong these feelings are present this is why james dean is admired america because in this he represents us all and his actions are actions that we would also execute in our minds we just try do the right thing just like deans jim stark does not only does rebel without cause display these universal emotions for all relate but it also shows that america has suffered uniqe pattern in its social structure each generation looks at its past generation without strong connection this is because times change and in response people change no matter how popular you were once as your generation grows older newer breeds look at you in different light this is why stark and his friends never could form strong relationship their parents even if their parents insisted that they were also rebellious and troublesome in the past the teens could not believe this in one humorous scene stark his girlfriend judy natalie wood and his pal plato sal mineo pretend they are adults they use upper class british accents and in their conversations they make it out appear that kids are no good and should be ignored this scene shows that what was once cool in past generation is the complete opposite in another speaking on behalf of my generation feel that dean has lost lot of his coolness from our perspective as the years have grown the only ones who seem still lionize him are those members of his generation same goes for brando redford even deniro can only imagine how vaguely matt damon ben affleck and brad pitt will be viewed at the mid point of the twenty first century will dean even be remembered when these newcomers are forgotten any that sparks this kind of thought is certainly milestone in american even if rebel without cause has some ridiculous scenes the game of chicken did people really act this way an unbelievable conclusion how did everyone end up at the abandoned mansion at the end and silly romance wood declares her love for dean after talking him for couple hours it still is fabulous the acting is so believable that it is no wonder that dean was considered the epitome of cool now however the coolness is fading

david mamet has long been my favorite screenwriter and director his distinctive more often than not ingenious dialogue and his laid back style of direction nearly all of his movies are absolutely irresistible some of them tend be thickly layered deceptive productions that require the audience look at the in less superficial manner than the plot seems require in order discern its concealed message or sometimes even concealed storyline and although the real plot in his new project the winslow boy is slightly more conspicuous than in some of his other endeavors it is still brilliantly complex consistently riveting motion picture about honor about sacrifice and about the difference between what is commonly known as justice and what is right oh and it is rated incidentally this is the first time that mamet has decided adapt someone elses work namely play terrence rattigan set in the th century he casts nigel hawthorne in the lead role as arthur winslow rich aging man who finds out that his year old son ronnie has been kicked out of the naval academy for allegedly stealing shilling postal note did you do it he asks his boy no father did not ronnie answers that is enough for arthur who his oldest daughter rebecca pidgeon immediately starts crusade bring his sons case court they enlist the help of sir robert morton notorious attorney help them achieve that formidably daunting task it all seems fairly frivolous and no matter how you look at it the winslow case is not the trial of the century but arthur is determined keep his familys word clean and he is willing go quite far make sure of that soon enough sir robert morton along the rest of the country becomes equally wrapped up in the proceedings so do we all david mamet does for the script is tighten and hone the dialogue but his style is still fairly apparent the characters still talk in his trademark staccatto lines and there is still tension present in conversations that no ordinary writer would be able make tense but this is not mamets norm and it is refreshing see mamet deviate from his world of crooks gangsters as con men wonderful as those films were nigel hawthornes performance is nearly flawless his delivery is that of dignified yet not pompous man who seems be getting beaten at his own game we pity the man but we also like him rebecca pidgeon david mamets wife who gave fairly awful performance in the spanish prisoner is at the top of her game here as arthurs oldest daughter flailing feminist who gives her all the winslow case as way for making up for her lack of success in the womens suffrage movement the winslow boy is wonderful movie that avoids cliches such as seemingly inevitable courtroom scene and shoots higher it wants make real impact rather than phony one be honest did you feel anything profound at or after the courtroom scenes in films like time kill if you wanted but did not this is movie for you it is the epitome of subtlety it is powerful without being too emotional sad without even trying be depressing david mamet can churn out some great scripts but in this movie he proves those who ever doubted it once and for all that he is hell of director too he is almost national treasure his films deserve their own genre eugene novikov

catherine deane jennifer lopez is psychologist who has been hired participate in project where she can enter the minds of comatose victims and try interact their subconscious in an attempt wake them up she has been experiencing moderate success young boy in coma but the boys parents are not happy the apparent lack of progress and the toll of her job is having adverse affects on her regular life as if trying assure the boys parents was not hard enough on her new development arises that furthers the strain on deanes mental faculties vicious serial killer named carl stargher vincent donofrio has been kidnapping women locking them in an automated cell that drowns them slowly in matter of days then soaking the corpses in bleach turn them into lifesized dolls just after kidnapping his latest victim and locking her in the cell stargher has traumatic experience that triggers schizophrenic virus in his brain and causes him sink in an eternal catatonia the police led fbi agent peter novak vince vaughn are able locate stargher some clues he left while dumping his previous victims body but they feel all hope is lost for his current victim due his vegetative state in last ditch attempt they ask deane and the scientists that created the project undergo the frightening task of entering starghers mind try and find the location of the victim locked in the deadly cell cell will completely fill water in the next hours initial reports about this described it as cross between the silence of the lambs and the matrix while it does share some characteristics both films particularly the first forty minutes seem almost like condensed version of lambs the cell also seems contain elements of dreamscape and brainstorm the buzz around this project is that firsttime feature director tarsem singh who won many awards for his video of e s losing my religion wanted script that he could fashion images out of instead of cohesive story and good portion of this supports that theory despite the borrowed elements from the aforementioned films and script that contains several logically questionable moments the cell does feature some remarkable imagery all of the sequences where we delve into someones mind are incredibly beautiful including the dank mind of stargher whose thoughts are reminiscent of an r giger painting come life mixed tool music video proving that singh is as adept at filming strange and wonderful images as his acclaim would lead us believe the first sequence that takes place in starghers mind is far the best featuring one of the most ingenious traps have ever seen in involving horse no one seeing this will probably forget zoolike display of starghers victims are animated like marionettes and stargher himself in giant purple cape that spans the walls of his mental throne room if the had continued within this dirty monstrous world would have deemed the brilliant but alas the sequences only become more silly as they go along despite painful nipple ring removal later in the the cast is basically just an excuse for there be some moderate plot semblance during the parade of images but at least vincent donofrio turns in his usual bizarre and psychotic performance magnified ten thanks the environment in the has been placed in my opinion donofrio was one of the best creepy actors have ever seen in but his choices as of late have been so completely awful e the newton boys feeling minnesota the thirteenth floor and the velocity of gary that have begun rethink my initial assessment of him the character of stargher is an excellent role for him though and will probably lead bit of typecasting for him detractors of violence and disturbing images will want stay far away from this as it contains heavy doses of both besides the nipple ring removal mention above there is also starghers penchant for hanging suspended off of the floor the rings that pierce his back and legs prior his catatonia and capture will have audiences recoiling sequence where catherine enters starghers mind and finds him recreating the disemboweling of his first victim is also pretty disquieting one moment also features character having his intestines slowly removed from his body an old fashioned hand cranked spitlike device as narrative the cell is sorely lacking as collection of images though the cell is extremely well done although the latter sequences in the contain fewer disturbing imagery than the first half singh has done what he supposedly set out do make solely for the purpose of stringing some remarkable images together unfortunately wellwritten script should have been considered too because without it the cell just seems like any other music video we could see on mtv provided of course that mtv allowed for the use of graphic violence and language in music videos

when casting the key part of the voice of moses most peoples first candidate would probably not be the controversial actor val kilmer the saint and the island of dr moreau but he was dreamworkss choice in their first traditionally animated movie the prince of egypt the selection of kilmer proved be wise one but the biggest risk dreamworks took was not in the casting department the radical departure was that they decided use the medium of animation make biblical epic la cecil demille move our hearts and minds rather than tickle our funny bones in the press kit producer penney cox says that they wanted make for adults based on sophisticated themes but one that did not exclude children animated movies for adults that are appropriate for kids and that are not comedies now that is something fresh let me admit upfront that was quite skeptical as whether dreamworks could pull it off dreamworkss antz seemed be movie not quite appropriate for any age group the prince of egypt may be harder market than antz but it is much more satisfying like antz and unlike the more modest casting of pixars bugs life the prince of egpyt has half of doing the voices danny glover is the voice of jethro jeff goldblum of aaron steve martin of hotep helen mirren of the queen michelle pfeiffer of tzipporah martin short of huy and patrick stewart of seti you can figure out for yourself who does the voice of god the movie is weakest in the story department is cliffs notes version of demilles the ten commandments the script kelly asbury and lorna cook has an obsession touching briefly on every classic event in mosess life demille took over three and half hours in order do it justice at less than half of that the prince of egypt rushes through so much material that it does not establish sufficient depth for us bond the characters we meet moses when the queen finds him floating in his little basket we watch him grow up and become best bud and chariot racing partner ramses ralph fiennes the future pharaoh moses is free spirit and practical joker until he finds out his true identity as jew all have ever known be true is lie moses complains after finding out his real identity he sees for the first time the oppression of the jewish slaves that are all around him after leaving egypt moses comes back ask ramses let mosess people go this leads the classic scene of the parting of the red sea is one of many places where computers were used enhance the traditionally handdrawn animation of the most of the production it is the absolutely stunning visuals that make the movie so compelling drawn rich palette of luxurious roses blues and golds the picture looks sumptuous from its first frame its last the construction of the temple is shown in blowing dust and other scenes are shot the glow of rising sun the most original visual sequence in the occurs during dream moses has done an explicit twodimensional look the colorful images painted on the temple walls come life tell their own animated story even though it has its weaknesses the prince of egypt is noble attempt carve out new genre serious animated movies for adults that are acceptable for the entire family this aweinspiring movie deserves be seen the prince of egypt runs about it is rated pg for thematic elements and would be fine for the whole family how old kid would need be be interested depends on the child but those over will probably like it

it is certainly more than just monster story kenneth branagh directoractorcowriter of mary shelleys frankenstein kenneth branaghs new motion picture had compete all the previous frankensteinfilms made throughout the years in almost every part of the world including the most controversial version of them all directed james whale the dark and stormy nights the lightning bolts the charnel houses of spare body parts the laboratory where victor frankenstein stirs his steaming cauldron of life are effectful but the center of the quieter and more thoughtful contains the real story horrorfans will probably be disappointed the total lack of horror branagh has instead concentrated on serious issues morality philosophy and human elements of the story and not on old fashioned horror cliches his version is much closer the book than all the previous adaptions of the classic novel the begins and ends somewhere in the arctic ocean the year is bold captain is steering his ship through the unknown waters his gole is reach the north pole at all costs as the ice closes around his ship figure appears on the horizon it is man exhausted and on the brink of death he approaches the frightening crew his name is victor frankenstein kenneth branagh and his story is so terrifying that it will scare everyone from venturing into the unknown the myserious stranger begins his tale or more precisely his confession in geneva he is remembering his childhood and youth laughter banquets and parties happy life without troubles or concerns here victor lived his father ian holm mother cherie lunghi his surrogate sister helena boham carter and his servants in happiness and harmony this idyllic lifestyle is suddenly changed like thunder from quite sky his mother dies giving birth his youngest brother shocked baffled and then gradually changed grief and despair victor already interested in science becomes obsessed death standing on his mothers grave he says oh mother you did not have die no one should ever die will stop this promiss after proposing marridge his surrogate sister and promising return as soon as his studies are finished victor travels ingolstadt in presuite of medical career after while his obsession totally overtakes him as he is working day and night creating life from death composing dead bodies frankenstein wanted create the perfect man both physically and mentally strong electrical impulses he managed breeth life into his creation the result was ugliness realizing what he has done frankenstein tried undo his work but it was late the creature has escaped because of the epidemic frankenstein hoped that his creation has died and returned his home making plans for the wedding for while everything is as it was before his mothers death but then one one his loved once are dying mysteriously whales picture although powerful never managed capture the total depth of the novel brannagh has more or less done that another thing is characters and actors branagh has developed every character and assembled magnificent cast the greatest performances comes from de niro the monster that has been played among others charles ogle karloff lon chaney bela lugosi glenn strange christopher lee fred gwynne as herman munster and now robert de niro alone hated and feared he is completely aware of his ugliness at first he is like helpless abandoned child desperately reaching out for love later when he reads frankensteins journal and learns that he is composed of dead bodies his love turns into rage as he is seeking revenge he is capable of killing without regret took him the throughout and lifted him off the ground and then slowly crushed his neck and as killed him saw your face that is how he reveals his savage nature his creator and yet he is never quite evil in our eyes and his vaulerbility and his loneliness are palpable for the sympathy of one living being would make peace all rarely has cinematic interpretation of the daemon approached the level of threedimensionality and humanity it is portrayed in the novel another vital thing is the character of victor frankenstein in most of the previous adaptions he was simply mad scientist that trolls the graveyards for corpses and then creates monster god knows why the power of an electrical storm almost no time was granted on his charecter who is the most important and vital charecter in the novel here branagh introduces the character of victor frankenstein establishes his obsession the very nature of life and death sets up the intellectual and ideological conflict between victor and the academic establishment and somehow manages build up rousing and horrifying creation scene branagh plays frankenstein remarkable understanding of his character on the outside he is strong ambitious and talented scientist but deep down he is unsecure fragile and vaulerble constantly haunted the ghosts from his past helen boham carter is equally wonderful as frankensteins surrogate sister who at the end becomes his wife for little while before death drives them apart the rest of the cast playing secondary characters is solid and nothing less than convincing visually the is stunning especially the makeup the spinning camera the constantly buildingup musical acore the art direction the production design the costumes are all magnificent from the arctic ocean the swiss alps and dark forests the plagueriddled streets of ingolstadt mary shelleys frankenstein is wonder behold kenneth branagh directs his as if the script was written shakespeare all once loved lies in shallow grave my hand and the ends exacly as hamlet when the creature sets both his and his creators body on fire the ends frankenstein and his creation burning in the almost hellish fire in the darkness and terrifying last closeup on the creatures smiling face can man create life then abandon his creation because its appearance horrifies him whom are its actions then attributable the creature or the being who brought about its existence shelley did not answer these questions but she certainly posed them following her example branagh does the same his is tragic saga about playing god victor frankenstein is not an evil man he wanted change the world the better in this he represents everything science stands for acting without doubts never considering the consequences of his actions produced francis ford coppola frankenstein resembles in some respects coppolas previous dracula in comparison can say that dracula has visuals that even frankenstein can not live up but when it comes story characters and casting frankenstein is stronger but stronger than both of them on every aspect is neil jordans interview the vampire although the is not perfect the camera that simply refuses stay still and the occasionally pushy score are at times more tiering than effective these minor faults are easily forgivable as the picture is otherwise captivating and stimulating branagh has probably created one of the best if not the best adaptions of shellys classic novel

love is the devil is challenging munundating its audience wild imagery and plot structure that disallows plot perhaps in an attempt get us know the artists psyche rather than the artists lifeline watching it was enthralled the look of the the way the director shot everything like it was looking through bizarre personalized filter everything looks like it is not how life looks like but how painter francis bacon the films subject looked at it personally but while was engrossed stumbled upon my thoughts halfway through the awakened from my trance some inner distraction and began try and follow what is going on exactly what was looking at watching this was not sure if it was the most insightful had ever seen or the most vacuous directed and written john maybury love is the devil is stylish masterpiece for the senses everything looks originally bizarre and perplexing the camera angles are ferociously askew and the closeups are uncomfortably too close the editing is deft occasionally cutting away something bizarre every couple seconds but other times holding on shot for so long that you wonder if the audience is not supposed be voyeurs or rather intruders bacons world and psyche as such there is no real story have not heard much about francis bacon that did not read prior the but what learned was this he was painter in england who reached his peak during the and drawing hideously bizarre drawings of carnage and the like he was one of the first really come out of the closet and in interviews he was notoriously drunk yet incredibly witty as played great shakesperean actor derek jacobi he is like foppish and selfabsorbed cross between oscar wilde and nero he lives life the way he wants live it the disatisfaction of those who have the privelege of being really close him it is as if he were taking delight in the destruction of others and maybe himself champagne for my real friends and pain for my sham friends he says one night at the bar he frequents love is the devil chronicles the latter part of his life bacon wellknown in his midlife awakens one night when he hears man tumble through his ceiling window and land on the floor he walks in unafraid of what he finds and discovers thief george dyer daniel craig bacon gives him an offer if he spends the night him he can take anything he wants in the morning george agrees this and off bed he goes but ends up staying him for whatever reason the shows their lives together at least in reference one another while creating bacons world of friends like high art this minors in showing certain group of people who radiate connection that is not shown but is understood the shows the relationship of bacon and george as it remains rather stagnant bacon is haughty and bizarre george is simple and does not understand bacon in the least especially not his paintings while watching this that is basically all thought was there the has hypnotic feel free of any restraints of form and is shot so uniquely that felt my attention was almost entirely on the way this was made rather than what it is about once the is over it is easier piece it together kept on thinking about this wondering what the point all of it was someone does not merely make of all style and no substance at all and if they do they do it accident but still allow some substance creep in thinking about it remembered how the two fed off of eachother thought about how bacon was masochist in love cruelty in one scene he watches boxing match orgiastic delight and lets out squeal of pleasure when blood from the one boxers head splashes across his face in another scene he masturbates the odessa steps sequence of eisensteins battleship potemkin and perhaps he drove george too far in his delight for pain he drove him over the edge and for him that was love even if it was not for george guess that explains the title bit that is great and all but almost wish the was devoid of any meaning wish it had not reduced itself making some point about humanity about how love is the most selfish thing in the world and it is if you look at it certain way or maybe if it had avoided any meaning about humanity and merely drove itself into being the one that was truly inside one mans twisted pysche it is almost always best obtain insights from looking at one mans uniqueness than it is forcing universality down an audiences throat that way you do not reduce your something it is just not cannot say totally enjoyed love is the devil though despite all of the things respect about this movie it is still rather uncomfortable sit through even at normally trite length of ninety minutes the still seems like an arduous task sit through especially after an exhausting first hour though hypnotic it still almost seems gimmicky and even redundant at times as if it were taking advantage of one mans truly bizarre nature but not doing anything deeper it as such respect the way the looks it is beautiful and painstakingly crafted so that along what dreams may come and dark city it is the years most visually stunning in fact if better script had been forged would almost compare it in visual power peter greenaway complete similar haunting images that stick in the mind forever and dymanite performance derek jacobi it has the comic and distanced tone that it needs just wish it had been more than mostly style and just hair bit of substance then would have had something hold me over even now

a costume drama set in the england elizabeth is lush romantic political masterpiece about the upset over the crossing of protestant queen from respected catholic one when the court and country are whole after the passing of the queens the royal family so speak are upset that protestant should be crowened and not another catholic plus the new queen elizabeth cate blanchette was the bastard baby of the previous queen marys father the persecution over catholics and protestants is not the only majority in elizabeth elizabeth must face the decision give up personal pleasures and her lover joseph fiennes of shakespeare in love in order rule successfully the country she did for more years both elizabeth and shakespeare in love are set in the elizabethian era and both feature queen elizabeth judi dench plays her in love or course yet found elizabeth more stimulating and involving than love not just because elizabeth features great deal more of elizabeth but because found blanchette more powerful hypnotic sense for the role elizabeth also featuring geoffrey rush and richard attenborough is my pick for the best picture of award it is dynamic important breathtaking of loyalty power greed and trust shakespeare would die for the book rights

jay and silent bob strike back can rightfully be subtitled kevin smiths greatest hits for the is comprised of numerous references and characters from smiths earlier works including clerks mall rats chasing amy and dogma so be advised bone up on that cinematic quartet in order achieve the maximum enjoyment from smiths latest outing kevin smith must be very likable person because several good sports took ton of kidding in this feature most notably miramax the studio whose subsidiary dimension films is jay and silent bobs distributor others deserving accolades include ben affleck matt damon directors gus van zant and wes craven and the mighty george lucas this is laughfilled foulmouthed road jay jason mewes and silent bob smith hitching sabotage miramaxs production of bluntman and chronic comic book characters based on the two jersey slackers jays convoluted reasoning is that if the is shut down people on the internet will stop insulting him and bob even though it is not him and bob the people are dissing but rather their comic book counterparts no matter the duo begin their long trek hitching rides across the country but first they get some tips from veteran hitchhiker played george carlin who tells them follow the book the rules of the road of course jays interpretation immediately gets the duo in trouble friendly nun carrie fisher who offers them ride jay and silent bob contains enough laughs that the movies weaker aspects include lame subplot about girl gang of diamond thieves as well as buffoonish federal park ranger played will ferrell can be easily tolerated really how can you not laugh at in our heroes are picked up the mystery van and jay has potinduced hallucination concerning velma and daphne the movies highlight though is near the finale in jay and silent bob sneak onto the miramax lot where they crash the set and are mistaken for extras of the latest affleckdamon picture good will hunting hunting season here we are privy hilarious conversation between affleck and damon in the two put down each others careers and choices and the laughs continue grow next up is jason american pie biggs and james dawsons creek van der beek the actors chosen portray bluntman and chronic the pair mistake jay and silent bob for their stunt doubles finally comes star wars homage featuring one of the stars of that legendary feature this bit will leave you howling smiths obvious affection for pop culture icons is evident in the way he shoots these scenes and handles his performers he allows them play it all tongueincheek their fun comes through the screen the audience it is too bad that this is jay and silent bobs swan song the characters have grown since their supporting role debuts in clerks but smith realizes that times have changed and he does not want his creations overstay their welcome so smith has provided them just the right kind of exit saving the best for last goodbye jay and silent bob at least you are going out blast

a sci ficomedy starring jack nicholson pierce brosnan annette benning glenn close martin short and other stars warner bros picture the martians have landed in this hillarous tim burton movie before entering the cinema was initially little bit nervous about what this would be like many people were saying that this was silly rubbish and there was no point it all how wrong they were left this feeling much happier than was before entered the cinema the story is about martians attacking earth using ray guns hooray they generally cause havoc around the s and other countries nicholson plays the president who must try stop invasion and also taking advice from his loopy officials but basically its load of set pieces showing the martians destroying earth the way people are killed the ray guns is great they is hillarous and mildly disturbing scene involving martian lady mad general who just wants nuke the aliens away and ends up getting squashed an aliens foot and gory finale involving lots of alien heads exploding but most of all this is fun the martians are full of character the performances are spot on and the all star cast help make the more enjoyable the is million times better then the dire independance day and is real tribute the tacky invasion movies they are is great score danny elfman and lots of laughs this has be the best invasion have seen for long time

let us face it the millionplus smash that was goldeneye was not good any means and as bond movie was only marginally better than say view kill or either of the timothy dalton pictures virtue of nice pacing but it did revive the series and granted the producers some new directions in take the it ie the new is woman tomorrow never dies is the picture goldeneye should have been it is also the most entertaining bond outing since the spy who loved me the new picture opens china considering war britain after standard military operation is misconstrued as hostile threat from an english submarine as an attack occurs the frontpage headline is already being prepared courtesy of carver media carver pryce the man is deluded magnate sort of hybrid of ted turner bill gates and peter sellars german scientist from dr strangelove physically pryce even recalls sellars in his kubrick days it is up james bond take him down assistance of course from wealth of gadgets including multipurpose cell phone and beautiful women enter michelle yeoh fresh from supercop as chinese secret agent her own agenda effortless grace she cat burgles dispatches baddies seemingly the ease of preparing pasta and refuses the advances of our philandering hero they make great team tomorrow never dies is surprisingly entertaining and efficient given that at the helm is none other than the director of turner hooch spottiswoode has crafted some breathtaking set pieces each much more intricate and impressive than for instance the tank scene in goldeneye moreover brosnan has at last settled into the role some feel he was born play last time out the fate of the franchise rested on his shoulders and there was noticeable discomfort in his body language returned in brosnans eyes has some of the playfulness he demonstrated for so many years on tvs remington steele as has his deadpan wit and though carvers motives are muddy when carver explains that genius is insanity some success screenwriter fierstein is taking lazy shortcut pryce makes an agreeable memorable villain in the future they should pursue actors as talented and experienced as pryce breathe life into these cardboard figures there few too many explosions in tomorrow never dies perhaps so many they qualify as dialogue and it could have used sharper script though was amused the double entendres none of will reveal here as it stands the plot suffers many holes am not taking about implausibilities and the dialogue tends towards the hackneyed now that the elements are in place modern special effects and stunt work cool pierce brosnan kickass female allies it is time put them use in something truly special there is no mistaking however that tomorrow never dies is ideal holiday escapism and for the first time in perhaps years you will walk out wanting more bond movies reviewed december

rated for strong language sexual dialogue drug use crude humor violence and brief nudity starring ben affleck matt damon linda fiorentino salma hayek alan rickman chris rock kevin smith jason mewes jason lee george carlin alanis morissette running time minutes being huge fan of kevin smith was expecting lot out of his newest project dogma it might just be kevins best work date it is very funny smart and foulmouthed dialogue while unexpectedly it has serious undertone it and besides going against god and jesus christ it actually tries tell people that there is such thing rather than that there is not in little movie premiered at sundance this little was called clerks and this little went on become huge video sensation you really cannot meet person on this green earth who has not seen clerks it was hailed critics as one of the best movies of the year and soon sequel is coming in kevin made another movie mallrats that flopped horribly thought it was not the best movie ever made it was pretty good little flick it was panned critics but hailed audiences and in chasing amy came out and was kevins biggest success date now in we get great little movie the name of dogma wow what cast ok here is the plot in this movie linda fiorentino plays regular woman who works at an abortion clinic one day at her house metatron the voice of god appears at her house much her surprise and tells her that she must stop two fallen angels matt damon and ben affleck from getting back into heaven ways of church ok now get this she is told find two prophets one who talks lot and one who does not however she gets jay and silent bob instead who give us great performances now on her way new jersey jay and silent bob try and stop the two angels the th apostle falls out of the sky chris rock and helps guide her find these angels salma hayek plays serendipity who also helps her out along her way azrael jason lee who is demon is trying help the two angels out so that they can win bethany linda fiorentino has now use the help of all these people try and stop the angels before they cheat their way back heaven leading violent and bloody end that will make you think twice about your faith what movie it is everything rolled into one an offensive offbeat smart and sassy comedy that surprisingly has great message at the end and ends up being feelgood movie who would have known kevin had such soft side on him that could make us know that he is faithful person himself now for those of you who get offended this movie really should not take it heart yes it may target the catholic community and bash them lot but it also seems rather than go against god and heaven it actually goes god and kevin gives message that there is god this review may sound confusing at first but really the only way understand it is see this excellent movie kevin goes new lengths in this hilarious comedy and gives us some great characters not too much background or study and rather we start know the characters as we watch the movie of course the best and funniest of them all is the only duo in history that have made me fall out of my chair laughing and that my friends are jay and silent bob probably the best characters in movies that like the starstudded cast is amazing and has some other cameos george carlin jeanne garafolo and so may more that we start lose track after while the script was written kevin smith many fwords in there of course and strong emphasis on sexual talk but he also seems concentrate on what is important rather that what is not and makes us laugh at the same time as we think chris rock gives hilarious performance and gets into his character very well some classic lines linda fiorentino is just perfect for her role and makes us believe that she really is who she is of course jason mewes and kevin smith do great job as jay and silent bob some priceless lines from jay as well as silent bob alan rickman jason lee salma hayek round out the cast matt damon and ben affleck in the starring roles being oscar winners for the classic good will hunting they give great performances here again but matt damon seems just little held back and me did not give it all he could ben however was all out and got very much into his character as well as the story the movies only big flaw is that it has few unfunny lines and some slow parts go along it however the direction kevin and the script kevin as well as the priceless performance many of the cast members dogma stands as new classic and think can safely compare it clerks while being funny at times in the end it becomes serious movie an important message that some may not agree but cannot deny it dogma will offend people especially deeply religious people but for those of you who are open minded and want see some very funny material then this is the movie for you all kevin smith fans must see

one of the most popular subplots in the entire science fiction genre is time travel that concept although many purists doubt its scientific credentials spawned many interesting novels comic books and films in the last century however the big granddaddy of time travels g wells novel the time machine was not written the intention speculate about that concept or its consequences the author g wells merely used it as convenient way express his socialist views and condemn the great social gap between the rich idle capitalist class and impoverished labour whatever intentions wells had the future generations of readers were less impressed his political messages instead they were fascinated the idea that the strange new worlds could be explored without traveling trough space the novel became one of great classics of science fiction genre and it natural for filmmakers use it as inspiration first of them was george pal who in directed would through the years become genre classic of its own the plot revolves about george rod taylor victorian scientist who discovered the way travel through the fourth dimension time at the eve of the new th century george gathers his friends in order present them his invention machine that would enable him travel through time they are skeptical but that does not prevent george from carrying out his plan and traveling into the future at first he travels slowly seeing london as it changes through the years and three world wars finally after witnessing world war three he travels far into the future hoping that he would cease witness wars and senseless destructions when he finally reaches year ad at first glance new world looks like utopia humanity consists of young beautiful but idle eloi people who are fed clothed and taken care of unseen machines but weena yvette mimieux eloi woman tells george about another side of the coin in the night her people is preyed upon morlocs humanoid creatures from the underworld the time machine became the cinematic classic for the very same reason the novel became the classic in science fiction literature the fantastic concept was brilliant way for the authors talk about burning issues and fears of their respective times for g wells it was frightening threat of class struggle for george pal and his screenwriter david duncan who produced the in the worst days of the cold war it was the constant and more imminent threat of nuclear holocaust underlined the negative references war throughout the movie even the modern audience would be tempted discard the as oldfashioned could find some values in its universal messages fit for each era compared the genre films of today the time machine is even better and could serve as good example how make intelligent thoughtprovoking films of course since this is product after all the time machine delivers such concepts in the form of classic adventure sometimes sacrificing plausibility for the sake of attractiveness for example it is hard imagine that someone would be able understand perfect english million years in future same is morlocs degenerating into mutant monsters while eloi remain undistinguished from the people of today some of the final scenes that turn victorian scientist into an action superhero are also rather unconvincing but on the other hand the is very well directed cleverly paced and the special effects although definitely oldfashioned are more than adequate for this kind of picture the acting is good rod taylor in one of his most remembered roles while in the same time alan young brings rather memorable performance as georges trusted friend filby yvette mimieux who plays weena on the other hand would be remembered more her looks than the complexity of her role however despite all those flaws the time machine is very good piece of cinema something that connoisseurs of quality sciencefiction films sorely miss these days

if this keeps up jane austen sense and sensibility pride and prejudice may have apply for posthumous membership the screen writers guild yet another novel of hers has made the transition the silver screen mansfield park is turn of the century th century going on th story about love among the classes as well as an examination into proper society and family ties ten year old fanny price hannah taylorgordon jakob the liar taken from her mother and father and the poverty in they dwell is sent live her aunt and the privileged class at mansfield park under the stern patriarchal hand of her uncle sir thomas bertram harold pinter mojo spending her days reminded of her lower status she also invents and writes fanciful stories during her private times fanny eventually grows become beautiful intelligent and engaging heroine quite unlike the original character ms austen originally penned in her novel writerdirector patricia rozema when night is falling is responsible for the textual changes from purely dramatic perspective the revision makes perfect sense and improves the films audience appeal what ms rozema has done is infuse the main character much of ms austens own personality including excerpts from the authors journals giving that dialogue fanny the result is central character that is immediately appealing as the grown fanny australian actress frances oconnor all about adam does wonderfully textured work at times ms rozema has fanny address the camera directly communicate many of the novels more introspective observations this is difficult device work seamlessly into period and it is ms oconnors credit that it works as well as it does the central theme gives the story its legs in an old one whether it is better marry for love or for social standing fanny has fallen in love her cousin edmund jonny lee miller plunkett macleane who appears fond of her as well his attentions are soon divided as the stylish and socially acceptable mary crawford embeth davidtz bicentennial man enters the picture along her equally acceptable brother henry alessandro nivola inventing the abbotts who eventually sets his romantic sights upon fanny while mary and henry are evidently less than sincere in their affections their presence does provide the movie and the main characters the necessary conflict that keeps our interest until the films appropriately austenlike ending other thematic devices include awkwardly inserted reference the source of the wealth of mansfield park the slave trade there is also hint of both lesbianism and incest but neither is carried very far and is soon forgotten the motivation for marriage remains the primary thematic thrust fannys cousin maria bertram victoria hamilton persuasion is an example of one making poor match marrying welltodo fool who is able make her comfortable but never happy fannys own mother trapped in her chosen life of squalor warns fanny admitting that her situation is due the fact that she married for love fanny given those two terrible examples and faced the same choice is understandably indecisive as way lean the spiritual answer of course lies in the middle of those two extremes marriage is not cold calculating decision based upon selfpreservation neither is it senseless decision made in the warm afterglow of passionate embrace in the purest sense marriage forms an insoluble union whereby two people agree function as one and said for this cause shall man leave father and mother and shall cleave his wife and they twain shall be one flesh matthew kjv love and logic can be combined gods word contains both so does marriage based upon his truth

saving private ryan dreamworks running time hours minutes starring tom hanks edward burns tom sizemore and matt damon directed steven spielberg already being hailed as the greatest war movie ever made saving private ryan is an harrowing saddening and riveting movie it may not be the greatest war movie in my opinion but it is certainly one of the best war movies made and one of the best of tom hanks stars as captain who is troop has find private ryan damon who has ticket home because his three brothers have been killed in action action drama and even some humour occur as the troop journeys through wartime france find him after the disappointing amistad spielberg has returned form this excellent movie am not the war movie genre biggest fan but found this be gripping and very scary thanks the excellent cast direction and terrifying battle scenes tom hanks is superb straying away from his usually soppy dramatic roles such as in forrest gump this time he plays the role gritty realism and is much better for it occasionally he overacts the sentimentally but he generally delivers fine performance edward burns looking lot like armageddons ben affleck also delivers top notch performance moving away from his roles in films such as she is the one tom sizemore makes less of an impact but is still watchable and matt damon reinforcing his position as one of the finest young actors working today spielberg directs very well putting the audience right in the heart of the action of the battle scenes and what battle scenes they are they are truly terrifying yet the audience cannot drag their eyes away from the screen the battle scenes are filmed jerky handheld camera and the panic and confusion felt the soldiers is emphasized this technique the gore and violence is not spared either body parts flying and blood spurting this is certainly not for kids and sensitive adults other factors help saving private ryan be masterpiece of making the cinematography is excellent and the music score john williams is also superb it is never intrusive and adds the drama onscreen but while they are thousands of good things great about private ryan there is one major flaw that detracts the genius of the the writing it is unusually flat many of the speeches strangely weak the never really makes any profound statements this is not major gripe as private ryan is of action not words still the script could of been lot better thankfully the actors help partly rectify the situation their great delivery of their lines saving private ryan in the end is an excellent but not the greatest war movie due it is weak acting this should be viewed everyone who has the stomach for it as it is rewarding and extremely worthwhile it really should not be missed and dreamworks skg has finally found it is first hit movie

s aliens vs earth idea revamped if you have been following the movie news over the net you could not have escaped the hype over id it promises be the summer of the year and it has all the elements necessary id opened in the us on nd of july and up till now only after week of release it has nearly touched the us million mark phenomenon last observed when jurassic park was released back in the premise of the movie is disgustingly simple earth defends itself against the aliens typical and highly popular theme manifested itself in many films produced in that era the movie opens via star wars however unoriginal it may be it worked the aliens have sent large mother ship supposedly be size of the moon attack earth deploying attack ships miles in radius all the major cities on earth the us president pullman does not know of the aliens intention but soon finds out when david goldblum scientist discovers that the aliens are counting down synchronised attack on all the major cities capt hiller smith hotshot pilot are one of the hundreds assigned take out the hovering alien attack ship over washington dc his squadron came under heavy alien fire after discovering that their weapons were useless against the invaders he crash lands after spectacular on chase over the grand canyon one of the many highlights of the movie id features many characters and we are shown the impact on them as the story progresses acting on the whole was ok although thought that bill pullman was bit unsuitable for the president role but he did make very rousing speech before sending his troops into battle do we smell bit of braveheart here no prizes for guessing how id ends its just plain obvious id borrows heavily from star wars return of the jedi alien and in some parts of the movie could even sense bit of xfiles on screen if were critically review this movie id is full of plot holes corny dialogue and ridiculously dumb aliens however below that waferthin plot and onscreen flaws id scored well in playing the appealing idea of the entire world giving up their petty differences unite themselves as one force against the alien invasion an idea will have the audience strongly rooting for the united front throughout the movie thus maintaining screenviewer interaction that virtually render any holes in the movie acceptable no matter how ridiculous id was produced under modest budget of us million of such magnitude would have easily been another waterworld but director roland emmerich universal soldier stargate and producer dean devlin assembled team did their own special effects rather than commissioning it ilm or any other special effects company some of the effects are not too good but most of it are very believable especially the epic standoff between fs and alien saucers reminiscence of the classic space battle featured in return of the jedi id is movie for all though there are many explosions and implied deaths there are no gory scenes of human destruction thus young kids should be able take it sit back and do not be too critical chances are you will be absorbed into the movie just as was if you are not planning watch any movies this year please at least make time for this one this is best watched on the bigscreen

the trailers and the beginning of the move sum up this plot very easily three filmmakers venture into the woods of maryland track down the legend of the blair witch for documentary they are making they disappear and their footage is discovered year later buried underneath the foundation of one hundred year old house from there things become little more complicated can say absolute assurance that no has ever had quite the impact that this little movie has had on me although know it was all staged mockumentary there is no denying the psychological impact this will leave on you did not feel much upon initially watching it just thought it was an interesting some pretty creepy parts never even dreamed that thirty minutes after the had ended would be frightened out of my mind just discussing it friend have gotten chills every time have brought it up since then this is not movie that hits you right away instead this is movie that sits at the base of your spine waits until you think everything is okay then it slowly starts creep it is way up into your mind this is truly the most frightening movie have ever had the pleasure watch the is comprised of home video and mm camera footage that the documentarians supposedly shot for their blair witch so do not expect any steadicam shots or fancy camera work this is as real as it gets folks do not recommend sitting too close the theater screen though because guarantee you will get motion sickness from the constant movement of the camera the performances of the three lead actors in the are so real you may find yourself questioning whether all of this has really happened or not this is definitely movie that warrants home video viewing especially due the fact that the bulk of the movie was shot standard home video camera the reality of the images will strike frighteningly close home when viewed as actual video instead of the tapetofilm transfer done for the big screen word has it that special edition dvd boatloads of extras hours of deleted scenes alternate endings commentary the scifi channel special and others is being planned for release urge artisan entertainment forge ahead this plan and give us what could be the dvd rival all dvds know will be first in line buy one r

apocalypse now based on the novel hearts of darkness is an extremely striking gripping and horrifying depiction of the vietnam war from another angle long debate has surrounded this movie as if it is actually an antiwar in many ways this debate could go either way apocalypse now is probably one of the most memorable vietnam war films ever made in addition now has gone the extremes that this does disturbing look at the corruption and terrifying effects of the most devastating war of recent years apocalypse now follows the mission captain benjamin willard played martin sheen seek out and eliminate colonel walter kurtz green beret who is thought have gone insane and set up his own militant base in cambodia captain willard is ordered assassinate kurtz extreme prejudice because he has been deemed murderer willard accepts his mission but not while pondering the accusation accusing someone of murder in this situation is like handing out speeding tickets at the indy as he puts it it does not make too much sense escorting him on his mission are group of men who operate riverboat the men are chef frederic forrest chief albert hall lance johnson sam bottoms and mr clean fifteen yearold laurence fishburne willard is ordered not let them know exactly what his mission is but they all know it is something big the men encounter many exciting dangerous and bizarre situations but no situation is more bizarre than the infamous napalm scene very eccentric robert duvall as lieutenant colonel kilgore kilgore decides attack and overtake certain beach area so that his men can surf surf this is all inspired when kilgore is able meet the famed california surfer lance johnson duvalls portrayal as lieutenant colonel kilgore is terrific and he provides number of memorable quotes eventually captain willard encounters colonel kurtzs frightening community full of strange things everywhere you look especially his followers one of his main followers is freelance photographer dennis hopper who attempts convey the situations willard but willard cannot understand the madness that encompasses the colony kurtz is actually well aware of willards mission and refers him as an errand boy sent grocery clerks collect bill yet willard is intent on completing his mission no matter what shocking things kurtz does apocalypse now possibly one of the greatest films ever made is stunning vision into the madness that corresponds the vietnam war movie that will hypnotize you it is brilliant cinematography apocalypse now is an outstanding epic drama about the controversial and horrifying ravages of war definitely on the do not miss list be prepared for very memorable

sometimes find th century british costume dramas little hard relate it is not the time or the distance it is the rules and conventions of social class that deserves resentment rather than sympathy yet somehow the movies are all well made and always get caught up in the story the wings of the dove fits the pattern kate helena bonham carter and merton linus roache are in love merton newspaper writer would like marry kate but kates job if you will is be member of the british upper class her father lost all of her familys money but wealthy aunt agreed take care of her until she married nice rich man naturally newspaper writers wages do not count as rich kate leads him on but she always ends up giving him the cold shoulder ultimately because he is not marriageable kates american friend millie alison elliot stops in for visit on her way venice at party millie catches glimpse of merton and likes what she sees kate realizes that if merton were introduced millie he might forget about her it appears that she is trying spare him from the heartbreak of their inevitable breakup merton sees what kate is doing and resents her for it he is still in love kate and will accept no substitute the three of them along fourth friend elizabeth mcgovern end up on holiday in venice together where their interactions are quite complicated let us sum up millie has fallen for merton merton has no feelings for millie because he is still in love kate kate loves him but cannot marry him so on the one hand she is trying match him up someone who will make him happy but on the other hand she is
