jealous of them as couple clear solution presents itself kate when she realizes that millie is very sick dying in fact at this point she decides that merton should marry millie until she dies millie will leave her money merton who will then be rich enough marry kate she lets merton know of her schemes and since it will help him win kate he reluctantly agrees kate leaves venice so that the two ms can be alone together merton finds that pretending love millie is lot like actually loving her he is not sure he can separate the two kate finds that she is not so sure she really wants her merton falling in love and marrying anyone else the brilliant scheme proves be painful all involved without revealing the details suffice it say that the situation ends badly the title refers the object of mertons vain hope that something might lift him from his predicament one is left feelings of regret and despair what started as such promising relationship was damaged greed anger and jealousy an interesting thought struck me after the movie was over and that is that the wings of the dove almost fits the story line of noir couple conspires cheat someone out of their money so they can live happily ever after their involvement in the deception makes each less attractive the other and after few things go wrong the whole idea seems like an awful liferuining mistake would not call the wings of the dove noir but the comparison is interesting as have acknowledged before am not wonderful judge of acting but liked the performances from roache and elliot roache successfully conveyed his characters ambivalence toward millie near the end he hugs her at first staring into space as if he is thinking about his plan kate then giving that up fully embrace millie millies part did not require as much range but elliot gave her the necessary bubbly personality that made her irresistible will probably file away the wings of the dove in the same lowtraffic corner of my mind as sense and sensibility and persuasion their settings are far removed from my personal experience geographically historically and socially still the movies are well made and the stories inevitably win me over

earlier this year the movie holy man opened meager box office receipt and indifference from audiences and critics real charmer of movie it is possible that the subject matter was too hip or trendy attract any real audience now at the end of comes waking ned devine comedy inspires the same vein of easygoing laughter there is no substantial difference between the two other than more refined atmosphere they strike all the same chords but still ned devine is movie worth seeing the plot is interesting and robust the latest lottery winner is ned devine jimmy keogh of tullymore ireland neds prize is over six million pounds but the shock of winning killed the poor old man and the check remains unclaimed enter jackie oshea ian bannen and michael osullivan david kelly the only two residents who are aware the winner is in their village the two men eventually find the ticket and decide that if michael can convince the lotto authorities that he is actually ned the entire town can reap the benefits their only adversary is an ancient old woman eileen dromey who sees more profit in reporting the fraud ian bannen and david kelly truly shine as jackie and michael jackie stocky and large is the brains behind the operation michael scrawny and short is the method man the two contrast each other delightfully and at the same time remain sympathetic the audience every viewer is sure like both of them there are other minor subplots included as well such as an unlikely romance between local girl and the town pig farmer this appears quite inconsequential until the end and even startling revelation it is tad bit unnecessary overall waking ned devine has predictable outcome and plot twists are never really taken seriously the ending very hilarious and very ironic twist of fate somehow fits the twisted sense of humor the movie exhibits throughout the kirk jones script is indeed offthecuff in way waking ned devine is exactly like the class of people it presents warm friendly outgoing and jovial it is the perfect kind of comedy real gem of tale that sets up trivial plot outline introduce sympathetic cast of characters and string of jokes there is nothing remotely serious or grounded for more than moment or two because the spirit of ned devine is lighthearted one indeed it is one of the years best feelgood movies minutes of unrestrained joy that no one should miss

susan grangers review of the perfect storm warner bros more people die on fishing boats per capita than working in any other job in the s every journey fishing boat makes can be an allornothing risk it is life at its most exhilarating and its most terrifying says director wolfgang petersen das boot and that is just what he captures in this true story of struggle and humanity aboard swordfishing boat the andrea gail sailing out of gloucester massachusetts in late october early in bill wittliffs screenplay based on sebastian jungers bestseller we meet the crew of six the veteran captain george clooney is frustrated because he cannot find fish on the grand banks yet rival skipper mary elizabeth mastrantonio brings in huge hauls his righthand man mark walhberg needs money build new life his girlfriend diane lane there is devoted dad john reilly an estranged wife and son freespirited jamaican allen payne lonely guy john hawkes and lastminute replacement bad attitude william fichtner the skippers convinced he can change his bad luck streak in remote flemish cap and he does but then trouble begins there is rogue wave man overboard and the ice machine breaks lb of fish that could spoil but that is minor compared deadly monster storm approaching boston meteorologist describes as disaster of epic proportions that also threatens the lives of coast guard helicopter rescue team trying save three people stranded on sailboat on the high seas it is formulaic and there are cliches but the walls of water created fluid dynamics simulating reallife phenomena are awesome on the granger movie gauge of the perfect storm is terrifying suspenseful hang on for the whiteknuckle thrill ride of the summer

just in time for halloween and christmas the reissue of the nightmare before christmas could not be more appropriate all of the attention thrown family films in recent years namely those starring pocket monsters and nickelodeon characters it is high time we raised the intellectual level of childrens fare as well as the animation achievements of the movie studios that in mind it was refreshing revisit an animation classic on the big screen that still retains the originality and freshness it had seven years ago nightmare is the story of one mans quest discover his true purpose in life look beyond the accolades of his peers the achievements of his years and the praise of his ego jack skellington the pumpkin king of halloweentown is the main dude behind the halloween holiday for kids everywhere but during his reign as pumpkin king jack has somehow lost his understanding of his place in the world and the magic he creates his halloween holiday after the completion of one particular halloween season jack walks heavy heart and ends up discovering in the woods outside halloweentown grove of trees doors all of the other holidays in the world imagine his surprise discover christmastown far more impressive and uplifting holiday than halloween surrounded happy elves making toys and good cheer all around upon his return halloweentown jack decides combine halloween and christmas together kidnapping sandy claws employing all the residents of halloweentown build toys for children he then aims take over the role as primary joyprovider and giftbearer the children of the world in the hopes of rediscovering the zest for life he once had alas the comingling of halloween and christmas creates disastrous results involving shrunken heads psychotic wooden ducks sleigh pulled phantom dog lighted nose and large sinister singing bag named oogie boogie tim burton the man behind such great films as ed wood beetlejuice peewees big adventure and edward scissorhands is the creative force behind nightmare originally burton authored poem that became the basis of the storyline and he was jointly involved in the production design of the though many mistakenly assume he directed the picture the stamp of burton is clearly everywhere in the bold colors imaginative character design and it is simple yet compelling story the direction of harry selick who also directed james and the giant peach is strong offering intimate views of the strange collection of characters also memorable are the songs in the written former oingo boingo lead singer danny elfman the next john williams of composing the nightmare before christmas is intended for both the kid and adult in everyone it is not just childs play for the holidays it is movie about how be truly happy in tough world saying that all you need do is just be exactly who you are without compromise what better message is there for christmas

every once in while movie comes along that completely redefines the genre dramas it was citizen kane arthouse it was pulp fiction and comedy it was well that jim carrey guy okay so he is not movie but he did have huge influence on the genre not mention an expensive one sometimes movie even combines them all into big sprawling motion picture event as did forrest gump four years ago action films it was aliens whic was released much hype seven years after it is equallyinnovative parent alien directed and written james cameron judgement day the abyss true lies the authority on action films it was masterful encore his scifi thriller the terminator while the original alien was dark enclosed horror that featured one alien slowly massacering horrified crew james cameron took the bigbudget action aliens featured multiple aliens doing basically the same thing although on muchlarger scale and boy did he take that route would say at about mph or so the opens years after the original lt ripley weaver being found in her ship in cryogenic state salvage vessel if you will recall at the end of alien ripley the only surviving member cryogenically hibernated herself after expelling the rogue alien from her ship unfortunately she thought she would only be out for couple of weeks once she is returned earth ripley is quickly interrogated the company who quickly dismiss her and her stories as lunacy in truth they believe her as they soon approach ripley an offer travel some marines new colony planet as an alien advisor it seems that the colony planet was oncebreeding ground for the nasty aliens and now all communication the planet has been lost it does not exactly take genius guess what happens next ripley agrees and before you can say big mistake she and the half dozen marines plus the slimy corporate guy reiser who has more than it looks like up under his sleeve are off the colony when they arrive they find the planet in ruins only one survivor is found little girl newt who confirms that yes the aliens were here and that she only managed survive hidding in the ventilation system and soon enough the marines come under attack from the aliens what happens for the next hour and half or so is what completely sets this movie apart from any other standard alien scifi movie the action scenes cameron directs them so skillfully and so suspensefully that you are literally ringing your hands the time the finale rolls around features in my opinion the best fight scene ever recorded on as ripley straps herself into huge robot and battles the nasty queen alien the death many people will tell you that this while being great action has no real drama and is all cliches well they would be wrong my friends if this had no drama then why was sigourney weaver nominated for best actress at the academy awards that is right best actress you know that any action that has an oscar nomination attached it for something other than technical stuff like editing and fx has got be good in short aliens combines all the right elements great action and fx drama good plot good dialogue and great villains into what could arguably be called the best action of all time then again maybe not movies rise and fall from glory and sad say aliens was wrestled from it is throne of best action movie another cameron judgement day in so who will be the next king well let us wait until december th and see yet another james cameron filmthe highest budgeted of all timetitanic make that decision cannot wait

in brian singer and christopher mcquarrie dreamed up simple concept the audience is not stupid from that they went on and created the most plotdriven intricately pieced movie in the last years the result the usual suspects one hell of movie that redefines the word plot twist the story is convoluted and is really confusing read although easy follow on screen special investigator kujan chazz palminteri grills verbal kint kevin spacey crippled conman who is the lone survivor of an la boat explosion that claimed more than victims kujan wants confirm that his nemesis the rogue cop keaton gabriel byrne is actually dead kint relates the majority of the in flashback beginning the fateful day when five shifty guys meet in policestation lineup in new york city along dour keaton kint encounters cheerfully sociopathic mcmanus stephen baldwin mordantly sarcastic hockney kevin pollak and fenster benicio del toro whose speech is virtually incomprehensible together they plot steal small fortune in gems from new yorks finest taxi service crooked cops who provide escort service for visiting drug kingpins what follows is shellgame of violence and betrayal all hinging on the identity of mysterious villain called keyser soze the is brilliantly compact its the shortest minutes you will ever spend in movie theater the cast is exceptional palminteri shines he is brutally honest true cop one who is going after the whole story because its there byrne is terrific his brooding character his seriousness is needed supplement the hysteria of benicio del toro who is riot as fenster del toro is brilliant his lines are jumbled mess you cannot understand word the man says but it sure is damn funny baldwin is also very good he is careful methodical and cold chilling character nasty streak of hotblooded sarcasm pollak is also terrific as usual very good character actor however this will be forever known as the that launched kevin spacey spacey is simply breathtaking he is force on screen giving magnetic performance that jars the senses at the end of this twisting maze spaceys performance will be remembered for years for it is the best of his career it may be the best supporting actor performance in the last years verbal kint is clever storyteller weak oppressed and gleefully evil the bone yet pitiful one who draws sympathy the is good one decent until the last minutes what this boils down is the greatest ending in cinematic history for me at least the revelation of keyser soze the closing gunfights it is something wondrous you have see this movie about times believe what they do kudos mcquarrie and singer for giving the audience delightful fastpaced furiously plotdriven movie quirky characters phenomenal acting and some hilarious moments stuck in the middle mcquarrie refuses believe the audience is dumb without furnishing too many details he concocts his story and lets it run hoping the audience gets it at the end we do this might just be the finest cinematic puzzle ever created kudos also singer and john ottman who created the score they both create what is true filmnoir setting carefully setting up this intricate puzzle until the final jarring ending there are flaws more questions raised than answers lack of character development and no strong female characters save one however the plot and that stunning ending make up for all the flaws and more if you have not seen the movie rent it watch it then rewind the tape and watch it again trust me you will be amazed

it has happened again movie that is well scripted well acted and well directed it is involving suspenseful it even has an unexpected twist at the end that packs punch like blow the solar plexus but in order accept its premise one must also accept spiritual lie the sixth sense is that movie starring bruce willis armageddon as child psychologist and haley joel osment forrest gump as troubled youngster the sixth sense is more spooky than scary though it does contain disturbing images designed startle eightyearold cole sear osment sees dead people not just in dreams and not just as lifeless bodies he sees them walking around like regular people and he sees them all the time dr malcolm crowe willis is trying help him he recognizes in cole many of the same attributes as one of his earlier patients whom crowe failed resulting in that patient shooting crowe before turning the gun on himself if crowe could manage find way help cole he believes he just might be able put his own demons rest but first he needs gain coles trust the boy is so frightened what he sees he has closed himself off emotionally being unwilling tell anyone not crowe not even his own mother toni collette clockwatchers about his secrets crowe begins spend more and more time him even as his own marriage starts dissolve around him his wife anna olivia williams rushmore becoming cold and distant because of his neglect of her and his preoccupation the boy bruce willis underplays his role allowing the excellent script do most of the work of building character development crowe moves from treating troubled boy who will not communicate treating troubled boy who is having hallucinations wondering if perhaps there is not some truth behind what the boy sees mr willis does serviceable job letting the focus remain on the story instead of on his familiar action hero screen persona elevenyearold haley joel osment manages impress us his performance he demonstrates an amazing amount of selfcomposure as well as an ability play nuances in complex character as if he were seasoned pro it is fine work for one of such tender age keep your eye on this young man the supporting cast is also quite effective toni collette as the confused frightened and frustrated mother who cannot understand what is happening her child olivia williams as crowes once loving wife who is shutting down emotionally due the lack of attention from her husband and donnie wahlberg ransom as crowes expatient now grown who illustrates his doctors failure help him in the most vivid terms imaginable twentyeight year old night shyamalan wide awake directed his own script maintaining proper tension throughout the and crafting the storytelling so expertly that the films full impact is not reached until its final moments when surprising revelation forces reevaluation of all that preceded it it is rare movie manages pull that off and mr shyamalan as the one responsible is certainly be commended in giving the sixth sense favorable three star review for its craftsmanship and artistic merit must also point out that spiritually speaking the is highly misleading there is no scriptural foundation upon base belief in ghosts or the living dead the concept of death being doorway another plane of existence is devilish lie that has been around as long as man himself the first lie recorded in the bible was devised the serpent who assured eve thou shall not surely die direct contradiction of gods admonition that same lie has been perpetuated ad infinitum throughout the ages scriptures do speak of time when the dead shall rise but that wonderful demonstration of victory over death will not commence until after the second coming of christ an event has not yet occurred therefore the dead remain in state of oblivion having no consciousness until that longawaited time when the final trump shall sound and then you will need six senses register all the joy and rejoicing that will resound throughout the heavens

in the grand scheme of mel gibson movies payback was better than conspiracy theory but not as good as braveheart or lethal weapon in other words it is decent couple of hours of entertainment but years from now if they compile list of mel gibsons greatest hits payback probably will not be on it gibson plays crook who gets double crossed his partner after they heist payroll mels partner needed the money pay off mob debt so he puts couple of bullets in mel leaving him for dead and goes on pay off his creditors but mel is not dead it would be real short movie if he was and he certainly is not happy make matters worse he wants his money back and is willing go any lengths accomplish this feat his ex partner has already used it pay off the mobsters so mel goes after the mob get it back payback is often very violent its credit there are few scenes that could have been very graphic but the director am not sure one more about that in second made the choice let the audience use their imagination instead of subjecting us the usual gratuitous gore found in many films the appears bit disjointed in places is understandable considering producer star gibson was not thrilled how the turned out and wanted parts of it reshot when the director refused another one was brought in do the reshoot so as result while the final product is apparently better than the original although personally would love see the original version for comparisons sake it does get bit of choppy feel it towards the end it is always tough make where the main character is villain unless that person has some redeeming qualities in this case gibsons character has few redeeming qualities but hey its mel so even when he is killing people in cold blood we are still rooting for him my guess is that if that you put some other johnny bananas actor in this role the audience would not be quite as responsive gibson is gibson whether he is playing suicidal cop or stone cold killer he does good job he almost guarantees that no matter what else happens in the rest of the movie at least the audience is going get one good performance this time out mel is surrounded good supporting cast including maria bello as his love interest william devane and kris kristofferson as mod bosses the man who steals the show and unfortunately does not have real big part is james coburn as yet another mobster if had one big disappointment in this it would be that coburn did not have bigger role in the end payback is fairly solid action thriller just not in quite the same league as some of mel gibsons other work

the thoughtprovoking question of tradition over morals is the subject directly at the core of leila powerfully articulated and subtle drama from famous iranian director dariush mehrjui that is his first motion picture in prosperous thirtyyear career gain s distribution thanks first run features although unfamiliar mehrjuis previous directing efforts perhaps the reason for this is that while the predicament at hand is no doubt exclusive its own country the heartbreaking and solely truthful emotions of the characters can easily be understood all viewers set in modernday iran leila begins on the birthday of the title character leila hatami after brief prologue in we are shown the first encounter between leila and her future husband reza ali mosaffa as leila and reza set off visit his parents and then hers where birthday celebration has been planned things seem rosy for the couple on the outside but for leila life is not quite as sweet earlier on that very same day leila had gone see her physician and has ultimately discovered that she holds very little chance of ever conceiving child when all of the conditions are ruled out and leila passes up the possibility of adoption reza firmly and lovingly tells her that he married her and does not care at all about having children nonetheless leila is ashamed that she will never be able give him baby is the societal norm and her selfesteem is not helped at all her domineering motherinlaw jamileh sheikhi whose hopes carry on the sacred family name vanishes once hearing the news reza is her only son bluntly explaining leila that reza has always wished for children and in country where polygamy is an accepted tradition she suggests that he take second wife bear child leila hesitantly agrees and while she and reza are able shallowly laugh afterwards about the hopeful womens inadequacies reza finally does meet woman whom he claims like even though he refuses go through the marriage if leila does not give her full blessing there are no easy answers be found within leila that thoughtfully examines the central characters unfortunate plight as well as the inner workings of leila herself told through matteroffact narration almost completely taken over her own shame she has no option but agree her forceful motherinlaws requests even though she is unsure of how she will react if reza really does end up marrying another woman maybe because leila is from iran the will unquestionably be shocking for american audiences since the concept of polygamy is looked upon the characters as more or less everyday occurrence leila however is unable come terms the idea quite as easily but feels it is her duty make her husband happy no matter what the circumstances one of the strongest aspects of the is in its portrayal of the relationship between leila and reza who married only three months after their first meeting but obviously love each other very deeply it is this relationship that is the key ingredient making what follows the opening scenes all the more powerful and director mehrjui has succeeded just about as well as possible although seemingly unimportant at first glance an early sequence where leila and reza are eating dinner and both are laughing nearly uncontrollably actually is one of the most vital moments in the first half as it unmistakably sets the boundary for their unrequisite love for one another ditto for another scene in reza gives leila large stuffed animal for her birthday and then reveals beautiful necklace he has also gotten her these small moments are the perfect contrast for the solemn outraging sequences in the latter half in reza drops leila off at the side of busy road and then zooms off go on date another woman left there ponder her quickly diminishing marriage foolishly unbeknownst reza leila prays each time that the date will not go well so she will be able keep her husband herself for little while longer refusing stay over at her parents house the inevitably leads up the second wedding night between reza and another woman and in sequence of extraordinary sorrow and potency leila finds her whole being emotionally torn apart as she is closed up in an upstairs bedroom as the marriage proceedings are going on down below despite her initial agreement such thing leila realizes how much she has been betrayed reza whom she believed cared for her as much as she did of him sure the whole second marriage was his mothers idea but if he really did believe what he initially had told her about not wanting any children then he could have still easily backed out could not he in the pivotal role of leila who appears in every scene leila hatami is nothing short of remarkable injecting her character an equal measure of startling strength unavoidable vulnerability and utter despair unlike most american films in everything always has be spelled out for audiences hatami says much more just an elusive expression on her face than could possibly have been conveyed words every bit perfect match for hatami is ali mosaffa as reza man who believe does hold an unbreakable bond his wife but is too naive realize what he will be doing leila if he marries someone else for all of its strong aspects leila is not perfect on technical level found many blatant punctiation and spelling mistakes within the subtitles that need be fixed and concerning the plot developments the final five minutes ring false when compared everything that has come before mehrjuis decision use an extremely stylized approach the ending was the wrong choice particularly in his almost comedic way of wrapping up the character of the spiteful motherinlaw played memorably jamileh sheikhi despite these minor missteps leila is an important motion picture that should definately be sought out upon its limited may release at new yorks cinema village and then on may in la the thoughtprovoking questions that the deals is balanced evenly its uneasy morales and when the climax arrives leilas selfworth is startlingly stripped away reveal victim led into complete devastation there is no return it is difficult not consider how leilas culminating interior demise could have been so simply avoided had the other characters taken second out of their own selfish lives consider what leila the major pawn in the unforgivable scheme was going through

barely scrapping playing at nyc piano bar timothy hutton returns his massachusetts hometown for couple of weeks on the surface he is coming home for high school reunion but since this is movie you know that he is really looking for some major life decisions fairly small this sports an impressive ensemble cast including uma thurman rosie odonnell and bunch of actors that you have seen before but cannot quite place commendable jobs all around they seem like real people hutton arrives at his past and is greeted his spiritdead father terminally goony brother and old high school chums all of his old buddies are engaged in the snow removal business and most are in the midst of relationship crisis the perfect stuff for comedy about people in the twenties angst he meets and falls for the new next door neighbor beautiful intelligent lively girl who is obviously taken him the problem is that she is only unconsummated no it is not _that_ type of movie their relationship builds and neither knows what do it starcrossed lovers no where go so hutton is gaga over barelyteen one of his buddies is twotiming his girlfriend married old flame anothers girlfriend is sleeping meat cutter and she is vegetarian things are mess enter uma thurman the beautiful stranger in town for few days is both delight in the and one of its minor downfalls her character is fun watch even more entertaining is observing the guys falling over themselves trying impress her like the lone ranger before she leaves she solves most of the problems and sets everyone onward their lives the ending is bit too pat everything is tied up neat little bow rosie odonnell is standout in her limited screen time her brash personality and tell it like it is pronouncements structured somewhat like diner few years later this feelgood story is good time but ends little too nice

it is an interesting premise our reality is only real us because it is what we perceive be real in truth our entire existences are lived out in our minds as we are fed information through electronic inputs directly our brains what we see what we do everything around us is nothing more than computergenerated construct interlinked the minds of others through vastly powerful artificial intelligence our bodies severely atrophied are kept alive for the sole purpose of generating heat and electrical energy for dominating order of machines control the planet the scifi realm has been waiting little while for something new come along the matrix is not it the idea of war between man and sentient computer network sham world the ability plug ones brain into computer has all been gleaned from such sources as the terminator dark city and few star trek episodes both classic and next generation what is new is the ability weave all of these various elements together and succeed in producing that is both entertaining as well as thoughtprovoking keanu reeves plays computer whiz nicknamed neo who is plucked out of the artificial world known as the matrix group of renegade humans who are clandestinely fighting expose the fallacy of the computergenerated existence and free humankind from the oppression of the machines the groups leader morpheus laurence fishburne has chosen neo because he believes neo is the one who is destined lead the attack against the artificial intelligence from the beginning of the we are kept on our toes trying figure things out this in lesser movie would be annoying but the matrix presents itself in an intelligent manner makes the puzzle rather interesting and even fun what is reality what is sham the turns our very perception of life on its side more than once we are also presented the question of whether we would rather know the harsh truth of reality or live life of relative bliss oblivious the true nature of our surroundings as viewers this is intriguing enough so imagine what it would be like for neo and who better play bewildered person than keanu reeves reeves whom have never really cared for as an actor is competent in roles require lot of straightforwardness and little subtlety he was good in speed for example but laughably poor in walk in the clouds neo is actually one of those roles reeves slips into rather nicely so much of my expectation was happily for naught in couple of places the script even capitalizes upon his wooden nature and this is heavy credit writersdirectors andy and larry wachowski mean since bill and teds excellent adventure what movie could you say really utilized keanu reeves more interesting than reeves is fishburne who is morpheus nearly runs the gamut of emotions and convincingly so very surprising for scifi movie fishburne also maintains certain demeanor about himself throughout as if he always knows what expect this helps further the aura of his characters proficiency and extensive knowledge hugo weaving as agent smith one of the artificial intelligences antiintruder programs is also good playing his deadpan nononsense kick ass role requires him show emotion at the appropriate time unfortunately when weaving speaks for more than few sentences in row the nature of his characters speech pattern becomes little more laughable than impressive carrieanne moss plays trinity morpheuss number one assistant who becomes somewhat of love interest for neo although her character is somewhat inconsistent moss nevertheless delivers an above par performance when fishburne is not in the picture there were few expenses spared when it comes the special effects many methods of imagery are employed from modeling bluescreen computer graphics of special note is the use of the freeze and turn effect where the entire scene is frozen turned then continued from new angle this is accomplished using large number of still cameras employed in semicircle motion picture cameras placed at the two ends the motion cameras the action and at the appropriate moment all the still cameras fire at once place each still image in sequence and you get nearly seamless transition from the first motion camera the second pretty slick the matrix drips style from the clothing the music the action we are watching an exaggerated version of what we are used much of it seems like the combination of two genres of the hong kong action there is lot of kung fu there is lot of gunplay when character is letting go an automatic weapon much is made of the empty cartridges falling the floor in slow motion there is also the element of the japanese action cartoon called anime aficionados especially in the way the sequences are filmed in sweeping pans and emphasized actions through special effects combined it is really like no liveaction have ever seen the is not without its faults some of the scenes and ideas are borrowed little too liberally from other films and one component of the ending is decidedly disappointing some of the lines are also pretty bad in one instance supporting character incorrectly delivers famous saying and it was not meant be joke however these shortcomings detract little from what is an overall solid action scifi that for once does more than merely entertain

one of kyle mclachlans earlier cinematic features this movie has had an obvious influence on such films as the terminator species and the more recent fallen denzel washington plot sciencefiction picture set in modern times this thriller follows the exploits of an entity from outer space who likes inhabit human bodies use them up until they are completely worn out and then switch over the next available receptacle fbi agent mclachlan and local top cop nouri are charged the capture of this thing before it is too late critique this fastpaced urban equivalent of the thing checks in on all cylinders for ultraviolence god knows how many people died in this movie action and an overall rock roll attitude then again how can you go wrong an alien that likes the ferraris guns heavy metal music and sexy girls granted the plot is not the most elaborate of tales alien bad find alien kill alien but can honestly say that was never once bored during the viewing of this entire picture would not recommend it those who do not like car chases murders and bland acting but for all the rest of you out there those who enjoy putting away their brains every now and again sitting back slamming back some salsad nachos and relishing in the cheeze some call have blast two scenes watch for are both within the first ten minutes of this gorefest the opening sequence is one of the most rockin scenes open any action movie and the subsequent extraterrestrial transformation is another eyecatcher even the late special effects were okay followed the hidden ii in little known facts this was kyle maclachlans first nondavid lynch foray into the world of feature films his first two movie appearances were in lynchs wretched dune and the sensational blue velvet

i want correct what wrote in former retrospective of david leans war picture still think that it does not deserve being the number in the american institutes list of the greatest american movies and think that lumets angry men wilders witness for the prosecution and kubricks paths of glory would have been better choices for the best picture oscar in but cannot deny the importance of the bridge on the river kwai cinematically and in its contents the is set in burma in bataillon of british soldiers in japanese war captivity is forced the japanese build strategically momentous railway bridge over the river kwai but the british commanding officer colonel nicholson alec guinness insists corresponding the geneva conventions that his officers need not work as simple workmen struggling toughly col nicholson forces the japanese commandant col saito sessue hayakawa give way in this respect afterwards col nicholson assiduously commits himself for the building of the bridge he considers it an opportunity raise his mens morale and he wants prove superior british capabilities the japanese but the british high command sends few soldiers who shall destroy the bridge among them the american shears william holden an escapee from the japanese prison camp and the british major warden jack hawkins flaw of the picture is the clich characterization of the japanese people they are presented as if they were intellectually inferior the british as if the japanese were incapable of building bridge and the does not consistently question the military spirit as kubrick does in paths of glory lean seems rather fascinated the military hierarchies this is also perceptible in the conversations between col nicholson and col saito in this regard it is symptomatic that shears who doubts the military logic is somehow unpleasant person in the the audience is supposed applaud col nicholsons perseverance concerning the question if his officers shall work on the bridge or not the spectators are supposed neglect the risks col nicholson takes for his men the plot bypasses these risks that means the picture is not perfect but it has lot of virtues as well it shows the madness of war and what war can produce in peoples minds it shows how col nicholson becomes possessed the idea of being hero and that others like shears get cynics and the bridge on the river kwai is an interesting study of characters clashing interests these points and the sometimes ironic dialogue make this an antiwar despite the inconsistencies in the treatment of this theme david leans effective and atmospherically perfect direction creates high suspense especially in the dramatic though not wholly plausible showdown alec guinness does magnificent job of bringing col nicholson life and making him such an interesting character the other actors deliver very good performances as well jack hildyards fine color cinematography and the apt score are also helpful like this extraordinary despite its weaknesses karl rackwitz klein ris germany

of the major horror subgenres vampire movies are easily the most adaptable think about it frankenstein movies have not changed all that much because they still need that madscientistinbavariancastle setting if you made frankenstein movie today you would have have the monster be virus or something and outside of michael fox there are not any actors that could play virus convincingly movies about mummies would still have be set in egypt there is not much you can do werewolves except take them london or paris unless you want have teenage werewolf or something and there is that michael fox thing again but you can have vampires do anything and you can place them in any genre you want just about you can have traditional vampire movies bram stokers dracula or have the anne rice version interview the vampire or play it for laughs vampire in brooklyn you can put vampires in locales from sunny southern california the lost boys squalid mexican dives from dusk till dawn your local high school buffy the vampire slayer were it not redundant you could have movie about law firm full of vampires any day now expect we will see movie about vampire third baseman who has decide whether play day game in order break the home run record or you can insert the vampire legend into hong kong action movie and when you do that you get blade wesley snipes has the chow yun fat role in this movie the silent expressionless hit man who destroys everything in his path in this case the everything happens be vampires that explode into cgi shards instead of dead bleeding corpses snipes has less say here than as the fugitive in s marshals but does demonstrably better job here as halfvampire wreaking vengeance on the bloodsuckers blade is silent brooding presence laying waste vampires without shred of remorse he is as cold as his silverbladed sword as single minded as his garlicfilled bullets yet he is not without quirks blade drives battered muscle car and has glean rolex watches from his vampire victims in order stay solvent like any good hong kong movie blade is heavy on the chopsocky action for some reason blade spends lot more time using his kung fu artistry than using the traditional antivampire weapons of garlic and silver blade dismisses manportable arc lamp as being too heavy although it looks be more efficient tool dispatch vampires unfortunately the guiding hand of john woo is absent from this relegating blade the status of the replacement killers it most strongly resembles the replacement killers is the last movie saw that did not review mostly because it made no impression on me and could not remember anything other than noise violence and the intensity of fats performance blade has little more going for it and has the vampire myth draw from but other than that it is the same kind of movie exciting well choreographed action scenes but no resonance stronger villain stephen dorff is pardon the pun curiously bloodless as the head vampire leaving us wonder what denis leary might have done the role wittier script and strong supporting cast blade might have been able rise beyond the level of commonplace summer entertainment as it is blade is an average action movie that serves do nothing but remind us that the summer movies just keep getting dumber and the vampire movies just keep multiplying

when quentin tarantino made pulp fiction he was not only making the greatest of the he was also making what believe be the most influential movie of all time but before you send me hatemail for not giving that title citizen kane hear me out much like citizen kane pulp fiction has changed movie making forever but think the latter has had tad more impact pulp fiction has actually ushered in new era of making it has altered the way films will be viewed fiction has spawned so many imitations have lost count sure some have been excellent bound and the usual suspects spring immediately mind but any serious moviegoer recognizes pulp fiction as the original neonoir of the in this review hope change all the peoples minds who have criticized it for it is excessive profanity and violence the way is not really that graphic the most brilliant aspect of tarantinos masterpiece is the screenplay it is filled so much classic dialogue the quarter pounder cheese speech will go down in history it should be required reading for any student if it is not already the story told in unorthodox nonlinear format centers around three main episodes all of eventually intertwine the first titled vincent vega and marcellus wallaces wife deals very loaded john travolta forgot mention the cool heroin shootup sequence taking mia wallace starmaking performance uma thurman his bosses wife out on date cool restaurant called jack rabbit slims they talk for while the occasional uncomfortable silence mostly about guy called tony rocky horror after giving marcellus new bride foot massage he was thrown off building and into greenhouse giving him speech impediment they also partake in cool dance contest and end up twisting the chuck berry classic you never can tell will not reveal the rest of the story but will definitely say that it turns out be real bummer of night despite the cool trophy they win the second story the least of the three but still four stars stars bruce willis proving he can play someone other than john mcclain in the die hard flicks as boxer butch coolidge previously in the like said it is told in nonlinear form he had made deal marcellus wallace that he would take fall in match as it turns out he not only does not take the fall but he ends up actually killing his opponent he takes cab his halfwitted girlfriends apartment and make long story short ends up going back his own place retrieve gold watch sort of family heirloom explained christopher walken in hilarious flashback sequence on his way home he bumps into literally marcellus the two winde up prisoner two hillbilly sex murderers results in the infamous gimp scene is very reminicent of the squeal like pig scene from deliverance the last and best in my opinion of the episodes features john travolta again and samuel jackson in the best performance of any supporting actor ever as two slightly offkilter hitmen trying rid themselves of bloody car they seek help friend of jacksons played the qman himself there is some movies enjoy even though know probably should not and have difficult time trying explain why did lucky numbers is perfect example of this because it is such blatant ripoff of fargo and every movie based on an elmore leonard novel and yet it somehow still works for me know am in the minority here but let me explain the takes place in harrisburg pa in during an unseasonably warm winter john travolta plays the local bigshot tv weatherman who is idolized the townsfolk as if he were john travolta himself and not the bumbling russ richards russ is married crystal lisa kudrow blonde bimbo if ever there was one in the history of cinema she is selfish nasty bitch full of lust and desire but somehow she got the job of the lottery ball girl not exactly the most intellectually taxing job on the market crystals cheating on russ their collective boss dick ed oneil the tv station manager she does not seem genuinely like either of them but it is all she can do in this onehorse town much like fargo this movie tells the story of man who is going broke and has pull off huge scam get rich quick he enlists the help of his english friend gig tim roth the local stripclub owner who tells him how fix the lottery along the way subplot involving twobit thug named accurately dale the thug michael rappaport gets mixed up in the process there is also bookie that somehow gets thrown in the mix once the deal goes down am not going elaborate much further on the plot and story because it continues unwind and take twists and turns you are not expecting this is farce is basically straightforward adultoriented comedy but does not go as far as classic black comedy should where as fargo was sometimes shocking and disturbing while being funny lucky numbers is just funny because you cannot take these characters in these outrageous situations seriously it is all big cartoon basically but it is funny and can respect that travolta is great in his role and even though he is not really likable character he is trying be nice guy despite the fact he is creep he is like gangster morals who genuinely feels sorry for the guys he has kill crystal is just the opposite she is constantly arguing and using whatever brain cells she has left look out for herself kudrow is perfect in this role since she is spent years on tv as the dimwitted phoebe on friends here is character is basically very evil incarnation of phoebe have admit was honestly surprised and pleased how the plot unraveled and the methods each of the main characters use try get their share of the money like jackie brown an elmore leonard adaption the story is about circle of characters all after the lottery money that has been won illegally the screenplay does fine job in balancing the characters and slowly revealing their motivations and hidden agendas while at the same time keep russ richards the main focus more and more characters are introduced and since the has such an iconic cartoony atmosphere you can take on faith just what makes the minor characters do what they do the ending itself is great it is surprising and funny and makes you feel good you realize this has packed in about different movies worth of stories into two hours time and did not fall apart although many other critics might beg differ liked it and could see it again is not that what makes movie good

this summer one of the most racially charged novels in john grishams series time kill was made into major motion picture on january of this year director rob reiner basically rereleased the under the title of ghosts of mississippi based on the true story of civil rights leader medgar evars assassination ghosts of mississippi revolves around the year legal battle faced myrlie evars whoopi goldberg sister act and her quest have her husbands obvious assassin and racist byron de la beckwith james woods casino jailed so she turns assistant district attorney and prosecutor bobby delaughter alec baldwin heavens prisoners imprison the former kkk member ghosts sets its tone an opening montage of images from africanamerican history from slaveship miseries life in the racist south of the but all too soon the white folks take over intoning lines like what is america got do anything this is mississippi as beckwith james woods his head larded latex most of the time as an old man teeters between portraying evil and its character meanwhile goldberg turns in very serious and weepy performance as the wife who would not let her husbands death rest until she got the conviction both deserve serious oscarconsideration this brings us the dull performance of baldwin let us face it trying match matthew mcconaugheys wonderful acting in time kill is basically impossible and baldwin is living proof of this as no emotions could be felt it seemed as if he actually had struggle shed single tear either poor acting or poor directing but something definitely went wrong another strange mishap was the fact that goldbergs facial features did not change as she looked the same in the courtroom as she did holding her husbands dead body years earlier yet woods was plastered enough make up make him look like goldbergs father at least the makeup was realistic some emotional moments in the poorly written script ghosts of mississippi lacked in heart when its predecessor time kill brought tears everyones eyes do not get me wrong the movie was not all that bad but if you have seen grishams masterpiece then do not expect this one be an excellent

towards the middle of the sweet hereafter crowded school bus skids on an icy road surface as it rounds bend careens through the steel guard rail and disappears out of sight then in long shot we see the vehicle slowly sliding across what looks like snowcovered field it pauses for moment before the field cracks under the bus weight and the bright yellow vehicle vanishes in an effortless moment single smooth second of time compare that scene if you will the last eighty minutes of titanic when the behemoth sinks slowly and spectacularly its watery demise and you will appreciate the futility of comparing greatness in films the scene in the sweet hereafter epitomizes all that is right independent canadian director atom egoyans it is not sensational we do not see the inside of the bus its payload of screaming terrified children being bloodied and battered about the bus does not explode or break into thousand tiny pieces it simply leaves the road and silently slips beneath the surface of frozen lake it is horrifying sequence made all the more so calm and distance using nonlinear approach his narrative egoyan shifts back and forward in time connecting us the inhabitants of the small british columbian town who have been severely affected this tragedy fourteen children died in the accident leaving their parents and the town itself paralyzed grief the catalyst at the center of the is ambulance chaser mitchell stephens wonderfully moving performance ian holm who comes sam dent persuade the townsfolk engage in class action suit stephens who does not believe in accidents functions as concerned involved observer scribbling details in his notebook and providing the parents an opportunity reach some kind of closure in the harrowing aftermath while stephens initial drive may be financial one third of the total settlement if he wins his involvement provides him more an outlet come grips his own loss his selfdestructive drugaddicted daughter has been in and out of clinics halfway houses and detox units for years egoyans attention detail and ability establish mood are so impeccable that even the sound of kettle boiling resonates like plaintive cry mychael danna who composed the shimmering music for the ice storm contributes another memorable score that shivers and tingles equally impressive is paul sarossys cinematography capturing the imposing canadian mountainsides and lowhanging fogs as splendidly as his shadowy interiorsin one scene bright wall calendar serves illuminate portions of room the sweet hereafter while undeniably grim urges the viewer grab onto life both hands and not let go it is of generous subtlety and emotion
